story:
PROJECT CLOSED - PLEASE DO NOT FUND THIS CAMPAIGN.

rababa.fm

Our names are Yasmin & Mo Khalaf, we are living in Amman, Jordan. We both have been in love with radio and music ever since we can remember, in fact, one of the best things we have in common is music. Join us in creating something special, as we share our story about how we aim to redefine your radio listening experience.

We started working on our online radio station (www.rababa.fm) since 2013, We have invested so much effort and money to the point where we couldn't do it on our own anymore, and our dream was to expand our idea, that's when a friend of ours suggested Indiegogo.

rababa.fm is made FOR people like you and me, we stream songs with profound meanings, songs that relate to our daily lives, songs that make us happy, simply great songs!

We are your go to radio station when you feel you need that motivation, positiveness and uplifting. We are live 24/7, you can listen to our English songs all day long from our website www.rababa.fm, and soon from our App for iOS and Android.

To us, most radio stations operate the same, talk shows that don't interest the majority, filled with commercials and just playing new music, well we want to offer you a better radio experience, because people are forgetting how fun and amazing radio stations are, we will also be offering other services such as retail radio services and commercials production for startups and small businesses.

Our dream is to expand to the new radio experience and services mentioned earlier,We are now trying to raise $12500 to open an office, to setup a team and get some bright minded individuals to work with me to get my idea come true. The most important thing for us is to redefine radio broadcasting, and offer the extra services for startups and small businesses from all over the world.

By successfully funding our campaign and reach the $12500 goal, you will generously be able to help us by:

  • Renting an office, with internet, which will cost me approximately $3500. 
  • Developing an App. Cost = $2500.
  • Setup equipment and production hardware and software. Cost = $1700.
  • Hiring, marketing and advertising my expanded business. Cost = $3800.
  • Creative productions such as voice overs and others. Cost = $1000.
  • Start operation and growth plan.

The goal is to start offering our services on the cheap, startups and small businesses can avoid hefty studio charges when they create their commercials with us, we can also compete strongly in retail radio services, as we can use my experience in setting up an online radio station in a very cost effective manner.

The ultimate goal is for us to succeed, and save up capital to do the following step by step:

  • Buying a local radio frequency and opening a radio station.
  • Opening a music school.
  • Opening an instruments shop.
  • All the above to operate under one umbrella.

You may call us dreamers, or see this as unrealistic, but they are our dream one day we will make them a reality, a promise we made to ourselves, and we will never give up on it.

With your help, We are confident that we will offer the market something different, something special that will gain the appreciation of all music enthusiasts and artists alike.

We'd be grateful for your consideration to invest in our idea, in return, you will be getting a better way to be entertained while staying happy and positive all the time, thanks to the music selection we are going to be broadcasting.

Perks

We are offering personalized gifts to each backer who is interested in getting some perks from us, as a token of our grateful appreciation,We are offering gifts at highly discounted rates, gifts include:

  • Mini Me figurine of yourself, friend or loved one: one of the artists I know makes handmade Mini Me's, if you email me your picture to talk@rababa.fm (or a picture of anyone you like which you can use as a gift), I can make you a Handmade Mini Me of yourself, friend or a loved one. 
  • Mini Me Key chain of yourself, friend or loved one (Same details as above). 
  • Natural Dead Sea minerals and mud gift pack. 
  • A beautiful handmade apron (we can offer for men or women). 
  • Original Parker Pen engraved with your name or anyone's name. 

The Impact of Your Contribution

The difference your contribution will make:

  • To change the way people listen to the radio, and help them enjoy themselves and stay positive and happy.
  • You will help me achieve the best results, as I have done for my other successful and profitable project (www.thejoshop.com), where I opened an online store that hosts local artists that sell their handmade work worldwide.
  • We are hard workers with an entrepreneurial mindset, We have had the trust of backers from our previous project that returned them a nice profit, while breaking even costs in less than a year, We seek your trust to help us succeed on a whole new level while ultimately making a huge difference in radio broadcasting.

Risks & Challenges

Like every other project, We might be facing risks and challenges, such as:

  • Difficulty penetrating a small market like ours.
  • Competing with fully functional radio stations.
  • Finding the right candidates for the job.

Given that We know the risks and challenges, We are more than capable to overcoming them and finding solutions to ensure smooth flow of business.

Other ways to help us for FREE

If you can't contribute, that's OK :) You can help us for free by:

  • Making noise, and spreading the word about my new campaign using Facebook and Twitter or by using Indiegogo's sharing tools.

If you need more information from me, I would be more than happy to talk, please email me at talk@rababa.fm.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH for taking the time to read our story, and we hope that you will be able to contribute to this idea and make it become a reality.

We kindly ask you to share this project on your social media pages, that will help a lot!

Yasmin & Mo Khalaf
story_txt:
PROJECT CLOSED - PLEASE DO NOT FUND THIS CAMPAIGN.
rababa.fm
Our names are Yasmin & Mo Khalaf, we are living in Amman, Jordan. We both have been in love with radio and music ever since we can remember, in fact, one of the best things we have in common is music. Join us in creating something special, as we share our story about how we aim to redefine your radio listening experience.
We started working on our online radio station (www.rababa.fm) since 2013, We have invested so much effort and money to the point where we couldn't do it on our own anymore, and our dream was to expand our idea, that's when a friend of ours suggested Indiegogo.
rababa.fm is made FOR people like you and me, we stream songs with profound meanings, songs that relate to our daily lives, songs that make us happy, simply great songs!
We are your go to radio station when you feel you need that motivation, positiveness and uplifting. We are live 24/7, you can listen to our English songs all day long from our website www.rababa.fm, and soon from our App for iOS and Android.
To us, most radio stations operate the same, talk shows that don't interest the majority, filled with commercials and just playing new music, well we want to offer you a better radio experience, because people are forgetting how fun and amazing radio stations are, we will also be offering other services such as retail radio services and commercials production for startups and small businesses.
Our dream is to expand to the new radio experience and services mentioned earlier,We are now trying to raise $12500 to open an office, to setup a team and get some bright minded individuals to work with me to get my idea come true. The most important thing for us is to redefine radio broadcasting, and offer the extra services for startups and small businesses from all over the world.
By successfully funding our campaign and reach the $12500 goal, you will generously be able to help us by:

Renting an office, with internet, which will cost me approximately $3500. 
Developing an App. Cost = $2500.
Setup equipment and production hardware and software. Cost = $1700.
Hiring, marketing and advertising my expanded business. Cost = $3800.

Creative productions such as voice overs and others. Cost = $1000.

Start operation and growth plan.

The goal is to start offering our services on the cheap, startups and small businesses can avoid hefty studio charges when they create their commercials with us, we can also compete strongly in retail radio services, as we can use my experience in setting up an online radio station in a very cost effective manner.
The ultimate goal is for us to succeed, and save up capital to do the following step by step:

Buying a local radio frequency and opening a radio station.
Opening a music school.
Opening an instruments shop.
All the above to operate under one umbrella.

You may call us dreamers, or see this as unrealistic, but they are our dream one day we will make them a reality, a promise we made to ourselves, and we will never give up on it.
With your help, We are confident that we will offer the market something different, something special that will gain the appreciation of all music enthusiasts and artists alike.
We'd be grateful for your consideration to invest in our idea, in return, you will be getting a better way to be entertained while staying happy and positive all the time, thanks to the music selection we are going to be broadcasting.

Perks
We are offering personalized gifts to each backer who is interested in getting some perks from us, as a token of our grateful appreciation,We are offering gifts at highly discounted rates, gifts include:

Mini Me figurine of yourself, friend or loved one: one of the artists I know makes handmade Mini Me's, if you email me your picture to talk@rababa.fm (or a picture of anyone you like which you can use as a gift), I can make you a Handmade Mini Me of yourself, friend or a loved one. 
Mini Me Key chain of yourself, friend or loved one (Same details as above). 
Natural Dead Sea minerals and mud gift pack. 
A beautiful handmade apron (we can offer for men or women). 
Original Parker Pen engraved with your name or anyone's name. 


The Impact of Your Contribution
The difference your contribution will make:

To change the way people listen to the radio, and help them enjoy themselves and stay positive and happy.
You will help me achieve the best results, as I have done for my other successful and profitable project (www.thejoshop.com), where I opened an online store that hosts local artists that sell their handmade work worldwide.
We are hard workers with an entrepreneurial mindset, We have had the trust of backers from our previous project that returned them a nice profit, while breaking even costs in less than a year, We seek your trust to help us succeed on a whole new level while ultimately making a huge difference in radio broadcasting.


Risks & Challenges
Like every other project, We might be facing risks and challenges, such as:

Difficulty penetrating a small market like ours.
Competing with fully functional radio stations.
Finding the right candidates for the job.

Given that We know the risks and challenges, We are more than capable to overcoming them and finding solutions to ensure smooth flow of business.

Other ways to help us for FREE
If you can't contribute, that's OK :) You can help us for free by:
Making noise, and spreading the word about my new campaign using Facebook and Twitter or by using Indiegogo's sharing tools.
If you need more information from me, I would be more than happy to talk, please email me at talk@rababa.fm.
THANK YOU VERY MUCH for taking the time to read our story, and we hope that you will be able to contribute to this idea and make it become a reality.We kindly ask you to share this project on your social media pages, that will help a lot!Yasmin & Mo Khalaf

story:
Update

November 8 is fast approaching, and it appears that funding for this song will not meet its goal ahead of the final days when Puget Sound regional citizens are deciding whether to accept or reject the $54 billion, 25-year ST3 tax proposition.  The song’s producers – educators and explainers first, business savants second! – have decided  to release the finished song now to support the public interest in trying to prevent a train wreck, or at least make sure that those aboard the train are fully informed!

The full song/video is now available publicly at TRAINWRECK.VIDEO

Please continue to contribute to support their dedicated work.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"There's something brewin' 'round the Sound"

... and it ain’t coffee! 

The Seattle-Tacoma-Bellevue-Everett region will soon be voting on the ST3 rail expansion plan (also called Regional Proposition One).  In presenting the ST3 plan to the public, the transportation agency proposing it (Sound Transit) for the past year has flooded the media with seemingly irrefutable wonderfulness and benefits.  Sharp eyes soon took a closer look and discovered serious concerns that weren’t evident at first glance.

To support the $54 billion in expenditure, the amount of tax money to be collected exceeds the officially claimed $36 billion because of construction bonds that will require repayment decades beyond the 25 years of construction.  

Beyond this and other financial concerns, there are also substantial underlying issues of actual service delivered, which go beyond the surface appearance of “faster and nicer” and are (understandably) not apparent to frustrated travelers who just want things to get better. 

 

Lopsided funding for a serious debate

A pro-ST3 campaign organization called Mass Transit Now recently began operations with a paid staff supported by organizational contributions amounting to over $2.5 million as of early September.

A few robust “opposition” websites have been established, but their visibility can't compete with the TV and print ads generously funded by millions of dollars in contributions from big design, construction, and sports organizations that would benefit from the expanded system.

 

Citizens are now starting to hear the rumblings of concern, and the time is right to grab that awareness and put some more attention-getting and trustworthy “meat” on those bones of concern.

 

Grabbing attention in a fun, accessible way

 

We believe that SEATTLE TRAIN WRECK will be an unexpected and engaging way to harness the power of social media (in this case, YouTube) to catch the attention of our unsuspecting taxpayers in order to reveal some surprises that will directly affect their pocketbook and their transportation experience, whether they use public transit or not.

​

    Kids combine learning and fun by singing,
    why not adults?

     

    SEATTLE TRAIN WRECK  is being created by a team comprised of an award-winning children’s singer/songwriter/explainer and a high-profile music producer.  The result is a catchy, high-quality, singable/danceable song combined with animated  imagery that illustrates  the message in a humorous (and sometimes irreverent!) way.  

     

       

       

      Everything in the song is supported by informational websites

       

      The closing scene of the video refers viewers to a “bibliography” website (ST3PLAN.INFO) which has links to supporting information for all the issues mentioned in the song  (plus many others).  Sites both for and against ST3 are listed.

      The song is fun and edgy, but there’s no baloney.  It is intended to draw attention to issues that are not readily visible in the broad promotion that is blanketing the region. This song does not tell you how to vote on Regional Proposition One in King, Snohomish, and Pierce Counties of Washington State.  As always with any vote, be informed, weigh the evidence, and make your judgment!

       

      Help us spread the word!

      Please contribute whatever you can, however large or small – the contributor count makes a statement as well the dollar count.  You can contribute anonymously.  Support the small citizen team pulling back the curtain to raise an informed warning about the $2.5 million juggernaut of big-and-rich organizations trying to shape OUR transportation future by spending billions of OUR tax dollars, all the while illustrating an obsequious endorsement of a political power structure that needs ST3 to survive.

      In the meantime, you can view the song preview at the link below – LIKE and SHARE, leave a comment, and start singing on the bus!

      O travel Seattle, and bless every mile
      All aboard ST3, to take you in style!
      It looks good on paper, but beware the facts –
      Lookout for a train wreck ahead on the tracks!

       

      View a longer preview at 

      SEATTLETRAINWRECK.COM

      Please help us get out this critical message to the taxpayers and travelers of the central Puget Sound area.

      SEATTLE TRAIN WRECK is a project of the Public Interest Transportation Forum, online since 1996 at BetterTransport.info

      Thank you !

In the meantime, you can view the song preview at the link below – LIKE and SHARE, leave a comment, and start singing on the bus! 

O travel Seattle, and bless every mileAll aboard ST3, to take you in style!It looks good on paper, but beware the facts –Lookout for a train wreck ahead on the tracks!

Please help us get out this critical message to the taxpayers and travelers of the central Puget Sound area.
SEATTLE TRAIN WRECK is a project of the Public Interest Transportation Forum, online since 1996 at BetterTransport.info

Thank you !

story:
NOW AVAILABLE ON www.earthmantra.net
 
Sign up for updates
 

The sacred chants of EARTH are grounded in delicate tones that ascend to Spirit through soulful, soaring vocals. Calling the names of the Divine of all traditions with devotion and a sensual musicality. The aspiration of EARTH is to reside in love, truth and presence ~ and their dedication to that path...This resonates through their collective sound, invoking a pure, child-like quality.

Listen to EARTH on www.reverbnation.com/earthmantra

Maha Mata ~ Great Mother

This album calls on different traditions to support and prepare the birthing process, be it for a child, a creative project, a new venture or planting seeds for great dreams. 

The Great Mother, The Divine Mother, The Creative life force that we all belong to, are a part of, and that resides within each of us is awakened through these sacred words. These mantras bring forth prayers for profound protection, healing and strength granting the feminine powers of intuition and creation to blossom and flourish. 

Vaishnavi has spent time un-learning with Rajeswar Bhattacharya and deepening into authentic sound with Chloe Goodchild. She encountered mantra through Kundalini Yoga and was introduced to bhajan and the bhakti path through meeting Amma. She considers this her greatest “teaching” – a flowering of the heart. For three years, she chanted the Lalita Sahasranama daily and led bhajans in a large Indian ashram. More info on www.at-om.com

"She sings like an angel, touching hearts at a deep devotional level." Chloe Goodchild

Vaishnavi: "I always longed to sing but shyness and terror overwhelmed me. On a TEFL training in 1997, when asked to teach a simple nursery rhyme to 5 people, my face beetrooted, my throat constricted and I could barely squeeze a sound out. In that mortifying moment, I realised: "This has to change!" It was the beginning of a long, arduous and utterly graced journey of "finding my voice”. From beginning to sound mantra in a group through my Kundalini Yoga teacher training in 2001, I was introduced to bhajan through meeting Amma in 2005. After 2 months singing nightly at San Ramon ashram, I had a startling breakthrough. I think that was the day I began to understand that what comes through when I sing is so much greater than me. My main learning continues to be to get out of the way and my prayer is always for my voice to be a channel for love. It is with that intention that I embark on bringing forth harmonious mantras with Amy: to transmit the healing vibration of love and transport you on its wings!"

​Amy continues to  witness in herself and others how the power of mantra and sound healing can carry us back into a state of surrender and grace, allowing our lives to unfold organically and our souls to guide us. Amy's passion for mantra and sound healing was ignited when she first discovered Kundalini Yoga in 2000 - around the same time she met Vaishnavi. Amy and Vaishnavi created 'Earth' in 2012, they came to understand that they share their music as a bridge to the Divine more than as a “performance”. 

Amy: "The idea of creating this album stirs up immense joy and love in my heart. I feel like it is a beginning, a birthing, a letting go and a sweet surrender into trust. It represents a flowering of my heart; a gesture that my soul is ready to receive and share. I have swam through fears, doubts, and a sea of insecurities regarding my creativity but now see these doubts as friends rather than enemies, as teachers rather than interrogators: they are there to awaken the best possible version of Myself - God's dream. My soul flourishes when I am singing, writing, sharing, loving, creating, when I am just being myself! So I pray that not only will our music radiate healing and devotion but will also inspire a rejoicing of each other’s gifts, joy, success and creative outlets."

Our Producer: We have a magical producer who loves our sound and has offered an amazing recording/mixing/mastering deal. Marc JB from Velvet Jam studios is a successful dance music producer and is moving into creating music more consciously imbued to uplift: JAM stands for Joy in Audio Manifest. What a delight it is for us to record in the depths of a leafy garden with someone coming from the intention! 

Budget: With recording, producing and distribution, this musical creation is only going to cost around £4000! Here are the break down of costs....

Recording/mixing/mastering/musicians -£2500
CD Production - £1000
Digital distribution, Indiegogo fees & Contingency - £456.67

If we make over the amount, this will go directly towards the making of our second Kundalini Yoga Mantra album - the songs are ready to go!

To have the opportunity and privilege to record and share these offerings is a blessing for us. We deeply appreciate any donation, however small, and hope in return we can inspire, uplift and console through this creation. With nothing but gratitude we open the invitation for you to be a part of this creation. If you cannot contribute with a donation you can still be a part of this by sharing and spreading the word:

Direct people to this Indiegogo page

Share the campaign page on your FB page & Twitter

Email  friends and family around the world who may connect with our sound!

 

With the deepest of love and gratitude, 

Vaishnavi & Amy 

xxxxx

If we make over the amount, this will go directly towards the making of our second Kundalini Yoga Mantra album - the songs are ready to go!
To have the opportunity and privilege to record and share these offerings is a blessing for us. Share the campaign page on your FB page & Twitter

With the deepest of love and gratitude, 
Vaishnavi & Amy

story:
Overdue Confession II - The Full Length EP

Overdue Confession II - The Full Length LP 

Hi there! My name is Sam Jones and I was born to make music.

My band and I, Sam C. Jones & the Sinners recorded our first EP together last fall. "Overdue Confession" is a sweeping tour through the Americana landscape, with everything from blazing guitar solos to ballads about lost love and the sea. The songs are a mix of blues driven break-up tales, upbeat rockabilly and slowed down folk ballads. I am incredibly proud of the work we put into recording that EP, the stories behind the songs and the overwhelming response from our fans. If you like the songwriting styles of Johnny Cash and Willie Nelson and the musicality of Jason Isbell and Elvis Presley, my music is just for you!

So, here's the deal: we have six more songs we would like to record this year and we need your help.  Once we record these songs, we'll combine the new tunes with the OG "Overdue Confession" EP to release our first full-length album. The thing is, recording an album is expensive, even when you have a record label backing you; which, I do not. I am an independent musician, so all of the money to make this album happen comes from me (and hopefully you). The money from this campaign will go towards everything I need to make this album happen: paying my band and our recording engineers, paying the album photographer and poster designer, marketing and PR, paying to make, print and send y'all the rewards for this campaign.

These new songs are straight from the heart and hit you right in the soul. I have big dreams to tell these stories in the biggest way possible - and you can make that dream a reality! 

No donation is too small - that being said, no donation is too big. We have some excellent reward tiers, ranging from physical copies of the new LP all the way to a live, in person show in your home.  Check them out!

Oh, and a thousand thank you's in advance for your help making this project happen. 

Risks & Challenges

Since my manager and I are a two-person operation, it will take some time to get everything put together to mail out to you. We hope that the rewards will be mailed out to you sooner than the dates listed, but with me being in D.C. and my manager being in Nashville there is an additional step to this coordination process since things that need to be signed have to come to me, and then go to her! My manager is the most organized person I know (that's why she's my manager), so everything will probably be ready to go in August, but we want to give ourselves as much time as possible, while staying within reason.

Recording an album also takes time! Mixing and mastering takes time! God-willing everything will go right the first time around, but sometimes things have to be re-recorded or added in or tweaked after we're done in the studio. This album's release date is planned to give everyone as much time to make it perfect as we can.

story:
About the "Where We Find Ourselves" Virtual Choir

Hello! I’m composer Michael Bussewitz-Quarm. I write choral music that engages singers and audiences with the leading social issues of our time. I’d love for you to join me in a virtual choir for my latest piece, Where We Find Ourselves.

Where We Find Ourselves is inspired by an exhibit and book of the same name, which feature the portraits of Hugh Mangum, a photographer who lived in Durham, North Carolina during the Jim Crow era. He is unique in that he photographed people of diverse racial and economic backgrounds and was incredibly sensitive to the details in the portraits: the clothing, hair, expression, and physicality he captured truly represent humanity’s richness. It is significant that his work reflects racial diversity during a time of violent segregation. As Margaret Sartor, on of the curators and authors of the book, Where We Find Ourselves, observes, his portraits “indicate that an unbiased and open-door policy existed in his studio.”

These portraits are from a set of glass plate negatives that were found years after Mangum’s death in a family barn. Over time, these negatives were damaged and so the photographs developed signs of wear and some distortions—all of which add to the richness of experiencing them as we consider the passage of time and the gaps between what we think we know about a person based on their appearance and who they truly are.

What We Need & What You Get

 

This project begins with a series of video “journeys” that explore the themes in the portraits, the history of this era, and the music and lyrics as they are being written. These journeys will be hosted by me, lyricist Chantal Sellers, photographers, curators, and authors of the book Where We Find Ourselves, Margaret Sartor and Alex Harris, as well as Dr. Sherry Boyd, Humanities Coordinator for Dallas College, and Tina Sayers, Executive Director of Maple Seed Creative Consulting.

All virtual choir members will be invited to join a private Facebook group hosted by me so that you can meet one another, share your thoughts and observations, and build community with your fellow singers. In this way, we begin our artistic journey with introspection and discussion, to deepen our understanding and open our minds and hearts to the topics we will be singing about.

Where We Find Ourselves will be 20-22 minutes long, in five movements, for SATB choir.  The work will be of medium difficulty, with original lyrics written by Chantal Sellers. The music will be released in January, 2021, along with rehearsal tracks for you to use to practice and record your part. I will host recorded virtual “rehearsals” with each section to share my vision for phrasing, shaping, and overall musical ideas. These rehearsals will be recorded for those who will be preparing their part on their own. 

In addition, you may join at the Premium Virtual Choir Member level and receive a one-on-one musical coaching with me. The final video will be edited together in the spring of 2021 and delivered to you and shared online so that the message can spread and grow!

The Impact

The message of these photographs, that we must look and listen deeper to one another, and that while much time has passed, our country still has so much work to do to overcome racism, is timely and urgent. As we look around at our country and our world, it is easy to get overwhelmed by the many challenges we see. It’s important to know that we can make a difference by educating ourselves and using our talents to inform and inspire others.

In addition, many of us who have found a home in choral music are missing our usual outlet for singing during the pandemic. Our weekly rehearsal routine has been disrupted to keep our communities safe. But we still need community, we still need purpose and a way to channel our artistic talents for our own happiness and to serve others. This project will have an immense impact on our lives and on the world as we come together in the journeys this fall and in song in the spring.

I truly believe we can change the world through the power of music. Choral music is the perfect medium to raise awareness, engage ourselves and our community in dialogue, inspire compassion, and incite meaningful change. I hope you will open your hearts and raise your voice with me to create this new piece of music.

Risks & Challenges

I am committed to writing this piece, hosting the video journeys, and creating the virtual choir video. I am an experienced composer and conductor with an extensive background in writing music, running rehearsals, and bringing a performance project to fruition. 

One of the great things about a virtual choir is that it can work with a large, medium, or small group of singers. Because everyone will have access to the rehearsal tracks, I expect a high quality performance no matter the number of singers. I would love to have a large four-part chorus for this project, but the piece will work beautifully with a smaller ensemble if necessary. 

If my financial goal is not reached, all commitments listed in the “perks” will be honored, the video journeys will go live, and the virtual choir video will still be created. In this way, I and my business are absorbing the risk of this project. There is no risk to donors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love for you to raise your voice and sing with us, but I understand this may not be possible for everyone who supports the mission of this project.

You can help amplify the message of this piece by sharing this project with choral singers who do not have the opportunity to sing this season, or with choirs who are working to program their season.

Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.

Visit my website and subscribe to my newsletter to be the first to know about future projects, and to be notified when the virtual choir video for this project goes live.

Hugh Mangum photographs courtesy of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

About the "Where We Find Ourselves" Virtual Choir
Hello! I’m composer Michael Bussewitz-Quarm. I write choral music that engages singers and audiences with the leading social issues of our time. I’d love for you to join me in a virtual choir for my latest piece, Where We Find Ourselves.

Where We Find Ourselves is inspired by an exhibit and book of the same name, which feature the portraits of Hugh Mangum, a photographer who lived in Durham, North Carolina during the Jim Crow era. He is unique in that he photographed people of diverse racial and economic backgrounds and was incredibly sensitive to the details in the portraits: the clothing, hair, expression, and physicality he captured truly represent humanity’s richness. It is significant that his work reflects racial diversity during a time of violent segregation. As Margaret Sartor, on of the curators and authors of the book, Where We Find Ourselves, observes, his portraits “indicate that an unbiased and open-door policy existed in his studio.”

These portraits are from a set of glass plate negatives that were found years after Mangum’s death in a family barn. story:
This is a $6,000 project which is a really tight budget considering the following expenses: the theater ($1,800), the musicians, which includes three rehearsals and two shows, ($2,500), insurance (tbd), a fire guard ($200), sound technician ($300), lighting expert ($300), my costumes ($300) and associated costs (i.e. programs, refreshments). I have a terrific director and a PR woman who are both donating their time and a host of friends supporting and making things happen. 

I need help to raise the money, and get the word out. Would you consider sharing this, telling people and just cheering me on from wherever you live?

Why do I feel so passionate about this project? In the last two years I have done five shows with this format, my audience has responded with a lot of support and feedback. They want more and they tell me it helped them in their own personal battles. This project is a deeper dive into the grit of life and how to come out better, stronger, and knowing life is a journey and one worth taking! 

If you will help me with this project, I want to give back to say thank you. For $15 you get my thanks via a postcard with a picture of the cast. For a donation of $30 I will include the postcard, along with the autographed lyrics to my original song Teddy Bear. A $60 donation will include the above and a ticket to the performance of your choice. Saturday evening at 7pm or Sunday at 4pm.  $100 gift will include the above and a copy of the program, autographed by the whole cast. If you decide to go all out, I will come up with a great surprise! 

Thank you for being a part!

Detra~

story:
Who We Are:


We are Commie Faggots. You may know us by the name we had to use on Facebook - Communist Homosexuals - until we became the Band that are Banned on Facebook. This will be our third album and we think it's great and that you'll love listening to it (it unless you're Tory in which case you'll really hate it.)

The Album

We realised a while back that we had amassed several songs about politicians and political figures, and thought it would make sense to put them together in one album. As far as concept albums go, that's a pretty simple one eh?! Along with the humorous take downs of this gallery of deplorables are songs about the power seeking and conforming mindset more broadly (Normal), an anti-body shaming song about a penis that is Bent (Like A Politician), a song about a politician we actually approve of (no prizes for guessing who), and one to round off the album which points out the limitations of focusing on individuals rather than ideas and systems (Better Be Better).

 

    We'd love it if you fund this campaign because we believe:
 

  • Personality Politics will make you laugh lots, tap your feet, wiggle your bum and want to do it all over again several times
  • You'll get to listen to the whole album, rather than songs in isolation that you come across on Youtube or split up by ads on Spotify, who'd pay us about 0.001 p per listen
  • We love to play without charge  at fundraisers and benefit concerts for causes we believe in, and we love recording music and making videos. We can keep all the costs involved in this sustainable by having merch to sell
  • We printed our last album, Pinko, entirely from crowdfunding. Lots of people love that one, and if we can crowdfund this one, we're sure you'll love this one too!

Our target

We're setting a flexible target - the more we raise the more CDs we'll get printed.
The price per unit goes waaaaay down if we reach £750, so that'd be nice, but less would still be cool - we can print smaller or bigger batches accordingly.


What you can give and what you can get!

£5 - a download link to the album so you can listen digitally
£10 - a CD copy of the album with full colour artwork
£15 - the new CD plus a copy of our previous release, Pinko
£20 - the new CD plus a t-shirt with the Commie Faggot logo

£50 - all the above plus a private or public performance for you within London (beyond London negotiable!)
£100 - we'll write and record/perform a song for you on a topic of your choosing
£200 - we'll make a figurine in your honour out of feather boas, kazoos, and tutus.

story:
Update!

The cloudfunding is now over and as you can see there was an amazing response. We will be providing regular updates as they happen. If you missed the window and still want to contribute you can donate directly from Little Cloud's web page :)

https://www.littlecloudsongs.com/

 

It’s Time!

Hey, Cloud People! We have heard your requests and are ready to get some music recorded for you. It is really important to us that we reflect Tucson in our sound, so we are looking for a local studio with whom to record. We also know that the live performances need some tweaking to get a better sound and we would love to continue to bring props and swag for our fan-mily (does that work? Fan + Family). Below is what are hoping to accomplish:

Project Expense Breakdown (So why that amount?)

First of all some good news, the campaign is a “Flexible” account which is different than ‘Kickstarter’ campaigns in the way that if we don’t make our target we still have access the amount raised. In a Kickstarter, if you don’t make the amount you lose it all.

We have already done significant work in that the songs have already been written and have been “quality” tested at live gigs. The songs that had the strongest reactions made the list and those that didn’t have gone back to the bench for more work. Now we just need to get the songs professional recorded and we need our gear updated for the live shows.

Below is a list of our expenses (in order of importance) so you can get a clear understanding of how the money in this campaign will be used:

Professional Record and Product Music ($3219)

  • Record, mix, and master 10 songs ($2250)
    • Standard studio cost is $45 an hour
    • Each song takes about 4-5 hours to record, mix, and master (so $225 a song)
  • Graphic (Tucson) artist for CD art ($150)
  • Run of 500 CDs in sleeves ($750)
  • Get the songs onto music steaming services (Spotify, Pandora, etc.)
    • It is really import to us that music is available to anyone who wants it. To get the songs onto media streaming services only runs $69. 

Equipment Refresh ($1300)

  • Jonica’s accordion is having pretty signifant issues but fortunately we have found a potential replacement for only $150
  • Geremy’s bass needs a major overhaul – estimating $200
  • The microphone stands are slowing breaking apart – estimating $50
  • Instrument cables are starting to go – estimating $100
  • Update the sound system for live performances
    • Wireless system for street gigs ($800)

Props, lights, and costumes ($300)

  • Lights and cloud props – estimating $150
    • We want the live shows to remain feeling magical so we have included costs in for lights replacements and new cloud props
  • Costumes – estimating $150
    • That’s right, we have a costume budget. This should not be a surprise to you ;)

Additional Overheard ($900)

  • Indiegogo costs – the cost to run this campaign back to Indiegogo is 5% - estimating $300
  • Taxes – This counts as income and therefor there is about a 10% tax to consider – estimating $600

 

The Donations Come with Perks!

We would not ask anyone to donate without offering amazing swag and performances. Take a look at the perk packages and see what's included. As you can tell, there are some really amazing options!

Weekly Secret Perks

Once a week we will announce a secret perk that will only be available to those who follow the link provided at that time. These will range from custom Little Cloud jewelry, ornaments, dolls, and even special request performances! Look for our live streams, and special posts, to hear about these secret perks.  

The Special Prize!

For every donation made (including the secret perks), your name will be added into a drawing (on May 5th) for the one-of-a-kind "Little 'Little Cloud' Guitar"! Additional opportunities to increase your chances will be announced in the event posts for Little Cloud gigs in April. 

 

We Need You!

More important than your donation, we need you for our community. What you probably don't know about the places we play is that the venues LOVE our fans - that's you! The Cloud People! We have been told that many bands will bring fans that do not take care of the bartenders, the space, and each other like you do. Since you all are so fantastic it makes it an added bonus for them to book us. We cannot express enough how much that means!

If you cannot afford a donation, please do not worry. We ask you to share this anyway! We are thrilled to see this community grow and want even more to become Cloud People  :)

We Need You!
More important than your donation, we need you for our community. What you probably don't know about the places we play is that the venues LOVE our fans - that's you! The Cloud People! We have been told that many bands will bring fans that do not take care of the bartenders, the space, and each other like you do. Since you all are so fantastic it makes it an added bonus for them to book us. We cannot express enough how much that means!
If you cannot afford a donation, please do not worry. We ask you to share this anyway! We are thrilled to see this community grow and want even more to become Cloud People  :)

story:
HOW DID I GET HERE?

On New Year’s Eve of 2016, I made the resolution to start meditating every day.

Something about meditation made me ask myself: what am I actually supposed to be doing with this life? What is my purpose while I’m alive? This questioning led me down an unexpected path.

I knew that I still loved making music and sharing it, but I started asking: how can it truly be used for good in the world? How can I do things with it, without any sense of shame or selfishness?

Eventually I found out about an academy in Vermont called MAPLE (Monastic Academy for the Preservation of Life on Earth), and their residential training program. I was intrigued because one of their missions is to help their trainees discover what they call their VOW: “A vow is your deepest commitment to be of service to all living beings in the way that is uniquely yours.”

So I took a huge chance, left amazing friends, musical projects, and my job in Los Angeles to move to Vermont, for the training. The training is in cultivating a deep mindfulness practice, doing good things in the world through non-profit development, and the intersection of those entities. I continue to live and train with an incredible community of spiritual practitioners and compassionate people. I live the lifestyle of what we can call a Modern Monastic, on a very strict schedule of chanting, seated meditation and work for our organization and community.

Through this intense and deep training, new parts of myself have opened up that I never dreamed I would encounter. This has led me to find new energy and openness within my artistic prowess.

With immense gratitude, I accepted a small grant for FIRE SIGN from our non-profit. I went to Brooklyn in March 2018 to begin recording the album with my friend Jon Markson. Jon and I were in a band called Time Crisis together and we had one album, which is my favorite album I've ever worked on. It was our first time recording since 2009, and it’s been incredible to be working with him again.

So now, I’m reaching out to you to help me complete the project!

I'm about to travel to Brooklyn again to finish recording and mixing FIRE SIGN.

There are 10 songs on the record. They were written and produced in Los Angeles, Vermont, Maine, Philadelphia, and Washington DC.

WHY DO I NEED FUNDING? WHY DO I DESERVE YOUR MONEY?

Prior to starting training at MAPLE, I was able to independently afford and fund my albums, but now, because I’m in the training (which I’ve literally given up my entire life for), in exchange for a supportive and loving community, healthy food, and a bed to sleep on, I don't get paid.

Your generosity will support me in my creative path, and in my spiritual path.

You will be supporting me as a musician who deeply cares about giving their offering to the world from a place of true compassion. I’ve thoroughly considered the karmic affiliations of not hiding my songs from the world. This has given me strength, clarity, and zeal to share them with you!!

WHAT EXACTLY ARE YOU HELPING ME PAY FOR?

  • Studio time with engineer + producer extraordinaire Jon Markson
  • Mastering (putting a beautiful sheen on the record once the mix is completed)
  • Art work by the talented Caitlin Herrschaft
  • Potential pressing of physical copies, merchandising
  • Uploading the record to streaming services

WHAT WILL I DO ONCE THIS ALBUM IS FINISHED? WHERE ARE YOU HELPING ME GO, AND HELPING ME TO DO?

I want to be playing shows. Once this record is done, I plan on releasing it in late 2018 / early 2019, and promoting it around the world. I plan on starting gradually around the East Coast, and expanding from there. Hopefully I’ll see you at show.

Thank you endlessly for your support. I absolutely cannot wait to share these songs with you.

Your friend,

Danny Joseph

---I---> Listen to my other music HERE.

---I---> Find out more about the Monastic Academy HERE.

---I---> Read about my recent experience at the intersection of mindfulness practice and music HERE.

---I---> For any customer service related inquiries, PLEASE FEEL FREE TO GET IN TOUCH WITH ME: DanielJW.shington@gmail.com

I was intrigued because one of their missions is to help their trainees discover what they call their VOW: “A vow is your deepest commitment to be of service to all living beings in the way that is uniquely yours.”
So I took a huge chance, left amazing friends, musical projects, and my job in Los Angeles to move to Vermont, for the training. The training is in cultivating a deep mindfulness practice, doing good things in the world through non-profit development, and the intersection of those entities. I continue to live and train with an incredible community of spiritual practitioners and compassionate people. I live the lifestyle of what we can call a Modern Monastic, on a very strict schedule of chanting, seated meditation and work for our organization and community.
Through this intense and deep training, new parts of myself have opened up that I never dreamed I would encounter. This has led me to find new energy and openness within my artistic prowess.
With immense gratitude, I accepted a small grant for FIRE SIGN from our non-profit. I went to Brooklyn in March 2018 to begin recording the album with my friend Jon Markson. Jon and I were in a band called Time Crisis together and we had one album, which is my favorite album I've ever worked on. It was our first time recording since 2009, and it’s been incredible to be working with him again.
So now, I’m reaching out to you to help me complete the project!
I'm about to travel to Brooklyn again to finish recording and mixing FIRE SIGN.
There are 10 songs on the record. They were written and produced in Los Angeles, Vermont, Maine, Philadelphia, and Washington DC.
WHY DO I NEED FUNDING? WHY DO I DESERVE YOUR MONEY?
Prior to starting training at MAPLE, I was able to independently afford and fund my albums, but now, because I’m in the training (which I’ve literally given up my entire life for), in exchange for a supportive and loving community, healthy food, and a bed to sleep on, I don't get paid.
Your generosity will support me in my creative path, and in my spiritual path.
You will be supporting me as a musician who deeply cares about giving their offering to the world from a place of true compassion. I’ve thoroughly considered the karmic affiliations of not hiding my songs from the world. This has given me strength, clarity, and zeal to share them with you!!
WHAT EXACTLY ARE YOU HELPING ME PAY FOR?

Studio time with engineer + producer extraordinaire Jon Markson

Mastering (putting a beautiful sheen on the record once the mix is completed)
Art work by the talented Caitlin Herrschaft

Potential pressing of physical copies, merchandising
Uploading the record to streaming services

WHAT WILL I DO ONCE THIS ALBUM IS FINISHED? WHERE ARE YOU HELPING ME GO, AND HELPING ME TO DO?
I want to be playing shows. Once this record is done, I plan on releasing it in late 2018 / early 2019, and promoting it around the world. I plan on starting gradually around the East Coast, and expanding from there. Hopefully I’ll see you at show.
Thank you endlessly for your support. I absolutely cannot wait to share these songs with you.
Your friend,
Danny Joseph
---I---> Listen to my other music HERE.
---I---> Find out more about the Monastic Academy HERE.
---I---> Read about my recent experience at the intersection of mindfulness practice and music HERE.
---I---> For any customer service related inquiries, PLEASE FEEL FREE TO GET IN TOUCH WITH ME: DanielJW.shington@gmail.com

story:
Our Project

Hey everyone! We're Ian Mullins and Jackson Gulick, AKA Matfield Green. We're a couple of singer-songwriters from Kansas living in Nashville, TN. The funny thing is, we didn't know each other until we met in Nashville three years ago (even though we grew up 40 miles apart)! It wasn't long after we started writing songs and playing shows together that we figured out we had a good thing going...  So we decided to make the duo Matfield Green! 

Since then, we've played shows all over the map and written hundreds of songs with some of our best friends here in Music City. From that catalog, this project is a collection of six of our favorite songs we have ever been a part of. Now, all that's left to do is get in the studio and record this thing! We're so excited to get it out to you all!

What You're Supporting/What You Get

What exactly does the campaign funding go toward?

  • Six fully produced songs, including:
  1. Paying our studio musicians, engineers and producer
  2. Paying for studio time
  3. Mixing and mastering of the songs
  4. Promotion/Distribution
  5. Merchandise

What do you get in return?

Package options include:

  • Digital or Signed Physical Copy of our EP
  • Matfield Green T-Shirt
  • MFG Hat
  • MFG Koozie
  • Acoustic Show
  • Cover Song of Your Choice
  • Personalized Original Song
  • Thank You in Liner Notes of Album
  • Associate Producer Credit
  • Custom Donation

Click on the individual packages for more description

The Impact

Your impact on us:

Each contribution not only brings us one step closer to finally putting music out, but will also get the ball rolling for us in the music industry. Having an album out could potentially open a lot of doors for us on Music Row here in Nashville, as well as globally- through streaming, digital media platforms and even radio. 

Another perk of having an album out is that we will now have the opportunity to tour! This will let us share our music with so many more people, as well as giving us the chance to meet all of you who have supported us over the years.

Your impact on our hometown communities:

After talking about what inspired us to create music, we decided that we wanted to give back to each of our incredible high school music programs. Five percent of all funding received will be shared between the music programs at Jefferson West High School and Shawnee Mission Northwest High School. We hope that this money can give a little back to the people and communities that gave us so much.

Ways You Can Help

SUPPORT

You can help us get this EP going by purchasing any one of the perks listed. 

If you want to contribute a custom amount, hit the pink "Back It" button on the top of our page! Every little bit helps, and we're so thankful for any support you can give us!

SHARE

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help a ton by sharing this with your friends across any and all social media platforms! If you know someone who might be interested in supporting us, please let them know!

Even if we don't completely reach our goal, we will still make this album happen!

We can't wait to get this show on the road!

 

Thanks,

Ian and Jackson

Matfield Green

story:
THE AMINA FIGAROVA SEXTET has been in existence for twenty years, and to celebrate this anniversary she will release two new albums in the coming months.

First in November: The Amina Figarova Sextet PLUS: She will add three strings to her sextet: Sara Caswell on violin, Lois Martin on viola, and Jody Redhage on cello.

The first album is comprised of two sessions: the first session recorded in June with Wayne Escoffery - tenor sax; Alex Pope Norris - trumpet; Bart Platteau - flute, Luques Curtis - bass, Jason Brown - drums, and Amina Figarova - piano, and the second session recorded in August with the Sextet Plus, with Marc Mommas on tenor and soprano sax, Brian Richburg Jr - an incredible 19 year old drummer from New Orleans, and Hasan Bakr as special guest on percussion.

The second album will be with a newly-created group:  "Amina Figarova E Band", with Rex Abbasi - guitar, Yasushi Nakamura - bass, Rudy Royston - drums, Bart Platteau - flute and EWI, and Amina on keyboard and piano. This album will be released in January, 2019.

Both albums will be released in CD format as well as vinyl.

The cover artwork for the sextet album will be created by a wonderful Brazilian artist, Chris Barreto.

Amina Figarova, born in Azerbaijan, is a phenomenal pianist and stunning composer, now based in New York. Her sextet is quickly developing a huge reputation on the international scene. For almost eighteen years, Amina has toured extensively, developing a tight-knit ensemble that, despite inevitable personnel changes, has attained a distinctive and inimitable voice by concentrating on an all-original repertoire. During that period, having collaborated with musicians residing in both the U.S. and Europe and having developed a circuit of welcoming venues, the Amina Figarova Sextet has triumphed at the main stage of the Newport Jazz Festival, has been invited repeatedly to the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival, and has won critical and audience acclaim in Chicago, Detroit, Paris, Amsterdam - and of course, New York.

Amina's pieces strike a perfect tone, employing incomparably beautiful harmonizations, to capture fleeting thoughts that accompany those precious moments when the puzzling jostle of daily existence comes into unexpected but deep satisfying sync.

To make both of these albums possible, we need your help. The costs of recording, musicians, studios, and album replication are around $20,000 for the Sextet album and $ 15,000 for the E band album. Our goal is to raise with this campaign the half of all the costs, the amount of $ 17,500.

We need your support to be able to make and to keep on making this wonderfully creative music. You can help us by contributing to this campaign - any donation is appreciated. Please share this and spread the word. Hopefully, we'll see you either at the album release concerts at the Jazz Standard in New York City on Tuesday, November 13 or Wednesday November 14, or during our European tour between November 16 and December 6, 2018 in the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, Italy, and Spain.

story:
Resilient 

Samantha Lucas 

Introduction 

My name is Samantha H. Lucas. I am a current senior at Baldwin Wallace University studying music theater and graduating with my Bachelor of Music this spring of 2021. Originally from Pittsburgh, PA, I discovered my passion for the arts when I started taking dance and piano lessons at six. Growing up in a family of professional musicians and always hearing music throughout the house, I developed an interest in different music, dance, and acting styles. Following my passion, I decided to continue my studies at Baldwin Wallace University. 

 

Campaign Importance 

This project serves as my Honors Senior Thesis Capstone Project and Senior Recital. It will include professional instrumentalists from the Cleveland area, students from Baldwin Wallace, a sound engineer from Pineapple Studios in Cleveland, and a Video Producer and former Baldwin Wallace Alumni from Blitz Studios located in the North East Ohio Area. The project will be shot over four days at different locations, including the following: Lakewood Congregational Church, The Cleveland Museum of Art, The Graffiti Heart Museum, The Baldwin Wallace University Gamble, and Kleist Auditoriums, and The Cleveland Bop Stop.

 

This campaign serves as a way to allow backers to obtain access to perks according to their tier level such as rehearsal edits, autographed printed notes from the entire team, behind the scenes vlogs, and more. By contributing your support to a tier level, you will help to make this project as meaningful and significant as possible. This project serves as a portfolio of the growth that I have made as a human, artist, and educator. The project will include a series of songs, dances, and spoken word that encapsulate my journey and adhere to the overall theme of creating meaningful stories through music, dance, and the arts, to develop a deeper understanding of humanity and to begin a conversation about how to progress our society and culture.

What you Will Help to Achieve 

I hope to empower the younger generation while enlightening the older generation by creating innovative work that inspires audiences to experience catharsis and rekindle the joy and happiness in their lives. I strive to create meaningful, progressive, universal work rooted in education and a cultural understanding of humanity—as it has been and is now. By fulfilling these truths, I can speak and connect to a broad audience, conversing and collaborating with many.

What We Need & What You Get

All funds will go to the support of the project and providing my audience with top quality work. 

I am looking to raise $2000.00 in funding. This funding will go to the professionals, musicians, artists, and collaborators on my team that is helping me to produce the clearest and purposeful vision. This additional funding will allow top quality musicians and sound engineers to create this new kind of virtual theater experience!  Any additional funds raised will go to The Malala Fund to promote arts programs in girls education.

Funding Breakdown:  

  • Professional and Local Audio Engineer 
  • Professional and Local Video Producer 
  • Professional and Local Student Musicians 
  • Renting of Local Locations/Spaces for Recording and Rehearsing 
  • All additional funds will go The Malala Fund to promote arts programs in girls education. 

The Impact

Form, ease, beauty, and a sense of the whole, for the artist's job, create a meaningful and cathartic experience, and teach the audience what they have chosen to forget.

To remind people to always choose love over fear even in the most challenging of times. 

 

Resilient definition – (adjective)

Springing back; rebounding

Returning to the original form or position after being bent, compressed, or

stretched

Recovering readily from illness, depression, adversity, or the like; buoyant

In different periods of our lives, we have moments of struggle; during these struggles, we usually see the most growth, development, and change after experiencing an uncomfortable state. I believe in lifelong learning, and to continue to learn and grow, we must seek love from others and choose resilience.

Risks & Challenges

The project is scheduled to be live-streamed in early December for various entertainment professionals located in LA, New York, and additional locations. I am confident in producing a high-quality experience in such a short amount of time and know that this is a challenge I am willing to take on. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please see my website, social media accounts, or e-mail me for more information! 

Website: samanthahlucas.com 

Instagram: samanthahlucas 

E-mail: samantha.h.lucas@gmail.com 

Please continue to share on social media with your friends and family as well as by word of mouth. 

Let's work together to stay resilient and continue growth in the arts!

story:
About Me:

I am Joi Najae Watts and I am a recording artist, actor and producer currently based in Savannah, Georgia. I am a senior Performing Arts major at Savannah College of Arts and Design and I will be graduating this spring. Music has always been a vital part of my life and watching music come to life through music videos made it even more special to me. That is what I want to do with my new single Solemate beat produced by Diggy Diamond. Solemate is a special piece to me because I am not only speaking of love, but I am also expressing how sometimes not everyone will love you for you, but there will always be that one person who sees and understands your full unique purpose here on earth. I want the music video of Solemate to represent happiness, fun times and not having a care in the world; especially with all that we as humankind have been going through. I want this music video to be not only entertaining, but I want it to pop and stick to your happy place in your mind as so many music videos did for me growing up today and still do. 

Your help towards this project is extremely important to those aspects of the music video. With your help we will be able to make costume design, set design, location and make up standout. The location is an extremely important part to this music video and with your help it will really make my vision come alive. My sole purpose in my music career is to make and see others happy to ignite joy in people's hearts. Which is why this music video will be inclusive of all ethnicities, gender and not only is the music video cast multicultural but so is my team and I. I want younger multicultural audiences that watch this to know they are included, unique and beautiful. We need your help getting our work out there and bringing this sense of happiness to life in picture for this music video.

 

What your contribution will fund:

  • Location: A large portion of the money will be going towards the location which is Star Castle skating rink here in Savannah, Georgia, it is a vital feature for the story and your donation will help to bring the fun, lively, exciting vision to life. 
  • Equipment: We will use the money only for necessary items such as; lighting and camera gear. Your contribution will help us to purchase the best quality equip to convey our message. 
  • Set & Costume Design: Lastly set and costume design. This is definitely and important but also fun part of the music video. Your offering will help us to acquire the finest clothing and set pieces to carry the 70s/80s roller rink look we are shooting for. 

Special Perks as a thank you for your contribution:

In exchange for your kindness I have created and come up with some significant and appreciable gifts that are available to you through your participation in this campaign. Each Perk increases with the amount of money donated. Please take a look at each perk as there are choices as well when you participate. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It is very understandable if you can not contribute and that is no problem at all, if you loved what you read and still want to help you absolutely can by...

  • Sharing this campaign page on your social media
  • Telling your friends and family about it
  • Stream my music or watch my previous music videos and share

​I truly do appreciate everyone who has supported me and continues to support me. It warms my heart to know that people care and are listening. I have a story to tell and this is only the beginning of something great! Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page, I can not wait to share this new song and music video with you all.

story:
Well, hello there!

There is a great expectation we have for this year: to continue reaching our brothers and sisters around the world by being given the opportunity to enter into Praise & Worship with them. In other words, we are working to record an entire album by the end of 2021, and we cannot do it on our own.

In the past couple of years, we have seen walls come down, hearts stirred and lives changed. We have seen how deeply others have been convicted to know Jesus more because of a simple song – and all that we have been a part of has only been possible through the grace of God and the generosity of His people.

So, today, our hope is this: that you might consider joining us on our mission by making a contribution to this campaign.

 

Who We Are

We are a group of friends, musicians, servants, and Catholic worship leaders, otherwise known as Steadfast Worship. We are based in the Archdiocese of Toronto, where we are set on giving back to the place we call ‘home’ – and the Church as a whole – by using our gifts. In praying with songs that glorify God and align hearts with truth, beauty, and goodness, our ministry aims to lead listeners closer to Jesus Christ, and our hope is to inspire the Church by bringing Catholic culture to the forefront of modern Christian music and the world.

Joseph Fabie is a vocalist and songwriter for Steadfast Worship. Joseph was born in the Philippines but has lived in Scarborough, Ontario since his family moved to Canada when he was six years old. Currently, Joseph works as a civil engineer-in-training in a consulting firm where he specializes in building science and restoration. Joseph also grew up pursuing music, performing various genres of music throughout his life - from musical theatre, sacred Catholic music, and his personal favourite, R&B. He discovered Praise & Worship music more recently, but has found in it a beautiful expression of devotion which brings him and those around him to a more intimate relationship with Jesus.

Erica Cinco is one of Steadfast’s vocalists and one-time egg shaker. She’s a recent graduate of a certificate program at George Brown College and is pursuing a career in nursing (Update, she got accepted into her program! Yay PG!) Growing up in a Christian church, she was exposed to praise and worship at a young age and still continues to be moved and formed through music. One significant way praise and worship has helped her grow in her faith was in her reversion to Catholicism. It introduced her to other Catholics who love and desire to grow more deeply in a faith that unceasingly reveals the beauty and love of God through the Church (St. Barnabas familyyyyyy)!

Jacob Kevin is the drummer/percussionist of Steadfast Worship. He was born and raised in Scarborough, Ontario and is currently studying at York University in the Mechanical Engineering program. During his 6th grade at St. Barnabas School, Jacob was asked to play the drums for school mass by his music teacher, where he learned to play Catholic hymns and songs of praise. Since then, using his gifts for praise and worship in youth groups and music ministries has drawn him closer to the heart of God and lead him to want to grow deeper in his faith.

Camille Herrera is a singer and songwriter for Steadfast Worship. She has spent her whole life thus far in Markham and Stouffville, where she has recently wrapped up her time as the youth minister at St. Mark's Catholic Church. In August, she will be moving to Ottawa for a new (full-time missionary!) career as an Events Intern for Catholic Christian Outreach. Camille has been singing since she was taught to read through karaoke, and it was being introduced to praise & worship in grade 7 that led to the recognition of her desire to make her voice a gift, and how beautiful it would be to serve the Lord through it.

Gabe Marania is the main guitarist and bassist of Steadfast Worship. He grew up in Scarborough, Ontario, where he now works as the Music & Media Communications Coordinator at St. Barnabas Roman Catholic Parish, Scarborough. Gabe has served in music ministry for 10 years and it was because of serving in music ministry that drove him into a deeper desire in getting to know the faith more intimately.

 

What We Need (Our Budget)

$15,000 may seem like a steep goal, but we assure you that every dollar that goes into our campaign will be used with purpose and integrity. The following list outlines in detail what your money will be used to help us build Steadfast Worship:

  • Recording Costs - $5650: This covers the costs of studio recording, mixing, and mastering at the rate of at least $500 per song. Moreover, these expenses ensure that we rightfully pay those who work tirelessly in the mixing and mastering process of each track.
  • Album Artwork and Videos - $1000: This covers the commissioning of our artwork, including album design cover, video graphics, photography, and videography.
  • Marketing - $1000: This covers all of the work to create and sustain a website, new merchandise & promotional material for our album.
  • Equipment - $6350: This will include new equipment such as Shure Sm7B Mics, Speakers, Audio Interfaces, stands, cables and wires, which will be used for our live events and recordings. These costs will also cover any needed equipment reparations.
  • Indiegogo - $1000: This covers two of the following Indiegogo fees: 5% commission fee of raised funds in return for the use of their platform,  2.9% payment processing fee, and a $0.30 fee per donation transaction.

 

The Impact

There is an abundance of good that music can do. It is a common topic of conversation. It can heighten the experience of a presentation, or a film, or a moment. Above all this, it can easily bring people together. Paired with the greatest good of the Gospel, we have every confidence that these moments of prayer in Praise & Worship can help to transform the world.

As for you, you have a place in this. If our goal is one that looks to reach souls across the globe, it only makes sense that the way to get there would involve leaning on the support of our brothers and sisters. By backing our campaign, you are helping us to be present for others in one of the greatest ways we know how to, shaping moments of conviction and conversion for others, and choosing to say ‘yes’ to even the possibility of lives being changed.

Here are some testimonies of people we have helped:

"It has been a blessing to have Steadfast lead the worship at our campus ministry events including Adoration nights. They were easy to contact and work with and sought to tailor their style to the unique needs of our theme and venue. They created a soulful, meditative way to enter into prayer with their unique vocal and instrumental duo. I would strongly recommend them for large or small ministry gatherings. In knowing some of the members personally, they provide an amazing example of what is it to throw themselves into the Lord's vineyard and depict an earnest desire to lead others to Christ through their music."

- Erica Figueiredo, Chaplaincy Director, UTSC & Centennial College

"When we were bouncing off ideas on how to best lead our ministry leaders at the parish in worship that would honour the Lord and be memorable for everyone, we knew we wanted Steadfast Worship involved. Aside from being incredibly easy and flexible to work with, Steadfast created a space for us to encounter Jesus. Having Jesus at the centre of it all mattered to us, and you could see that it was the desire of their hearts as well and for that, we are so grateful." 

- Pamela Clerigo, Youth Minister, St. Patrick Parish, Markham

"Steadfast Worship is a young adults music band actively involved in the youth ministry in several Catholic Parishes in the Archdiocese of Toronto. There I've had an opportunity to see and hear them, observing that their singing and even original music flow from ecstatic praise and yet humble yearning for the Lord as, for example, it may be experienced in their song, "Alleluia". I've seen them moving small groups and large masses of young people in humble worship of the Lord while passionately singing His praises. Steadfast Worship, stay humble as you evangelize and inspire new evangelists."

- Fr. Marijan Sisko, Pastor, Corpus Christ Parish, Toronto

 

Risks & Challenges

Okay, let’s lay out all the facts here! Though we might be tired of hearing it, we are still in the middle of a worldwide pandemic. We are setting up this campaign during a time when it could be most difficult for anyone to want to support us. For most of 2020, even we struggled to discern what it was we should be doing. For those of you who were familiar with our ministry before this campaign, you might have noticed that we seemingly disappeared for a time. And, honestly, that is because we did. When COVID-19 hit, every event we were booked for had been cancelled and we had to hit the brakes on recording. We lost opportunities, certainty, and, in some ways, tangible support. We had no idea what the Lord was calling us to do. For months, we found ourselves stuck in an unintended hiatus, and it took a 3-day retreat for us to finally decide to be more intentional in our ministry again.

So, here we are. Though the state of the world is still as it is, with finances fickle and certainty still in question, we know that the Lord is calling us to move. We still want to be present for others. We still want to use our gifts. We still want to serve our Church. All we can do is take the next best step and pray that others might feel compelled to work with us in taking many more.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not every person is going to be able to help financially, and that is okay! Thankfully, there are other ways to get on board:

  • Prayer: Pray for our ministry, the work that we are doing, but especially those in whom we have encountered and those in whom we have yet to meet.
  • Spread the word: Share this campaign with others through word of mouth or on any social media platforms.
  • Follow us: 

Facebook – https://www.facebook.com/steadfast.worship/

Instagram – https://www.instagram.com/steadfast.worship

YouTube – https://www.youtube.com/c/steadfastworship

 

Thank you so much for your time! We appreciate you and all the work that you do for God's Kingdom!

In Christ,

Steadfast Worship
story_txt:
Well, hello there!
There is a great expectation we have for this year: to continue reaching our brothers and sisters around the world by being given the opportunity to enter into Praise & Worship with them. In other words, we are working to record an entire album by the end of 2021, and we cannot do it on our own.
In the past couple of years, we have seen walls come down, hearts stirred and lives changed. We have seen how deeply others have been convicted to know Jesus more because of a simple song – and all that we have been a part of has only been possible through the grace of God and the generosity of His people.
So, today, our hope is this: that you might consider joining us on our mission by making a contribution to this campaign.
 
Who We Are
We are a group of friends, musicians, servants, and Catholic worship leaders, otherwise known as Steadfast Worship. We are based in the Archdiocese of Toronto, where we are set on giving back to the place we call ‘home’ – and the Church as a whole – by using our gifts. In praying with songs that glorify God and align hearts with truth, beauty, and goodness, our ministry aims to lead listeners closer to Jesus Christ, and our hope is to inspire the Church by bringing Catholic culture to the forefront of modern Christian music and the world.
Joseph Fabie is a vocalist and songwriter for Steadfast Worship. Joseph was born in the Philippines but has lived in Scarborough, Ontario since his family moved to Canada when he was six years old. Currently, Joseph works as a civil engineer-in-training in a consulting firm where he specializes in building science and restoration. Joseph also grew up pursuing music, performing various genres of music throughout his life - from musical theatre, sacred Catholic music, and his personal favourite, R&B. He discovered Praise & Worship music more recently, but has found in it a beautiful expression of devotion which brings him and those around him to a more intimate relationship with Jesus.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi everyone :) my name is Sophie Munger, I am a musician looking for a bit of help to record my first album & to get things going...

I started teaching myself to play guitar in 2017 so I could turn my poetry into music. I worked full time in social care for several years, until spring time 2020 when I gave more of my attention to my artwork. I am currently training in youth work, specialising in art and music. I want to start performing more so I can earn a better income.

So... I have written lots of songs and am ready to share them, starting with my first album of 5 songs, which I am aiming to complete by the end of 2021.

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

To record my first album I need £750 (approx quote from my producer).

For performance/ amplification equipment including portable speakers, a microphone & stand, an amplification pick-up for my guitar, cables, and a loop station, I need £750 (approx.).

So I am aiming to raise £1,500 all together...

Please see the 'perks' section to see incentives I am offering to donators!

 

The Impact

 

Buying this equipment will enable me to perform street gigs, venue gigs, and festival gigs. Recording an album means that I can sell copies wherever I perform and share my music with a wider audience online. These things will enable me to make a living doing what I love.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

I’d be very grateful if people shared this campaign across social media and emailed their grannies about it.
