story:
Who Am I?

Hey everyone! My name is Emily Groff, and if you know me you know I love music. By the time I was ten years old, I was already writing songs on wide-ruled school paper about the crazy world of a fourth grader using the few chords I knew. As I grew up, my music grew up with me. It became the way I processed the world around me and the more I learned about it the more I wanted to dive in head first. 

I grew up in Miami Beach, FL, playing saxophone in my school bands and songleading in Jewish youth group. I attended URJ Camp Coleman and URJ Kutz Camp as a camper and was heavily involved in my youth group and NFTY-STR. Through my band experience, I found a love of ensemble playing and teaching music. Through my experiences in the Jewish community, I found a deeper connection to Judaism and a passion for creating community. This led to Vanderbilt University where I studied music education and led services at Hillel. I have spent amazing summers songleading at URJ Camp Coleman, URJ Six Points Sports Academy, and Gordon JCC Camp Davis. Today, I am an elementary music teacher, songleader, and songwriter based in Nashville, TN. Between working as a music teacher and working in the Jewish community here, I feel so lucky to be in a place where I get to do what I love everyday. 

This EP- Breathe

Music is not just the way I process my world, but also the way I process and connect to Judaism. The four Jewish songs on Breathe are inspired by how I have related common experiences and emotions to Judaism through music. 

Hashkiveinu- A desire for not just physical but also mental and emotional protection.

Shiru- Celebration. Music is how I celebrate. 

Lo Yisa Goy- An outcry for unity.

Ahavat Olam- Having someone by your side, through good and bad times.

The namesake of the EP, Breathe, is about my struggles with performance anxiety. This song is included because without the events that inspired this song, this EP could not have happened. My performance anxiety began in college, and while it started in my solo saxophone performance, it bled into things like songleading and public speaking. My love of performing and being in front of a group gradually diminished and I started to dread doing it. My senior year, I had a professor tell me “you play the tenor saxophone like you love it” and I remember thinking “man, why can’t I just play it and feel that love”? I had a songwriting final due the next day, that line went into the first line of the chorus, and with the writing of that song I finally decided to work towards dealing with my performance anxiety and getting back out there. Life can be unexpected, scary, and have many twists and turns. It can feel so much easier to turn around than continue, even if you’re so close to where you want to go. Always remember to breathe, and keep going.

story:
Short Summary

    From Korea to New York, playful jazz music recorded by world-class pros to light up your world!

    This was a miracle recording opportunity, out of the blue, at the perfect time⁠—a dream come true! It was an honor and a thrill to record with these world-renown NY jazz cats! :D 

    KAREN LYU JAZZ EXPERIENCE CD

    bass - Lonnie Plaxico (Chet Baker) - www.lonnieplaxico.com
    drums - Mike Melito (Danilo Perez) - www.mikemelito.com
    piano - Misha Tsiganov (Clark Terry) - www.mishajazz.com
    vocals/solo piano - Karen Lyu (Soli Hughes) - www.karenlyu.com
    producer/recording engineer - Dave Anderson - www.saxonrecording.com
    CD cover artist - Ta-Coumba Aiken - www.facebook.com/tacoumba
    photographer - Fred Sanfilipo

    KAREN LYU JAZZ EXPERIENCE NY BAND BIOS

    http://tiny.cc/KarenLyuJazzExpBios 


    PRESS RELEASE
    https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-VX4jsyhwUU... 


    ABOUT KAREN
    Karen Lyu swings, scats and soulfully savors heartfelt, brave and quirky songs about life, love, and things that matter. Her music is touched by jazz, folk, pop, funk, Motown, '80s, Broadway, classical, Latin, world music, and Korean songs. Her vocal jazz inspirations include Ella Fitzgerald, Janis Siegel (Manhattan Transfer), Sarah Vaughan, Nina Simone, Dee Dee Bridgewater, Eva Cassidy, Youn Sun Nah, Robert Robinson, and Bobby McFerrin.

    Born in Seoul, Korea, Karen grew up with her struggling immigrant family in the US (CA, TX, and MN), got a Jazz Studies degree at Cornell College in IA, sang throughout the Midwest, and now sings in South Korea. She's sung with 12 groups, including the Karen Lyu & Fresh Jazz, Ben and Karen Duo, Yoo and Karen Duo, Karen Lyu & Global Jazz, Morris Wilson Band, Pacha Mamas, Bomba, Via Brasil, Minneapolis Community College Gospel Choir (now called Twin Cities Community Gospel Choir), Karen Lyu Quartet, Jazz Transit, and Eddie Piccard Trio since 1993 and also with Soli Hughes (Sounds of Blackness), Devon Evans (Bob Marley), and Bruce A. Henry (Roberta Flack). Karen’s singing has been featured on National Public Radio, Democracy Now, film, TV, radio, cable and all kinds of stages. She's also traveled and performed in Korea, Europe, Central America, Southeast Asia, and Brazil.

    HONORS
    2016-present #1 Jazz Artist in South Korea - Reverbnation.com
    2010 MusiCares/Grammy Foundation emergency grant
    2010 NashvilleMuse.com Songwriter of the Week
    2007 Minnesota State Arts Board grant with vocalist/performer, Maryam Yusefzadeh
    2007 West Bank School of Music Recognition Award for my work as Executive Director
    2007 3rd Prize Nye's Polonaise Polish Idol Competition
    2007 1st Prize Jitters Karaoke Contest
    2006 Nomination for Best Arts Article for the National Ethnic Media Awards
    2004 Samsung sponsorship gala performance in Austin, TX
    2003 KFAI-FM Top 5 Most Played CDs of the Week: Karen Lyu & Global Jazz Live! CD
    1995 Dayton's Department Store Artists Grant 

    DISCOGRAPHY
    Karen Lyu & Fresh Jazz (2009) - https://store.cdbaby.com/artist/KarenLyuFreshJazz
    Karen Lyu & Global Jazz Live! (2003) - https://store.cdbaby.com/cd/globaljazz

    Artist Statement: I am a 48-year-old Korean-American jazz singer/songwriter who loves to create unforgettable performances with playful exploration and authentic power.

    Core Values: Exploration, Authenticity, Faith, Adaptable, Unforgettable

    Fact: From age 2 to age 4, I loved to go up to perfect strangers and sing to them! I became shy after immigrating to the US and getting bullied, but became more animated and courageous again after finding jazz at age 16!

    Help Me Make History:  2019  has been a break-out year for Asian-Americans. After roughly 25 years as a struggling artist, with some modest success, I believe it's great timing for my break-out, too!
     

    HOW DOES A WALLFLOWER BECOME AN AWARD-WINNING JAZZ VOCALIST?
    Toastmasters Icebreaker Speech by Karen Lyu (2x Toastmasters Best Speaker award)​https://docs.google.com/document/d/10npN7v52IWZ... 


      CLASSIC CONCEPT - 8 Great Songs + 1 Original Piano Solo

      *  Recorded live in the studio with a classic approach, using vintage microphones by Neumann, RCA, and Altec, from the golden age of recording!
      *  All the songs were recorded live in the studio within 10 hours⁠—with no overdubs!
      * The Baldwin grand piano was the same one used by The Fray for the recording and the music video for their platinum single "How to Save a Life"!


      KAREN LYU JAZZ EXPERIENCE CD/VINYL RECORD 

      Ain't Misbehavin' - playful, sassy swing tune by Fats Waller
      ​Autumn Leaves - dramatic and reminiscent song—with a swinging middle section made famous by Nat King Cole
      God Bless the Child -  bluesy 12/8 shuffle written by Billie Holiday
      Feeling Good - soulful Nina Simone favorite with a twist 
      Moon River - light, wistful jazz waltz originally sung by Audrey Hepburn
      Stand By Me - an original take on the Ben E. King Motown classic with R&B vocals
      Stormy Monday - gritty blues by T-Bone Walker
      Cry (If You Want To) - a defiant, powerful and cheeky song about crying by Casey Scott
      Changes with Time - a beautiful original piano solo by Karen
       

      Story Behind the Karen Lyu Jazz Experience CD

        Why did I fly from South Korea to New York to record this special CD?

        It's quite a story!!!

        It starts in 1995. I was starting my jazz career in Minneapolis, MN, but I was considering moving to New York City, because things weren't going so well, being a newbie Korean-American jazz singer in MN who just graduated in 1993 with a BSS in Jazz Studies from Cornell College in IA. So, I decided to check out NYC.


        Amazingly, my old college roommate, Naomi, worked with the mother-in-law of legendary actor, Nathan Purdee, who played Hank Gannon on the soap opera, One Life to Live, and she put in a good word for me! So, I got to house-sit his extra NYC apartment with my high-school friend, Jenny. I had a nice, healthy lunch with Nathan, and he amazingly took me on the set of One Life to Live and introduced me to everyone, which was unforgettable!!!

        While in New York, I had dinner with Ravi Coltrane (son of John Coltrane)—who I met in Minneapolis 3 weeks prior, when he played with veteran jazz pianist, Joanne Brackeen, at the Dakota. I asked him about his dreams, and he mentioned that Lonnie Plaxico was his favorite bassist, but that he was too green and doubted that Lonnie would ever play with him?! I encouraged him, but he was humble. Lonnie has played with multiple Grammy-award-winners, including Cassandra Wilson, Art Blakey, Chet Baker, Dexter Gordon, and Wynton Marsalis!!!

        Two days later, I went with my friend, Jenny, to Birdland. And, Lonnie just happened to be playing there! So I gave Lonnie Ravi's number, and they have gigged, recorded and toured together a number of times over the years since then!!!

        I went back to Minneapolis, got a day job, started my Karen Lyu & Global Jazz band, and never returned to New York. But, Lonnie kept in touch with me about once a year, by phone or email. Then, he found me on MySpace and we later connected on Facebook, when I lived in Nashville, and he always remembered to wish me a happy birthday!

        Suddenly, last November, Lonnie called to let me know that he was flying to Seoul, where I live now, to perform with Cassandra Wilson!!! I tried to see him perform with Cassandra Wilson in Minnesota before, but he wasn't playing with her at that time. Sadly, we missed each other again due to circumstances beyond our control. I was despondent, but Lonnie said, "We'll meet in New York, someday. Don't worry!"

        Then, out of the blue, 3 months later, Dave Anderson, a renown Rochester, NY producer/recording engineer/songwriter/and radio show host friended me on Facebook based on our mutual platinum award-winning songwriter friend, Roy August, in Nashville, TN. After a few video chats about songwriting and potentially recording vocals of his original songs in Seoul, Dave bought and listened to my Karen Lyu & Fresh Jazz CD. And, he was so inspired that he generously invited me to record a new CD on spec at his dream recording studio, which he was building in Rochester, NY!!!

        The first thing I did was contact Lonnie Plaxico, who offered to record with me for free. (minus room, board, and airfare)!!! And, it was on!!!

        Miraculously, the resources suddenly appeared in my life to not only make this unexpected recording opportunity happen, but also to fund a 3-City US Birthday Tour!!! The music tour took me to Minneapolis, MN to perform with my former Global Jazz band members, to Nashville, TN to perform with my former Fresh Jazz band members, to NY to record at Saxon Recording in Rochester, NY, and also to New York City to perform at Rockwood Music Hall with Lonnie and world-class NYC jazz cats!!! It was great to see old friends and fans, and meet new fans!!

        In 1996, I woke up in the middle of the night from a vivid dream of touring with amazing international musicians wearing colorful clothes, that I designed, for a huge and lively audience in Brazil! Please help me on the path to making this dream come true! My ex-boyfriend remembers and believes in me still!


        IN MEMORIAM

        In loving memory of my Auntie Yeon-ok Kim, my Second Mom, who believed in me and my music. She died on Saturday, May 18th. Also, in loving memory of my SuperFan Friend, Janet Johnson, who was one of my biggest supporters in Minnesota of all my creative endeavors. She died of cancer on Saturday, May 25th.

        PRESS RELEASE
        https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-VX4jsyhwUU... 

        HOW DOES A WALLFLOWER BECOME AN AWARD-WINNING JAZZ VOCALIST?
        Toastmasters Icebreaker Speech by Karen Lyu
        (2x Toastmasters Best Speaker award-winner)​https://docs.google.com/document/d/10npN7v52IWZ... 

           

          CD Release Concert - 7pm Sat, Dec 7th @ I Have a Dream

          The Karen Lyu Jazz Experience CD Release Concert, with hot Seoul musicians will be celebrated on Saturday, 12/07/2019  7pm-8:30pm at the Anthony-Bourdain-lauded restaurant/jazz club, I Have a Dream, South Korea, Seoul, Gangnam-gu, Yeoksam-dong, Teheran-ro 5-gil, 7 KG Tower B1.

          SEOUL MUSICIANS (top award-winning Korean jazz musicians!!)

          piano - SeolKi Lim
          https://www.facebook.com/slki0619

          drums - Dukwon Seo
          https://www.facebook.com/dukwon.seo

          bass - ByeongJoon Kim
          https://www.instagram.com/jjjun_n/

          @ I Have a Dream - Trip Advisor Reviews:
          https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g...

          RSVP here: 
          http://tiny.cc/KLJazzExperienceCDConcert


          MORE INFO

          www.holisticvoicecoach.com
          www.karenlyu.com
          www.backstage.com/u/karenlyu
          www.facebook.com/karenlyu  
          www.linkedin.com/in/karenlyu
          www.instagram.com/karenlyu
          www.twitter.com/karenlyu

          bass - Lonnie Plaxico (Chet Baker) - www.lonnieplaxico.com
          drums - Mike Melito (James Moody) - www.mikemelito.com
          piano - Misha Tsiganov (Clark Terry) - www.mishajazz.com
          vocals/solo piano - Karen Lyu (Soli Hughes) - www.karenlyu.com
          producer/recording engineer - Dave Anderson - www.saxonrecording.com
          CD cover artist - Ta-Coumba Aiken - www.facebook.com/tacoumba


          What We Need 

          We need US$5,000.

          $1000 - CD manufacturing/packaging/design, etc.
          $1000 - New website, photos, copyrights, codes, distribution, etc.
          $3000 - Music video/Advertising/PR

          To get to the next level of music, we need next-level professional materials and promotion. 
           

          The Impact

          • Music is powerful and lifts us all through dark times and helps us to celebrate the good times. Music therapy is good for your mind, body, and soul. I thank God that music has helped me recover from the darkest times of my life, when I considered taking my own life. We made this music to be a light to the world and to every person who hears it! Maybe it could help save your life, too!
          • I can't tell you how much your support would mean to me. Without the support of friends and fans like you, I wouldn't be where I am today. Your support will enable me to fulfill my potential as a jazz vocalist and a human being to spread wonderful music around the world!
             

          Risks

          There will be no risk to you. You should receive any items that you choose to pre-order, no matter what happens. All the Karen Lyu Jazz Experience CDs, mugs, vinyl records, and limited edition prints will be made-to-order one at a time and shipped within 3 days. All previously made items are currently sitting in a box in Tennessee, waiting to be shipped.

          NOTE: Should an item get damaged during shipping, please email me at karenlyu@gmail.com to get the damaged item replaced.

           

          Other Ways You Can Help

          I realize that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

          • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social media!
          • You can sign up for emails and forward them with your friends!
          • You can like the videos and post comments!
          • You can friend me on Facebook, or follow me on Instagram or Twitter!

          Any effort is appreciated!

           

          What Happened & What's Next

            http://tiny.cc/KarenLyuJazzCDPostIGG
story_txt:
Short Summary


From Korea to New York, playful jazz music recorded by world-class pros to light up your world!This was a miracle recording opportunity, out of the blue, at the perfect time⁠—a dream come true! It was an honor and a thrill to record with these world-renown NY jazz cats! :D KAREN LYU JAZZ EXPERIENCE CDbass - Lonnie Plaxico (Chet Baker) - www.lonnieplaxico.comdrums - Mike Melito (Danilo Perez) - www.mikemelito.compiano - Misha Tsiganov (Clark Terry) - www.mishajazz.comvocals/solo piano - Karen Lyu (Soli Hughes) - www.karenlyu.comproducer/recording engineer - Dave Anderson - www.saxonrecording.comCD cover artist - Ta-Coumba Aiken - www.facebook.com/tacoumbaphotographer - Fred SanfilipoKAREN LYU JAZZ EXPERIENCE NY BAND BIOS
http://tiny.cc/KarenLyuJazzExpBios 

PRESS RELEASEhttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1-VX4jsyhwUU... 
ABOUT KARENKaren Lyu swings, scats and soulfully savors heartfelt, brave and quirky songs about life, love, and things that matter. Her music is touched by jazz, folk, pop, funk, Motown, '80s, Broadway, classical, Latin, world music, and Korean songs. Her vocal jazz inspirations include Ella Fitzgerald, Janis Siegel (Manhattan Transfer), Sarah Vaughan, Nina Simone, Dee Dee Bridgewater, Eva Cassidy, Youn Sun Nah, Robert Robinson, and Bobby McFerrin.
Born in Seoul, Korea, Karen grew up with her struggling immigrant family in the US (CA, TX, and MN), got a Jazz Studies degree at Cornell College in IA, sang throughout the Midwest, and now sings in South Korea. She's sung with 12 groups, including the Karen Lyu & Fresh Jazz, Ben and Karen Duo, Yoo and Karen Duo, Karen Lyu & Global Jazz, Morris Wilson Band, Pacha Mamas, Bomba, Via Brasil, Minneapolis Community College Gospel Choir (now called Twin Cities Community Gospel Choir), Karen Lyu Quartet, Jazz Transit, and Eddie Piccard Trio since 1993 and also with Soli Hughes (Sounds of Blackness), Devon Evans (Bob Marley), and Bruce A. Henry (Roberta Flack). Karen’s singing has been featured on National Public Radio, Democracy Now, film, TV, radio, cable and all kinds of stages. She's also traveled and performed in Korea, Europe, Central America, Southeast Asia, and Brazil.HONORS2016-present #1 Jazz Artist in South Korea - Reverbnation.com2010 MusiCares/Grammy Foundation emergency grant2010 NashvilleMuse.com Songwriter of the Week2007 Minnesota State Arts Board grant with vocalist/performer, Maryam Yusefzadeh2007 West Bank School of Music Recognition Award for my work as Executive Director2007 3rd Prize Nye's Polonaise Polish Idol Competition2007 1st Prize Jitters Karaoke Contest2006 Nomination for Best Arts Article for the National Ethnic Media Awards2004 Samsung sponsorship gala performance in Austin, TX2003 KFAI-FM Top 5 Most Played CDs of the Week: Karen Lyu & Global Jazz Live! CD1995 Dayton's Department Store Artists Grant DISCOGRAPHYKaren Lyu & Fresh Jazz (2009) - https://store.cdbaby.com/artist/KarenLyuFreshJazzKaren Lyu & Global Jazz Live! (2003) - https://store.cdbaby.com/cd/globaljazzArtist Statement: I am a 48-year-old Korean-American jazz singer/songwriter who loves to create unforgettable performances with playful exploration and authentic power.Core Values: Exploration, Authenticity, Faith, Adaptable, Unforgettable
Fact: From age 2 to age 4, I loved to go up to perfect strangers and sing to them! I became shy after immigrating to the US and getting bullied, but became more animated and courageous again after finding jazz at age 16!Help Me Make History:  2019  has been a break-out year for Asian-Americans. After roughly 25 years as a struggling artist, with some modest success, I believe it's great timing for my break-out, too! 

HOW DOES A WALLFLOWER BECOME AN AWARD-WINNING JAZZ VOCALIST?Toastmasters Icebreaker Speech by Karen Lyu (2x Toastmasters Best Speaker award)​https://docs.google.com/document/d/10npN7v52IWZ... 


CLASSIC CONCEPT - 8 Great Songs + 1 Original Piano Solo
*  Recorded live in the studio with a classic approach, using vintage microphones by Neumann, RCA, and Altec, from the golden age of recording!*  All the songs were recorded live in the studio within 10 hours⁠—with no overdubs!* The Baldwin grand piano was the same one used by The Fray for the recording and the music video for their platinum single "How to Save a Life"!KAREN LYU JAZZ EXPERIENCE CD/VINYL RECORD 
Ain't Misbehavin' - playful, sassy swing tune by Fats Waller​Autumn Leaves - dramatic and reminiscent song—with a swinging middle section made famous by Nat King ColeGod Bless the Child -  bluesy 12/8 shuffle written by Billie HolidayFeeling Good - soulful Nina Simone favorite with a twist Moon River - light, wistful jazz waltz originally sung by Audrey HepburnStand By Me - an original take on the Ben E. King Motown classic with R&B vocalsStormy Monday - gritty blues by T-Bone WalkerCry (If You Want To) - a defiant, powerful and cheeky song about crying by Casey ScottChanges with Time - a beautiful original piano solo by Karen

story:
Adam's Third Album!

I am so excited to start work on my new Adam Hawley album, which will be finished in early 2020.  The first two were made with contributions from crowdfunding, and they would not have been the same without your generous help.  If you choose to contribute, not only will you receive the album before it is released but you can also take part in several different and exciting reward options.  Thank you in advance for your consideration and support!

 

The Impact

Your contribution will be integral in the success of this record.  There are many costs associated with making an album such as:

  • Recording costs-studio time, musicians, mastering
  • Promotional costs-radio, print, internet campaigns
  • Photo/video shoot

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support financial, you could be a huge help in the following ways:

  • Follow me on social media (Facebook, Instagram, etc.)
  • Sign up for my mailing list
  • Share this campaign and let people know

Thank you so much!

story:
UPDATE: This album will be made regardless.  Your contributions will help give it more "polish and push" :)

What is this about?

Greetings!  I don't want to make a huge scrolling page so I will make this as brief as possible!

  • I am Jordan Aguirre, aka bLiNd and have been producing electronic music for 20 years now.
  • This campaign is about supporting THE album by bLiNd, this is the big one.  Basically I make an album every 2 weeks of standard dance music and release on my bandcamp but now I want to really get creative and try something completely new and different.  The style I am choosing is a genre that literally just blipped on the radar for a brief time in the 90s.  The Chemical Brothers, The Prodigy, The Crystal Method, Propellerheads, Future Sound of London and Leftfield were all huge influences on me growing up thanks to the Hackers Movie soundtracks and Wipeout XL for the Playstation.  I was only 14-16 when the sound was hot but it was MEGA inspiring.  So I want to revive it in my own way!
  • This could be bigger than I expect mainly because the style would be new to many ears and I plan on pushing it a lot more than I do my other music.

 

If you are a fan of Fat of the Land by The Prodigy, Dig Your Own Hole by Chemical Brothers, Vegas by Crystal Method, The Hackers Soundtracks, Wipeout XL Soundtrack etc, then this campaign is for you, most definitely.  Even if you aren't a huge fan of the styles, the perks may be worth it as I am offering my entire catalog to backers.

What I Need & What You Get

I need at least $5,000 to cover the costs to produce this album

  • $1,000 Minimum goes to Marketing and ADs
  • $1,000 for Mastering
  • $2,000 for Hiring other Musicians and Vocalists
  • $1,000 for Extra Artwork

If you back me, you get things!

EVERYONE that joins gets access to livestreams and the songs as I finish them.  On the completion of the indiegogo campaign, most perks will be delivered including the tracks that are already completed (currently 3.5)

  • $1 gets you an album off my bandcamp (and the first single off the album immediately)
  • $5 gets you 5 albums off my bandcamp  (and the first single of the album immediately)
  • $10 gets you the above plus the digital release of the album
  • $20 gets you the above plus the physical release of the album (CD)
  • $75 gets you the above all above plus a Vinyl copy
  • $100 gets you all the above plus my entire 2019 release list (nearly 30 releases/20 albums as a download)
  • $200 gets you all the above plus my ENTIRE discography (http://blindhandicap.bandcamp.com)
  • $250 gets you all the above plus every CD I have released (28 cds total)
  • $750 gets you all the above plus every Vinyl I have released (10 vinyls total, 28 cds total :O

I won't be signing these as it adds 3 extra steps to shipping and processing.  

The Impact

  • This album could potentially help revive a sound that has been lost in time!
  • I will be marketing through Move Music Distribution, who is my publisher, and they are plugged into big names in the dance music industry which could give it the boost it needs to be truly heard by people into the sound.
  • I will be crafting every song from scratch, no sample packs or presets, as there isn't much in the style anyway. 
  • I will be using HARDWARE for the sounds (because it's more fun and some of it truly sounds magical compared to software sources)

Risks & Challenges

I currently have NO jobs I am working on (just finished 2 game soundtracks) so this campaign is a bit of a need as well.  If it doesn't succeed I may have to cancel the project for the moment and refocus my energies

  • I WILL deliver the album as promised probably within just a few months as I work EXTREMELY fast. 
  • The more support I get the more polished the album will be most likely.  I will hire original vocalists and artists to help bring the vision to life.
  • Even if the campaign doesn't reach the goal, anything helps as this is a flexible campaign (not fixed) so don't think your contribution won't be acknowledge or appreciated.  This album will be made regardless of this funding and will be marketed as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, I appreciate you telling those that would be interested!

  • Resharing helps me TONS!
  • Share using the indiegogo share tools!

Why is bLiNd qualified to do this?

Well, that's a good question!

I currently have 50 albums completed under my alias bLiNd with 4 of them being game soundtracks of released and unreleased video games.

Most can be found here > http://blindhandicap.bandcamp.com

The released game? KLANG!

https://store.steampowered.com/app/412660/Klang/

I did over 35 tracks for this title as well as nearly 1000 sfx for the game and it's cinematics. 

I also have been remixing videogame music into electronic music online since 2002 under this alias on OCReMiX

https://ocremix.org/artist/4440/blind

Later on this lead me to releasing a few videogame cover remix albums on the record label "GameChops"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3cwgZ3ob3w0&amp...

And the founder of Impact Soundworks (a sample library company) has this to say

https://twitter.com/zirconst/status/11957816608...

WAIT! WHAT DOES IT SOUND LIKE?

https://soundcloud.com/blindedm/self-titled-ele...

 

<3 bLiNd

This campaign is about supporting THE album by bLiNd, this is the big one.  Basically I make an album every 2 weeks of standard dance music and release on my bandcamp but now I want to really get creative and try something completely new and different.  The style I am choosing is a genre that literally just blipped on the radar for a brief time in the 90s.  The Chemical Brothers, The Prodigy, The Crystal Method, Propellerheads, Future Sound of London and Leftfield were all huge influences on me growing up thanks to the Hackers Movie soundtracks and Wipeout XL for the Playstation.  I was only 14-16 when the sound was hot but it was MEGA inspiring.  So I want to revive it in my own way!
This could be bigger than I expect mainly because the style would be new to many ears and I plan on pushing it a lot more than I do my other music.

 
If you are a fan of Fat of the Land by The Prodigy, Dig Your Own Hole by Chemical Brothers, Vegas by Crystal Method, The Hackers Soundtracks, Wipeout XL Soundtrack etc, then this campaign is for you, most definitely.  Even if you aren't a huge fan of the styles, the perks may be worth it as I am offering my entire catalog to backers.

What I Need & What You Get
I need at least $5,000 to cover the costs to produce this album

$1,000 Minimum goes to Marketing and ADs
$1,000 for Mastering
$2,000 for Hiring other Musicians and Vocalists
$1,000 for Extra Artwork

If you back me, you get things!
EVERYONE that joins gets access to livestreams and the songs as I finish them.  On the completion of the indiegogo campaign, most perks will be delivered including the tracks that are already completed (currently 3.5)

$1 gets you an album off my bandcamp (and the first single off the album immediately)
$5 gets you 5 albums off my bandcamp  (and the first single of the album immediately)
$10 gets you the above plus the digital release of the album
$20 gets you the above plus the physical release of the album (CD)
$75 gets you the above all above plus a Vinyl copy
$100 gets you all the above plus my entire 2019 release list (nearly 30 releases/20 albums as a download)
$200 gets you all the above plus my ENTIRE discography (http://blindhandicap.bandcamp.com)
$250 gets you all the above plus every CD I have released (28 cds total)
$750 gets you all the above plus every Vinyl I have released (10 vinyls total, 28 cds total :O

I won't be signing these as it adds 3 extra steps to shipping and processing.  

The Impact

This album could potentially help revive a sound that has been lost in time!
I will be marketing through Move Music Distribution, who is my publisher, and they are plugged into big names in the dance music industry which could give it the boost it needs to be truly heard by people into the sound.
I will be crafting every song from scratch, no sample packs or presets, as there isn't much in the style anyway. 
I will be using HARDWARE for the sounds (because it's more fun and some of it truly sounds magical compared to software sources)



Risks & Challenges
I currently have NO jobs I am working on (just finished 2 game soundtracks) so this campaign is a bit of a need as well.  If it doesn't succeed I may have to cancel the project for the moment and refocus my energies

I WILL deliver the album as promised probably within just a few months as I work EXTREMELY fast. 
The more support I get the more polished the album will be most likely.  I will hire original vocalists and artists to help bring the vision to life.
Even if the campaign doesn't reach the goal, anything helps as this is a flexible campaign (not fixed) so don't think your contribution won't be acknowledge or appreciated.  This album will be made regardless of this funding and will be marketed as well!


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, I appreciate you telling those that would be interested!

Resharing helps me TONS!
Share using the indiegogo share tools!

Why is bLiNd qualified to do this?Well, that's a good question!I currently have 50 albums completed under my alias bLiNd with 4 of them being game soundtracks of released and unreleased video games.Most can be found here > http://blindhandicap.bandcamp.comThe released game? KLANG!https://store.steampowered.com/app/412660/Klang/I did over 35 tracks for this title as well as nearly 1000 sfx for the game and it's cinematics. I also have been remixing videogame music into electronic music online since 2002 under this alias on OCReMiXhttps://ocremix.org/artist/4440/blindLater on this lead me to releasing a few videogame cover remix albums on the record label "GameChops"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3cwgZ3ob3w0&amp...And the founder of Impact Soundworks (a sample library company) has this to sayhttps://twitter.com/zirconst/status/11957816608...WAIT! WHAT DOES IT SOUND LIKE?https://soundcloud.com/blindedm/self-titled-ele... <3 bLiNd

story:
Namaste friends

My name is Shyan. I’ve been passionate about playing musical instruments since the age of eleven. I discovered and deeply connected with the Indian Classical Bansuri Flute 24 years ago. I was super lucky to be accepted by my teacher, the renowned Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia and have been receiving his blessing ever since. 

Since 1996 I’ve been dedicated to the musician path whole heartedly as a solo and collaborative artist and experiencing the great fortune of working globally with amazing musicians and dancers on countless exciting projects. 

This Crowdfunding campaign is a very essential bridge for me to achieve a goal which I am extremely passionate about. To experience the completion of two of the best albums I have ever made. With your help I believe that this project will open doors to opportunities that I have been dreaming about for many years. 

Thanks to you I shall at last able to present something that really represents so many years of unwavering devotion and dedication to my musical service. I can then approach other musicians whom I greatly admire with confidence and increase my experience of performing in venues with professional setups. 

The money you are giving me will only be spent for this album project. Partially covering the cost of the studio rental, mixing and mastering, cover design and contributory guest artists.

You will have the exclusivity of having these albums in digital format and listening to them first. 

Here is a breakdown of the cost required for creating such albums.

+ Studio Rental for 6 months - £3500

+ Graphic design, mixing and mastering - £1500 

Additional also for guests artists. 

I am happy to offer you these albums in return for your kind support. And your donations are extremely welcome. 

I am certain that when considering how much love has gone into them, that you shall surely feel their therapeutic benefits and be joyfully uplifted. 

Musicians and many such performing artists have been extremely challenged by a sudden change in their circumstances recently, such as all performance events being cancelled. 

For those such as myself who live only from such a trade, we have to adapt and see this as an opportunity to discover ways, such as this crowdfunding campaign, that enable us to remain true to our heart and continue to be at service as channels of creative expression. 

In my case, rather than challenged, I feel blessed to have had this time to fully immerse myself in the creation of these albums. 

And to add, I totally understand if you cannot contribute financially. So if this project inspires and excites you, please just like it, post and share it. (You can use the Indiegogo share tools also).

We are a global community. Sharing our skills and encouraging one another to do so is a beautiful attitude which cultivates and nourishes the heart. 

Thank you

story:
WOW!!! What an exciting finish to the campaign!

With ALL MY HEART I wish to thank everyone who helped to make this campaign a success. It feels like such an incredible gift to have £10,038 to start producing this album...

Although the campaign on Indiegogo is now closed, if you missed it – don’t panic! You didn’t miss out!! As I am still in need of the remaining 16% of my funding goal, I would be delighted to receive any further pre orders of the album, perks or contributions privately: You can contact me at elise@eliseyuill.com to arrange this.

For now, it's time for me to start making the most beautiful album I can... and I can’t wait for you all to hear it!

  “A unique soulful voice blended with a deep crafted acoustic style” Glastonbury Festival 2015


The Story So Far

Since the release of my debut EP, I’ve spent the last 18 months writing and gigging at venues and festivals across the UK. Along the way I’ve written a collection of new songs which share stories of my life and the people I’ve met.

Everything has aligned beautifully for these new songs to be made into a full length album, so I can share them with more people than ever before. The last thing I need is the financial support. So I am now looking for help to manifest this dream and I believe that with your contribution we can make this happen!


My heart and soul has gone into writing these songs and also into forging this path as a singer-songwriter. To be at this amazing turning point in my life is quite incredible. 

I'm over the moon about the prospect of being able to record this album with the amazing team of people that are standing by to accompany me on this journey with their talents and support. This includes my producer Pete Miles: (http://www.petermiles.com/) and the formation of a brand new band of accompanying musicians.

My vision for this album is to be able to decorate these recordings with additional instruments to create a sound which I feel pays true testimony to the depth and vibrancy of each songs’ narrative. By including the beautiful sounds of a range of instruments such as the cello, violin and banjo to accompany my voice and guitar, I intend to produce an honest and heartfelt album with an alternative fresh “new folk” finish.


What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise £12,000 - which would cover everything I would ideally like to do involved with recording and releasing this album independently, including paying my musicians the fair wage that there deserve after doing so much for me for free over the years, and a Marketing & PR budget to sufficiently promote the album.

The breakdown of these costs is:

  • Recording, mixing and mastering (including musicians fees) - £6000
  • CD Production & distribution - £1,500
  • Marketing & PR - £1000
  • Artwork, Design & Video expenses - £1,450
  • Campaign support team (10%) - £1,200
  • Indiegogo (5%) & Paypal fees (2%) - £850

If you would like to take part and help turn this dream into a reality, you can make a contribution to the campaign by pre-ordering the CD or choosing from another one of the special edition perks - see right hand column of this Indiegogo webpage. Any donation would be a huge help! 


Staying Connected to My Project

Throughout the whole project I will be sending out regular email updates from the Indiegogo website to everyone who contributes to the campaign; with photos, videos and blogs that document my progress. You will be able to see how the rehearsals with the new band unfold, check out our days in the recording studio in and hear about any other exciting announcement I have to share! I really want you to feel like you are taking part in this process with me!


Other Ways You Can Help

If donating money isn’t an option at this time, that's ok! Simply sharing this webpage with your friends in an email, or on facebook and other social media sites would be wonderful!!!

Thank you so much for taking part, words don't seem to express quite how grateful and hopeful I am for this opportunity.

Elise x

 “Elise Yuill marries positive humanist lyrics to a fresh "new folk” sound. With crystal vocals and beautifully crafted guitar arrangements, she illuminates the human condition with the wisdom of a seasoned soul. Can’t wait for her new album!” - Howard Jones

story:
Aloha,  We are dedicated to blues exposition and education in the State of Hawaii and beyond.

We will bring Fruteland Jackson here to teach his Blues In The Schools Program.  It is our intention to conduct our local competition for The International Blues Challenge and help finance our winner's trip to Memphis.  Part of our mission will include helping the great Blues Musicians in the State of Hawaii bring their music to the rest of the world.  Mahalo for helping bring The Blues to this remote part of the planet !!

Good Blues To You,

Bobby Ray Bishop

story:
What We Need & What You Get

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise £8,000 - which would cover everything involved with recording and releasing this album independently, including a Marketing & PR budget to sufficiently promote the album.

The breakdown of these costs is:

  • Recording, mixing and mastering - £1500
  • CD Production & distribution - £1300
  • Marketing & PR - £4000
  • Artwork, Design & Video expenses - £640
  • Indiegogo (5%) & Paypal fees (2%) - £560

If you would like to take part and help turn this into a reality, you can make a contribution to the campaign by pre-ordering the CD or choosing from another one of the special edition perks - see right hand column of this Indiegogo webpage. Your support would be a huge help! 

Staying Connected to Our Project

Throughout the whole project we will be sending out regular email updates from the Indiegogo website to everyone who contributes to the campaign; with photos, videos and blogs that document our progress. You will be able to see how the rehearsals with the band unfold, check out our days in the recording studio in and hear about any other exciting announcement we have to share! We really want you to feel like you are taking part in this process with us!

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating money isn’t an option at this time, that's ok! Simply sharing this webpage with your friends in an email, or on facebook and other social media sites would be wonderful!!!

Thank you so much for taking part, words don't seem to express quite how grateful and hopeful we are for this opportunity.

Thanks

Simon, Mirek & Brian



“Deservedly the recipient of a great deal of praise”

Paul Jones BBC Radio 2


★★★★★★★★★★

10/10

CrossRhythms Magazine


“…Stunning…Irresistible…Rousing… Recommended!”

Blues Matters Magazine


“This is a solid debut album and deserves to be heard for its excellent sound qualities and stirring playing.” 

Blues In Britain Magazine


These are just some of the amazing reviews we had from our 2014 debut album "Make Up Your Mind". We were overwhelmed by the interest and positive reviews for the album so to build upon this success we now plan to release a follow up album in 2016.

story:
HI THERE, WE ARE DIRTY DISHES AND WE ARE GOING ON A REALLY LONG SPRING TOUR.  WE NEED TO RENT A VAN AND COVER EXPENSES FOR TWO MONTHS IN ORDER TO GET TO OUR SHOWS.  YOUR POCKET CHANGE WE WILL BE ABLE TO GET ACROSS THE NATION. 


We are trying to cover the cost of renting a van and being on the road for 2 months.

Anyone who contributes will be put on the guest list at our show in your city and get an Autographed album.

Any contribution helps no matter how big or small.  Thank you so much.

story:
Welcome,  

Thanks for checking out my campaign page to help fund my new album and tour. I gotta be honest, I’m not really comfortable asking for money for my project. We all have dream projects. Why mine? I’ve been wrestling with that... 

You all probably know the music industry has changed drastically. Companies don’t fund and work with artists the way they used to. People love music like they always did. That hasn’t changed. But they just don’t buy and support it the same way. Where does this leave artists? We can’t stop making music. What are we supposed to do? 

Crowdfunding has become the way forward and ironically, it feels like a personally fulfilling way for me to connect with you, and you with me… 
Going through this journey, I see one door closes and another opens…

It brings me the greatest joy to be blessed to make music and I believe it’s a privilege to share my songs. It’s always been that way for me. That’s why I enjoy hanging with you after shows, meeting you and replying to your Internet shout outs. Crowdfunding has a positive effect. It’s a direct link with artists, allowing fans to play a part of the music making process they support. I’ve excited more than ever by the possibility of what we can accomplish together. 

I’ve got killer new songs. I can’t wait to share them. I’ve got a truly ace band that I love and admire. It’s a mutual kick to make music together and I’m over the moon at the results. I’m thrilled to get these songs recorded, share the process and then, take them on the road. Perhaps, even play a gig … in YOUR ‘hood… 

This project depends on your help to bring the album and tour to fruition - through pre-orders and donations, sharing this campaign on your social media - and sending this page directly with your friends. Then hopefully they will pass along to their friends… 
That’s the way this works.

I’ve tried to make this funding campaign different from the ‘average bear’. It’s loaded with premiums, and exclusive participation opportunities. There will be updates from the studio and tastes of the new record, an open forum to chat with me about the album and… in my effort to re-invent the wheel, I’ve come up with extra cool things to share. I’ve been persuaded to pillage my closet of some “secret stuff” to stay tuned-in for. They’re gonna be available as exclusive links “gifted” during the campaign for a limited window of time to all campaign supporters. 

So peruse the sidebar, choose level and premium. I can’t do this without YOU, down for the cause. Thanks so much in advance for your support!
 
Much love from me to you, always! 
Evie XO

PS: Fyi: 
Should we be blessed to achieve the campaign’s target “goal”, those funds cover the efficient recording, mixing, mastering, art, manufacturing and limited tour costs. The stretch goal, beyond the $16,500, if you really get down to it, could cover what the labels used to fund. It’s an inter-connective process. Realize that once the record is released it’s like a tree falling in the forest. Just as vital is letting people know it exists. Ideally the record needs to engage the information channels, promoters and bookers are made aware, support is necessary for the band to tour... 
So if we reach our goal, how do I dare say this - keep on giving…  allowing us to achieve our true quest - to bring this album to you.
story_txt: Welcome,  Thanks for checking out my campaign page to help fund my new album and tour. I gotta be honest, I’m not really comfortable asking for money for my project. We all have dream projects. Why mine? I’ve been wrestling with that... You all probably know the music industry has changed drastically. Companies don’t fund and work with artists the way they used to. People love music like they always did. That hasn’t changed. But they just don’t buy and support it the same way. Where does this leave artists? We can’t stop making music. What are we supposed to do? Crowdfunding has become the way forward and ironically, it feels like a personally fulfilling way for me to connect with you, and you with me… Going through this journey, I see one door closes and another opens…It brings me the greatest joy to be blessed to make music and I believe it’s a privilege to share my songs. It’s always been that way for me. That’s why I enjoy hanging with you after shows, meeting you and replying to your Internet shout outs. Crowdfunding has a positive effect. It’s a direct link with artists, allowing fans to play a part of the music making process they support. I’ve excited more than ever by the possibility of what we can accomplish together. I’ve got killer new songs. I can’t wait to share them. I’ve got a truly ace band that I love and admire. There will be updates from the studio and tastes of the new record, an open forum to chat with me about the album and… in my effort to re-invent the wheel, I’ve come up with extra cool things to share. story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Daniel and I have been currently working on my project 'Nomadic Jurassic' for 3 years. 

This campaign to help me create more nature music videos like the popular 'waterfall magic' video that hit 6.2 million on Facebook last year. 

Since making that video I have made 2 full studio albums and have continued my work with Nomadic Jurassic projects in Australia, England, Germany, The United States, and Mexico. 

Most of the time I'm am restricted to playing in city. 

This fundraiser is to help with the cost of this project all across the board. Some of the costs will help cover:

Production, mixing shipping, graphic design, album cover design, import taxes, travel costs ad many other entries. 

Getting involved with this project will help me to reach even more people.  I have already reached 6.2 million with my top video. 

There are 7.53 billion people on the earth and I intended to reach as many as is humanly possible!

If we raise 15,000 Euro I will be able to fully commit to this project and I will go to extremes to bring you the most epic videos possible! 

If we can beat the target goal I will make another album will the amazing musicians I have come into contact on my travels and make a documentary film record at a profestional studio in Los Angeles California. 

Digital copies of any of the previously released albums are available as well as a 12 inch Vinyl copy of 'Tales of Mantra' 

Oh, and I am putting one of my first ever guitars up for auction (yes that is me in the picture)

Thankyou for watching and please share!

story:
Hi! I'm Mandy.

Sharing music with kids and their family is my biggest passion. I have dedicated my entire life to it!

Music with Mandy began in August of 2017 when I combined my experience as an educator with my passion for performing jazz. I have been lucky enough to have performed throughout Western Canada at theatres, libraries, preschools and retirement facilities with highlight shows at the National Music Centre, JazzYYC, Hay Days Festival, Fernie’s Culture on the Lawn and Enkindle with JUNO nominated artist Ginalina. Music with Mandy’s debut album, “On the Sunny Side of the Street”, was released in conjunction with a colouring book that I illustrated. It has been praised by families and jazz fans alike. It was recently nominated for Jazz Recording of the Year at the YYC Music Awards. In addition to my work as an artist, I work hard to promote the arts in my community. In May 2019 I founded a brand new children’s festival in Calgary called Create Kids Fest which presented 15 performances over the course of three days at two venues featuring music, dance, theatre, storytelling and visual art. I am also the youngest member on the JazzYYC board of directors where I work to introduce jazz to a wider audience in Calgary.

From My Head to My Toes

“From My Head to My Toes” is Music with Mandy's second full length album. It features a fresh take on children’s music that promotes self awareness, cultural awareness and emotional intelligence. The music on this album allows kids to explore their body, emotions and empathy. I have used my experience as a performer and educator to write songs in collaboration with composer, Matt Morris, that are entertaining and educational. Kids are invited to be present with the music through movement, silly stories and call and response. Children have always inspired my songwriting and will continue to on this album. You will hear them sing on some tracks to create a sound that is inspired by Raffi and the children’s music of Vince Guaraldi.

The Team

Matt Morris

My musical collaborator, Matt Morris, is a pianist, composer and educator. He studied classical composition at the University of Lethbridge and jazz performance and composition at Grant MacEwan University. For the past ten years he has worked with children to introduce them to and develop their understanding of music. Matt teaches piano, theory and composition lessons at Chinook School of Music where his patient demeanour allows children to develop their own unique musical voice. On this project he will be working as composer and I’ll serve as lyricist and arranger. In the studio and on stage Matt has and will continue to kill it on the keys. His playing style is whimsical and minimalist which allows kids to dig into his sound.

Kodi Hutchinson

Kodi Hutchinson is a WCMA nominated producer and bass player who has worked with JUNO winner Laila Biali and JUNO nominated artists Al Muirhead and PJ Perry. He is a leader of The Hutchinson Andrew Trio which won the 2013 TD Grand Jazz Award from the Montreal International Jazz Festival. Kodi is a great player, jazz advocate, industry person and producer which make him an obvious choice for any jazz album. What makes him the perfect fit for this project is his upbeat, happy-go-lucky personality and his recent jump into fatherhood. His passion for bringing accessible, high quality music to young children comes from passion for sharing music with his one and a half year old daughter. I have worked with Kodi since the inception of Music with Mandy and have used his expert guidance to bring my career this far. Kodi will bring his skills as producer and player to “From My Head to My Toes” which will be sure to please discerning jazz critics and children’s advocates alike. As a producer he favours clean, precise sounds which are perfect for kids tunes and as a player he lays down the groove with confident and ease and throws in the occasional playful lick to keep the audience intrigued.

Ian Yule

Ian Yule is a father and multi-instrumentalist who grew up in Manitoba, studied jazz drums at McGill before settling in Calgary. He has toured North America with Onlyforward and has been playing with Music with Mandy since it began and will join us again on this recording. It is important in jazz that the bass player and drummer have a strong connection. Kodi and Ian work together as a unit providing the foundation for the Mandy and her musical guests to explore the arrangements with freedom. The album explores grooves like swing, free jazz, bossa nova and funk. Ian moves flawlessly between them thanks to experience in both the jazz and contemporary world.

Spencer Cheyne

Spencer Cheyne is a JUNO-award winning Mixer/Producer/Drummer who has been nominated for multiple additional JUNOs, WCMAs and CCMAs. He’s one of the busiest engineers in Western Canada thanks to his extensive training with Manny Marroquin (Katy Perry, Rihanna, Kanye West) and Michael Brauer (Coldplay, Bob Dylan, Rolling Stones). He has worked with top notch talents such as Tommy Banks, PJ Perry, Paul Brandt and Raffi to name a few. His combined talents as a musician and engineer have given him the golden ear which is exactly what we need to bring the magic of a Music with Mandy live performance to a recorded album

What will the funds be used for?

This campaign will cover the studio time, engineering costs and mastering. Any additional funds will be used towards musician fees, producer fees and marketing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for any contribution you can make! Here are some other ways to help

  • Share the campaign on social media!
  • Like & Follow me on Facebook and Instagram
  • Send an email to your friends inviting them to the 3rd Annual MWM Holiday Sing-a-long.
  • Write a letter to your MLA asking them to increase funding for the arts. 
  • Listen to our first album "On the Sunny Side of the Street"

story:
Now is your opportunity to be a part of Daniel Kepel’s second positive music project, “Break Me Open Wide”.

How can you be a part of the project? 

Already professionally recorded at The Recording Zone in Rustburg, VA. You can be a part of this recording project and help finish mixing, mastering, and manufacturing the magic of the music by:

  • Holding Daniel in love and light as the project is nearing its completion.  Your prayers and positive energy are so appreciated.
  • Sharing this campaign on your Facebook page.
  • Pre-ordering now so that you can be one of the first people to get your hands on Break Me Open Wide.
  • Booking The Break Me Open Wide Concert for you and your friends.
  • Donating to the cause and receive acknowledgement of your support in the liner notes.

There will be a LIMTED RUN of CDs, so the best way to ensure a copy is to PRE-ORDER.

Keep up with the the campaign progress by following Daniel Kepel Music on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/DanielKepelMusic/.

Thank you for supporting positive music and being a part of this amazing recording project.

story:
About Us

Our story began as a group of friends and family practicing spiritual ceremonies to improve ourselves and sharing music that help facilitate our growth. Being a guest at Pagan Spirit Gathering Festival, we were called upon to fill in a musical spot for a band that unfortunately was not be able to come. The community welcomed us and encouraged us to work a whole year and put together a prepared musical ensemble which played the following year and was well received. We are now in the forward phase of our next step, which is to record an album for our community who have supported us from the start and a way to share our music, experience, and story to the world!

Recording this album would be very special not just to us, but to the many supporters who have been asking for our music for a year now, since we were called upon to be a band. As young artists and musicians, getting funding for this album will help make it into a reality and help us afford the right professional help to capture our music magic, message and delivery.

Your contributions: will allow us to hire a good producer, purchase and press the full album cd and other merch like stickers, posters, shirt. .. etc. You will not only be helping fund us, but will be giving us inspiration, hope, and nourishment as we continue to pursue this path of being musical artists.  

 

Who We Are

The Thundersirens is a multifaceted ceremony inspired musical group that combines sound therapy, shamanic influences and a variety of styles of music into their performances. Their music draws inspiration from each individual’s personal experience in their healing journeys, devotion to their spiritual work, and a variety of different ethnic soundscapes, tribal beats, with blues, rock, folk, and jazz fusion delivery that make their sound powerful and unique.    

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need around $3,000 on a very tight budget. About $2,000 will go to our recording cost and mixing the album. The reminder will go into producing and pressing the cd’s and packaging as well as delivery, and printing some stickers, artwork and band merch (if there’s enough in the budget).  

We have prepared a list of ways to donate and our unique perks which includes personal artwork and signed merch. Each level has an appropriate incentive and a copy of our cd starts at $20 donation

If we do not reach everything in the fund, it will go into a future fund as we continue to campaign in other ways to reach the benchmark to record a cd.

 

The Impact

This fundraiser means the world to us and your contributions the fuel and drive to move forward with this passion for music. We have been encouraged by you (our fans and friends), to continue our work and message and we would love to be able to share our music with you and the world! Y’all have been our inspiration in creating this campaign and we are finally ready to make it happen! THANK YOU! Your Love and Support has been a blessing!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Hey everyone! just wanted to mention that while we will try to get everything finished and delivered at the set dates. We would like yall to know that sometimes set backs, scheduling conflicts and life challenges may delay projects. So please be patient with us and we will let yall know about band progress. Also in the event that we do not reach our optimal goal, extra merch and products may not be available. We will try to accomodate and make up for it, but understand this is a fundraiser to record our album, which will be our main top priority in using our budget. 

These are all challenges that can be overcome with ample time to plan ahead and having the funds to make it all happen. We plan to kick everything in gear as soon as we hit our benchmark on our fundraiser

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps! If you are not able to contribute right now, or even if you’re able to, it would really help us to get the word around. Please share our campaign on your social media. And if you know us, please let people know about us and your story with us!

*click the share button up top to copy link

Keep up to date with our progress on our band page - https://www.facebook.com/thundersirens

Check out our music and podcast from Circle Sanctuary - https://www.blogtalkradio.com/csnp/2019/07/03/c...

story:
Flashpoint CD/DVD Concert

 

I'm Aaron Gayden and I am a full-time musician. I try to make the world a better place one song at a time. I play in several bands including my own and work full time at my church doing music. My music ranges from orchestral to R&B and Jazz to Gospel and multiple genres in between. My guitar player, from my church (and a band leader in his own right) Tim Brisson,, reminded me that we'd been talking about doing a CD of my Gospel music for over a year and he gave me a swift kick in the rear and pretty much said "Let's do it now!" 

He has essentially said my music has impacted him and helped him tell his story about his recovery and he believes it needs to get out into the world. So here we are.

Budget and I do mean budget...

A lot of favors have been called in. My budget for a previous attempt at capturing my music was $15,000 just for a CD. We're just trying to raise 1/3 of that. $5000. I have a lot of fellow starving artists who just want to help get the music to you! Ideally, I would like to make that not have to be the case for my fellow artists. But at the very least there are the hard costs such as manufacturing that need to be covered. 

What does it all do?

I believe this is just the beginning. In the past, my band has taken on such causes as the Haiti earthquake, sex trafficking and fundraising for a young man stricken down in a freak accident to become a paraplegic in the prime of his life. Music is what I do so whenever there is a problem I am likely to throw music at it. Music is one of my tools to help brighten lives on any level I can. Like I said, I believe this is just the beginning. 

You can help make it happen.

I hope you will join me to get the ball rolling. Just one dollar from you and 4999 of your closest friends can help me get started bringing a little more love, joy  and hope into our crazy world. There's a lot more to it. But I figure that's enough to start with. Just a dollar.

My guitar player, from my church (and a band leader in his own right) Tim Brisson,, reminded me that we'd been talking about doing a CD of my Gospel music for over a year and he gave me a swift kick in the rear and pretty much said "Let's do it now!" 
He has essentially said my music has impacted him and helped him tell his story about his recovery and he believes it needs to get out into the world. So here we are.

Budget and I do mean budget...
A lot of favors have been called in. My budget for a previous attempt at capturing my music was $15,000 just for a CD. We're just trying to raise 1/3 of that. $5000. I have a lot of fellow starving artists who just want to help get the music to you! Ideally, I would like to make that not have to be the case for my fellow artists. But at the very least there are the hard costs such as manufacturing that need to be covered. 

What does it all do?
I believe this is just the beginning. In the past, my band has taken on such causes as the Haiti earthquake, sex trafficking and fundraising for a young man stricken down in a freak accident to become a paraplegic in the prime of his life. Music is what I do so whenever there is a problem I am likely to throw music at it. Music is one of my tools to help brighten lives on any level I can. Like I said, I believe this is just the beginning. 

You can help make it happen.
I hope you will join me to get the ball rolling. Just one dollar from you and 4999 of your closest friends can help me get started bringing a little more love, joy  and hope into our crazy world. There's a lot more to it. But I figure that's enough to start with. Just a dollar.

story:
Help Pat Donaher create a very special occasion! 

 Occasionally will feature Pat's music realized by Allison Miller, Jason Palmer, Carmen Staaf, Tony Scherr, and Tim Watson, at Samurai Hotel in Queens, NYC

What We Need & What You Get

The goal for this campaign covers the following expenses

  • musicians' salaries (80%)
  • 2/3 of the cost of the studio time (the first third is paid for) (13%)
  • the cost of the merchandise you receive (7%)

If we reach our first goal, these are our stretch goals

  • $14,500, would cover the cost of mastering with one of the best in the world
  • $17,000 would let me hire one of the best jazz and new music PR firms in the world, to make sure this music is heard everywhere.  

The Impact

Making an album like this, with really personal meaningful music being interpreted by some of the best musicians on the planet, has been a dream of mine since I was a kid.  But now it's even more important

  • All of the players on this record have seen all of their upcoming gigs and tours, and hence most of their livelihood, go up in smoke due to the pandemic.  No one is booking gigs for at least six months, and the future of venues is very much at risk.  Likewise, the studio and its team, who are responsible for so many amazing recordings, have been sitting idle for months.  My hope is this project can be a shot in the arm for them, both musically and financially.  It's not enough, by any means, but it's something.
  • I've done one crowdsourcing project before, for my third album "Who We Are Together".  It was a success beyond my expectations.  This is a much bigger ask, but I'm hoping we can make this one just as successful

Risks & Challenges

Ordinarily, I'd say the biggest risk is that we don't make our goal, and I'm left figuring out how to make up the difference and make the album happen.  Because I have people counting on me, especially.  But, obviously, these are not ordinary times.  

The biggest risk, near term, is that New York is not ready to open recording studios for our late August date, which has been on the books for several months now.  Hopefully, given the circumstances, everyone involved can be flexible and we can push the project back, or (an unpleasant prospect) do it in another space. I hope you will be patient in this unusual moment.

For the past six years I've been working as a music educator in a high school.  Wynton Marsalis likes to say that educators are more than just teachers- we have to be counselors, coaches, travel agents, referees, surrogates.  I know what he's talking about.  If I can talk a group of twenty teenagers off the proverbial cliff, I can manage this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that for a lot of folks right now, things are hard.  So if you can't support this project financially, but you want to help keep the music going:

  • Get the word out- share the campaign on your social media, or e-mail like-minded folks.  Please use the tools that Indiegogo provides here!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everybody, 

Lance Riebsomer here, and as most of you know i've been writing and recording music with friends out in the desert as well as in Orange County for the past year. Through all the songs we've written and recorded together, we have finished an ep under the new name of our project Black Water Gospel, and we need help getting the songs mixed, mastered, and put together into a press package. That's what this indiegogo campaign is for. With your help, not only will you be supporting local music, but you will be apart of what my close friends and I have spent long nights, long drives, and much of our heart and soul, putting together.

Any contribution you can make is greatly appreciated. We are trying to raise 8,000 to pay for what we need to get to have the first EP mixed and mastered, as well as putting together a merchandise package including cds, tshirts, artwork etc. Any amount you contribute, is greatly appreciated, and anyone who contibutes will receive merchandise they are donating towards creating. If you can't donate financially, we value you sharing this campaign with friends and family, via social media or word of mouth.Thanks!

story:
A bodacious, healing product of sound, pleasing to the ear and soul.

I am launching my first ever crowd-funding campaign, for my first ever LP album. Thank you for stopping by. My name is Marilyn Tennant, and I'm a singer-songwriter from Lansing, MI. The album will be recorded at Troubadour Recording Studios, in Lansing, MI with Corey DeRushia. I aim to have it ready for you in the Spring/Summer of 2020. 

The album will bring messages of Hope, Love, and Understanding. It will carry the common struggle that we all face; to live our own life from a place of authenticity and truth.  I hope to curate a message of inspiration to listeners. Inspration to live from their own authentic truth, and that only they can decide what that truth is.

There is sure to be stories on this album, as well. Stories of my travels of performing music, connecting with the people I have met over the recent years.  I hope to build on my previous understanding of recording my own songs through this process, and I understand that music connects us in more ways than we realize.

That is why I am asking you to connect with me now, so that I am able to create more music. It would not be possible without your help.  Thank you again for your consideration and support.

story:
The Artist

IamManaking is a unique crossover artist from the UK who's original, controversial and entertaining live shows have been steadily carving him out a 'hard to forget' and equally hard to categorise reputation.

Homeless and fuelled by a turbulent past this creative and unapologetic artist is known for his reality based, no limitations, no rules, no boundaries approach to both his life and his art and continues honing his craft and paying his dues on the UK's grass roots live music scene.

His music is describe as 'Dark yet catchy crossover avant-garde with a theatrical twist combining an aggressively emotive blend of experimental rhythmic vocals boldly splattered over a uniquely torn rock/punk canvas'

Find out more personal and detailed information about the artist  by visiting his patreon page here.

 

The Song

Wanna hear it? - Listen to song demo here now.

You can also listen to all my other previous DIY releases here.

Up (Where I Belong) is to be IamManaking's first official release taken from his forthcoming 13 song debut studio album entitled '15 Different Colours Of Decay'. Building a notoriety for his seemingly effortless song writing abilities and simple yet catchy genre blending musical creations this latest scheduled release proves to be no different.

Providing a toe tapping, head bobbing experience whilst also capturing a personal insight into the struggle and rejection faced by many an up and coming artist as they bang on closed doors hunting opportunities and recognition.

  • Features familiar tune.

This latest IamManaking ear worm features his reworking of Ennio Morricone pocket watch tune popularised from the classic Clint Eastward western 'A Few Dollars More'.

  • Mixed by Muse Producer.

Set to be a broadcast quality production mixed by highly experienced producer Paul Reeve who's accolades include previously work on music by legendary UK rock band Muse.

  • All those extras.

With your support this 'Indiegogo fund yourself' campaign will also allow for additions such as live drums, enhanced middle 8 and uncensored, radio edit and Instrumental versions.

 

The Video

The first of 13 videos to come from the forthcoming debut studio album '15 Different Colours Of Decay' this video will feature actual footage taken from the reality based artists's actual 2019 mental hospital incarceration.  

  • Real life footage of artist's mental hospital incarceration.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We absolutely understand and appreciate that not everyone is in a position to contributing financially but there are still other ways in which you can still help. You may know someone that can and by simply sharing this campaign amongst your friends may help in being the difference in becoming a successful campaign.

By using the links below a simple thing like spreading the word about IamManaking as an artist, supporting, listening and sharing his music, signing up to his mailing and following his social media will all help in building this unique artist's notoriety and momentum.

Patreon - Website - Instagram - Facebook - Twitter - YouTube - Music

story: I've been singing and playing guitar since age 3. My father played in festivals and fairs and taught me everything. I learned about drums, bass guitar, rhythm guitar, vocals and the songwriting business. This is the lifestyle I chose at that age and my father George "Froggy" Brown inspired my love of music and the diversity of music. He was a country boy through and through and died telling me to follow my dreams and be the best i can be. I love to play and write all genre of music from country to rock and beyond. I've listened and played with the greats of music through the years but recording those moments was not possible then. Now is a whole new world where artists from around the world can connect and play in live recordings. Music is my passion for myself and my team. We are dedicated to the arts and the production of dreams help us make ours and support our campaign with our thank you.

story:
About My Project 

Hi. My name is Martay. I’m a 27 year old singer-songwriter that has been performing and releasing music for 8 years now. I’ve been privileged to tour the country many times as an independent artist, share stages with influential artists like Snoop Dogg and The Gospel Gangstaz, and most importantly — inspire people through my music. 

This is more than music to me: overtime, I have come to realize that God has given me music as a gift and it’s a gift that spreads hope, as well as joy, to people who might not find it otherwise. In such an unsure and dark time in our history, I see releasing my music as not just something I get to do, but as something I must do.

3 years have gone by since I released my last music project to the public and I am now bursting at the seams once again to let the world hear what I have to share through my recent creations. My recent creations are songs that face the reality of pain, give hope, and inspire us to be our authentic selves. I’m excited to share these songs, but realize that I lack one thing: the funds to do so. 

I’ve already paid to record and create my next project. All that’s left is to package it up and release it to the public so that others can hear it. I’m going to need some extra help to make this happen — your help. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

As of right now, my next album is fully written and recorded. I selected what I believe are my best songs ever written by me so far and am absolutely ecstatic to release them so that others can experience them— you have no idea how excited I am! 

In fact, I have 3 singles that are already buzzing around the airwaves (“Laugh - Acoustic”, “Ghosts” and “Boils My Blood”). 

What I need is your help reaching my goal of $2,100.

If I reach my crowdfunding goal, I will not only be able to release my third album, but a music video that will help promote my new record the way I believe it deserves be promoted.

When I break down the $2,100 budget, it covers the following expenses: 

  • Creation of physical album copies ($1000)  
  • New music video to promote single off the album ($1050) 
  • Digital distribution to (iTunes, Amazon, Spotify and more) for album ($50) 

All donations that exceed the amount I’m raising will go towards: 

  • my album release party in March
  • online marketing to promote the album and its music video 

When you donate you will receive exclusive incentives and rewards. Here are a couple:

If you want to contribute, you can use your PayPal account or your credit card. When you reach the checkout page, you will be redirected to PayPal, where you can choose your preferred option.

Throughout the campaign, all backers will receive exclusive insider information about my album title, the track listing, my album release and more exciting factors having to do with the release.

 

The Impact

Like I said above, music is truly a gift that can be used to help others get through their day-to-day life. Music can bring healing, inspiration, joy and so many other needed qualities to the lives of others. 

I am sure of this because I have been fortunate to have seen the fruit from the last two albums that I successfully created and released. From written emails, to social media comments, to people pulling me aside at shows: I’ve been humbled to hear stories of listeners who feel empowered to overcome (or even leave) dark situations in their lives because of hope they’ve found through my music.

I don’t take it for granted.

In fact, now more than ever it seems that we are living in a chaotic time. People are heartbroken and troubled about America’s political situation and many are unsure about their future wellbeing. I believe that this album is more than just a passionate creation of mine: it’s a way in which I can truly help others experience peace, hope, joy and inspiration during the dark time that we’re in. 

Without art, our world remains a tremendously dark place. This is a chance for you and I to come together and be light. 

 

Risks & Challenges

If I don’t reach my goal, the music I’ve created and recorded is going to take longer than expected to release. It could be anywhere from a few months delayed to a year or so. I currently am shooting for the first week of April to be the time span in which my new project hits public ears. Not meeting my goal of $2100 will disrupt that. 

Though this is a risk I will be taking, I plan to avoid it by throughly promoting this campaign to media sources and all of my social media channels. With adequate promotion effort and your help, we can make this happen. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from donating, there are other ways to help me make this project happen. One of the biggest ways you can help is by praying for this project and for all God has in store concerning it to happen. Prayer is powerful and I believe it is truly the key to success. 

Also, you can help me by sharing it with your family and friends. On the top of this page, you will find buttons that will help you share my project link on your social media. 

Lastly, you can also head to your favorite digital download outlet to get your very own copy of the singles I’ve already released. They’re available on iTunes, Amazon, Google Play and more. 

Every ounce of support helps! 

If you have questions or would like to connect, feel free to send me an email at martaymusic@gmail.com or find me on social media at @MartayMusic

Thank you for always supporting me: HERE WE GO!
