story:
Here is my story.

I was born & raised on Kodiak Island, Alaska. 

I spend half of each year hunting & fishing while managing our family lodge and as a chef for our clients. The other half of the year, I spend traveling all over the country sharing my story with others while singing & recording in Los Angeles.

Here are just a few things about me:

  • I am only 20 years old
  • I have released 2 singles & an EP of 4 songs
  • I have been hunting since I was 6 years old, and plan to incorporate that into promoting children & women to take a more serious role in the hunting industry.
  • I shot the biggest Sitka Blacktail by a woman & its new #7 in the world record book! 
  • I started a business in Kodiak called Krimson's Krab, to sell live Dungeness crab to the public.
  • I am the chef for our family lodge in Larsen Bay, I love to cook!

What I need, & why?

My goal is to raise $3000, which is the exact amount of production cost for one song. I will be paying for traveling expenses, but need help to pay for the song itself. Everything over my goal amount will be put towards a music video this November in Kodiak. 

  • I have been working very hard at our lodge to save up money to support my career but most was spent on a piano course to expand my skills as a musician. 

The impact that you can make.

Right now is simply the most crucial part of my career, Im only 20 years old, but with goals like my mine my opportunities decrease each year. Women of the outdoors & Alaska is a flourishing industry right now and there is no better time for me to make a difference. 

Other ways that you can help!

anything is appreciated!

  • go to Facebook and like my page to stay updated!

    https://www.facebook.com/krimsonmusic/

  • download my EP on iTunes for only $3.96! 

         https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/stay-ep/id1137783636

  • go to my website http://krimsonlive.com and buy signed hard copy or a Krimson's Krab t-shirt!
  • share my story with others, any way you can!
If you have any questions or recommendations, email me at krimsonmusic@icloud.com 
I would love to hear your thoughts!
Thank you for your time and contribution! 
                                                                                  Krimson
story_txt:
Here is my story. I was born & raised on Kodiak Island, Alaska. 
I spend half of each year hunting & fishing while managing our family lodge and as a chef for our clients. The other half of the year, I spend traveling all over the country sharing my story with others while singing & recording in Los Angeles.
Here are just a few things about me:  I am only 20 years old I have released 2 singles & an EP of 4 songs I have been hunting since I was 6 years old, and plan to incorporate that into promoting children & women to take a more serious role in the hunting industry.
I shot the biggest Sitka Blacktail by a woman & its new #7 in the world record book! 
I started a business in Kodiak called Krimson's Krab, to sell live Dungeness crab to the public.
I am the chef for our family lodge in Larsen Bay, I love to cook!
   What I need, & why? My goal is to raise $3000, which is the exact amount of production cost for one song. I will be paying for traveling expenses, but need help to pay for the song itself. Everything over my goal amount will be put towards a music video this November in Kodiak.   I have been working very hard at our lodge to save up money to support my career but most was spent on a piano course to expand my skills as a musician.  
The impact that you can make.   Right now is simply the most crucial part of my career, Im only 20 years old, but with goals like my mine my opportunities decrease each year. Women of the outdoors & Alaska is a flourishing industry right now and there is no better time for me to make a difference. 

    Other ways that you can help! anything is appreciated!  
go to Facebook and like my page to stay updated!
https://www.facebook.com/krimsonmusic/
 download my EP on iTunes for only $3.96! 


         https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/stay-ep/id1137783636
   
go to my website http://krimsonlive.com and buy signed hard copy or a Krimson's Krab t-shirt!
share my story with others, any way you can!
If you have any questions or recommendations, email me at krimsonmusic@icloud.com I would love to hear your thoughts!Thank you for your time and contribution!                                                                                   Krimson

story:
The Project

I'm Adam Bauer and I've been singing and playing sacred music for 30+ years. In 2014 I released a partially crowd-funded sacred chant album, Shyam Lila--which was a critically acclaimed success and one of the true honors of my life. I remain humbled and grateful for everyone who helped bring that into form!

Now I am back in the studio working on the next album, this time with renowned producer Ben Leinbach.

I am profoundly grateful for the support I've felt (from the Universe and from humans) these last years as I've traveled all over the world offering these devotional chants through my own voice. Everywhere I've gone--India, Europe, North and South America--people have opened their hearts to join me in the sacred space of congregational mantra recitation, and the Grace that flows from this practice together is deeply humbling and inspiring. Thank you all! 

I'm launching this campaign to pre-sell the coming album in order to raise funds to complete the project. I've always had a strong commitment to high quality, and making this album with the support of truly inspired musicians, artists and engineers frankly costs real money. I've happily invested my own resources of time and money reaching high for a truly inspired result, and we are very close to releasing something we can all feel grateful to be a part of.

With your help, we will be able to complete a record I began one year ago in the ancient city of Varanasi India with some of the finest musicians in that city known for profound musicianship.  Working with Ben Leinbach, one of the world's best known producers of sacred and world music, has been a real pleasure, and I've been blessed with the support and contributions of a host of incredible artists, players like Steve Gorn (bansuri), Hans Christian (cello), John McDowell (piano and organ) and many others. We are almost finished recording, and so far it's sounding great! Much remains to be done, however, and here's where you come in. The last rounds of recording, mixing and mastering, album cover design, CD production will cost about $14k, so I'm inviting a little help from my friends as we navigate these last rounds of creativity and expense on our way to releasing this new album later in Summer of 2017. Thank you in advance for helping us make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

So far, I've paid (happily!) for everything out of my own pocket. Now, I'm seeking $10,800 in order to partially cover the following expenses, estimated at $13,408:

  • Remaining musicians' & singers' fees: $2500 
  • Studio recording & production time: $3600 (6 days at $600/day)
  • Final mixing & mastering time: $4200 (7 days at $600/day)
  • Album art, design & creative: $1000
  • Printing and manufacturing of first round of physical CDs: $2000
  • Lunch and superfood smoothies for Ben so he stays sharp and happy: $108.

The most basic "perks" on offer are simple: just pre-buy the album! This one easy thing, when lots of people act together, can help immensely. In addition, there will be other perks for participating at different levels; these will range from copies of the last album, Shyam Lila, to private house concerts for you and your friends, to an executive producer credit on the album,  and more.

If we don't reach the goal, I'll just keep traveling and singing and pouring money into the project as I can, and one day, insh'Allah, we will finish this beautiful labor of love and offer it to you, with our love and gratitude.

The Impact

The last time I ran an Indiegogo campaign, it helped me make the Shyam Lila album, and people's responses to that album continue to move and humble me deeply as it continues to make its way through the world. It takes a village to make a record, and I'm deeply grateful for the beautiful folks who live in my village--thanks for being part of the lila! 

Risks & Challenges

As far as "risks and challenges" on this project, there really aren't any big ones. I've already paid for all the work to date, the album is 3/4 recorded and already sounded pretty lovely, and if this campaign doesn't fully fund the remaining costs, I won't give up! By hook or by crook I will raise and spend the money necessary to finish it, and finish it well. That is my commitment, and God willing, this album will be publicly available while 2017 still offers warm weather in the northern hemisphere.

Other Ways You Can Help

And finally: whether you are able to contribute monetarily or not, you can definitely help this project by spreading the word amongst your community and sharing on social media ( www.igg.me/at/adambauer2 ) to help us get the word out there. Many thanks for your good thoughts and help--I bow to you!

See you out on the bhajan trail,

Adam

story:
The Vinyls (click on the right to pre-order and make them happen!)

Previews of the tracks and the artwork etc. to be released during the crowd funder so check back or follow us on soundcloud or facebook. So excited about these releases! Gonna be some serious bangers on there!!!

 

JIGSORE 010

a1 - FFF - In My House

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/fff-in-my-h...

a2 - Osh-Kosh - Lightning And Thunder

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/osh-kosh-li...

b1 - Ben 9mm - EGOTRIP

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/ben-9mm-ego...

b2 - Acdbrnout

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/acdbrnout-d...

 

JIGSORE 011

a1 - Enduser
a2 - Sebby T

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/dj-sebby-t-...

b1 - Ronin - End Of The Road

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/ronin-end-of-the-road-jigsore

b2 - E-coli + General Waste

 

JIGSORE 012

a1 - Stazma - Electric Voyage

Preview: https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound/stazma-electric-voyage-jigsore

a2 - Humb
b1 - Johnny Sideways 
b2 - c3b

 

The Hoodies (specify size when ordering)

Limited Edition (only available through this campaign) black with white print zip hoodie. High quality cotton ridge hoodie. High quality by hand screen printing. Big hood, Zip up, Stash / Phone pocket inside hood. Artwork by our resident artist JakMCS

Available in any size just specify when ordering.

Order on the right >>

 

About Us

We are a sound system from Devon in the UK who are now based in Bristol who have put parties and club nights on all over Europe over the last ten years. Also a record label having released 12 vinyls (including versus ones) and a multitude of digital releases. More info, music etc. at the links below:

 https://soundcloud.com/jigsoresound

https://jigsore.bandcamp.com/

https://www.facebook.com/jigsorerecords

 

Thanks!

Massive thanks to anyone who orders any of the stuff or donates, all the money will go to pressing vinyls, fixing equipment and taking the sound all over Europe in the summer!

We really appreciate your support :).

Hopefully see you at the stack!!!

Get in touch if you have any ideas for parties or wanna link up or anything else in europe in the summer! 

Don't worry, we will press the vinyls even if we don't hit the target. It's just gonna be a stretch :D. Doing it this way round just means we have the money we would have had to front spare to pay for the mega mission round europe and that we are selling the vinyls to you cheaper whilst getting extra money than if we sent them off for distro.

story:
Yes Man Jellyfish 

From the musical Mecca of Bristol, we write and play alternative dance music... A fusion of house, garage and D&B grooves with guitar licks, uplifting piano, and soulful vocals - all played completely live.

We are: Abbey May - Vocalist | Jim Brooke - Bassist | Louise Schwarz - Pianist | Richard Entwistle - Drummer | Tim Hearn - Guitarist | Vadim Degtiar - Keyboardist

This campaign is crucial to us - it is the funding for our first ever release. Earlier this year we recorded 3 of our tracks at the legendary Foel Studios in Wales. In keeping with a dance scene tradition, we commissioned 3 exclusive remixes from world class producers. This has grown into a whopper, sweetly named 'Charm EP'. Whatever your music taste, this record will get you dancing... Everything is ready to go but we need your help to get ready for the launch!

Supporting YMJ

We've got our original recordings and masters. However, to release the EP we need to raise £1800 for the remixes, merchandise, distribution and fees. 

Charm EP

  1. True
  2. Sleep
  3. Flow
  4. True (Moodymanc remix)
  5. Sleep (Dr Meaker remix)
  6. True (POV remix)

Remix Artists

  • Dr Meaker - Hailing from Bristol, the spiritual home of live Drum & Bass, Dr Meaker have broken the mould with their unique fusion of sounds earning them fans across the globe. soundcloud.com/dr-meaker
  • Moodymanc - Danny Ward aka Dubble D, Moodymanc, Vault, Balaphonic and more to come... Crate digger, Jazz musician, Vinyl Record Producer, Re-mixer and DJ. soundcloud.com/moodymanc
  • POV - Pete Gizauskas is a Bristol based DJ and part of the Parallel Dimensions group. Known for versatility in his live sets that borrow from all aspects of house, techno & disco, POV is certainly a dance-floor-centric DJ. soundcloud.com/povbristol

Perk Goodies!


  • Free: All donations include a free waterproof circular sticker, collected at a gig or by arrangement. Or delivered with CD, poster or t-shirt.
  • Digital Download: Link to download high quality audio files will be sent to you on release date.
  • Delivery: CD, poster, t-shirt or sticker will be delivered to your door on release date or P&P refunded upon collection.
  • T-shirts: Size chest (to fit): S - 34/36" // M - 38/40" // L - 42/44" // XL - 46/48" // XXL - 50/52".
  • Music Lessons: We can come to you... Louise is an accomplished piano player featuring in several bands. She currently teaches keyboard in schools across Bristol. Tim is a virtuoso guitarist, managing Hobgoblin music shop in Bristol. He currently has several students. Richard is an experienced drummer, having played and recorded with jazz, rock and pop bands across the country. He has taught various students from beginner to intermediate.
  • Live Performances: We'll travel to you with our own gear. Our travel costs are free up to 30 miles from Bristol. We can bring a PA and engineer for a small £50 fee.

Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everybody can contribute, but you can still help us:

    • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign - tell everybody and we can add more Jellies to our team!
    • Also please take a moment to click share on this page, it is much appreciated :)

    Thanks

    Thank you so much for reading and supporting us and championing new music! We will be in touch very soon to give you the goodies we have made! Special thanks to James Billett for photography and videography, http://jamesbillettphotography.com/. Cheers, YMJ

Also please take a moment to click share on this page, it is much appreciated :)

ThanksThank you so much for reading and supporting us and championing new music! We will be in touch very soon to give you the goodies we have made! Special thanks to James Billett for photography and videography, http://jamesbillettphotography.com/. Cheers, YMJ

story:
Hi friends!

I’m singer-songwriter Jenny Bienemann, based in the Chicago area, member of the bands The Zimmerman, The Significant Others, and The Rainy Day Women.  I've taught songwriting at schools, community centers, and retreats.  I've produced three solo CDs, a live CD with my husband Robin Bienemann, and have been very fortunate to have a number of my songs featured in TV, radio, and theatre.  

What's new?

In recent years, the guitar has been in the background of my projects.   

  

My most recent solo CD, "Heading Slowly Towards the Beginning," was supported by the Illinois Arts Council, featured a string quartet, and was recognized as one of the year’s top albums by local DJs, with WXRT's Local Anesthetic heralding it as "simply striking in its fluidity and charm."  The album before that, "Girl Friday," didn't even have a guitar on it!  It was recorded live during rush hour in the Ogilvie Transportation Center in Chicago with  my voice, kalimba, and a looper, earning accolades from TimeOut Chicago and the Illinois Entertainer.

  

What's new is that my brand new, upcoming CD, "Every Soul Grows to the Light,” marks my return home to my first love, the acoustic, finger style guitar!

  

I need you!

YES, you!  I need your help.

I have a track record of successfully producing ambitious projects on tight budgets.  Yet, even with the generosity of the artists and artisans, all of whom are working at  below-market rates, my vision exceeds my personal resources on this project.   

Please join me in the adventure of bringing to life my new CD, “Every Soul Grows to the Light."  

Where do contributions go?

In supporting this project, your dollars directly support the artists and artisans helping to create "Every Soul Grows to the Light," including Andon Davis on guitar, Klem Hayes on bass, John Carpender and Paul Bivans on drums, Heather Horton on violin, Robin Bienemann on guitar, Isaac Lyons on accordion, and Naomi Ashley, Sue Demel, Deb Lader, Ron Lazzeretti, Bruce Roper, Michael Smith, and Jodi Walker on vocals.   You're also supporting the good work of Bruce Roper of Little School Street Studios, Steve Dawson of Kernel Sound Emporium, and Blaise Barton of Joyride Studios.

The CD is more than just music!

One of my very favorite artists, Sue Demel, has created an extraordinary allegorical painting that will be the centerpiece of the CD's design.   Other artists working on the project include photographer Paul Goyette, videographer Ian Leith, and designer Sarah Stec.  

All of these artists have spent years honing their respective crafts, and all are sharing their skill, passion, and heart with me and this project in ways that are beyond my wildest dreams.

  

YOU make a difference!

It takes a creative community to bring a project like this to life and we need you!  

Support in all amounts makes a difference, and directly supports the livelihoods of artists in our vibrant community.  

And, when you make a gift, you become part of this creative community!  I will be very grateful for all that your generosity allows you to contribute.  

The major expenses for the CD include:

Musicians, $5,500

Mixing/mastering, $5,000

CDs, tee-shirts, posters, $3,250

Tracking, $2,750

Design (painter, photographer, designer), $850

...and things always come up, the closer the project gets to completion.

Perks to delight and surprise!

In addition to the warm, wonderful feeling we hope you'll experience by becoming part of this community, the benefits of contribution can be enjoyed by you; OR, gifted to a loved one during the Holiday Season.  There are are very special perks ranging from the practical (physical copies of the CD) to the whimsical (a custom cheer created by my niece!) to the specialized (song-arounds, concerts and songwriting workshops in your home, church, or not-for-profit organization.)    

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Again, gifts in all amounts make a difference, and will be warmly received!  

Your support means the world to me, and it will make the difference in my ability to bring into the world my homecoming to the acoustic guitar, "Every Soul Grows to the Light."  

And even if a financial contribution is not possible for you at this time, the simple act of sharing this campaign with your friends is a contribution, and will be greatly appreciated.  

THANK YOU in advance for all the ways that you may choose to be part of this project!

Remember: YOU make the difference!

Please join me in the adventure of bringing to life my new CD, “Every Soul Grows to the Light."  
Where do contributions go?
In supporting this project, your dollars directly support the artists and artisans helping to create "Every Soul Grows to the Light," including Andon Davis on guitar, Klem Hayes on bass, John Carpender and Paul Bivans on drums, Heather Horton on violin, Robin Bienemann on guitar, Isaac Lyons on accordion, and Naomi Ashley, Sue Demel, Deb Lader, Ron Lazzeretti, Bruce Roper, Michael Smith, and Jodi Walker on vocals.   You're also supporting the good work of Bruce Roper of Little School Street Studios, Steve Dawson of Kernel Sound Emporium, and Blaise Barton of Joyride Studios.

The CD is more than just music!
One of my very favorite artists, Sue Demel, has created an extraordinary allegorical painting that will be the centerpiece of the CD's design.   Other artists working on the project include photographer Paul Goyette, videographer Ian Leith, and designer Sarah Stec.  

All of these artists have spent years honing their respective crafts, and all are sharing their skill, passion, and heart with me and this project in ways that are beyond my wildest dreams.
  
YOU make a difference!
It takes a creative community to bring a project like this to life and we need you!  
Support in all amounts makes a difference, and directly supports the livelihoods of artists in our vibrant community.  
And, when you make a gift, you become part of this creative community!  I will be very grateful for all that your generosity allows you to contribute.  
The major expenses for the CD include:
Musicians, $5,500
Mixing/mastering, $5,000
CDs, tee-shirts, posters, $3,250
Tracking, $2,750
Design (painter, photographer, designer), $850
...and things always come up, the closer the project gets to completion.
Perks to delight and surprise!

In addition to the warm, wonderful feeling we hope you'll experience by becoming part of this community, the benefits of contribution can be enjoyed by you; OR, gifted to a loved one during the Holiday Season.  There are are very special perks ranging from the practical (physical copies of the CD) to the whimsical (a custom cheer created by my niece!) to the specialized (song-arounds, concerts and songwriting workshops in your home, church, or not-for-profit organization.)    
Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Again, gifts in all amounts make a difference, and will be warmly received!  
Your support means the world to me, and it will make the difference in my ability to bring into the world my homecoming to the acoustic guitar, "Every Soul Grows to the Light."  
And even if a financial contribution is not possible for you at this time, the simple act of sharing this campaign with your friends is a contribution, and will be greatly appreciated.  
THANK YOU in advance for all the ways that you may choose to be part of this project!

Remember: YOU make the difference!

story:
Who Am I And Why Should You Care?

  • I am a rapper from Central Florida who runs the Orlando Cypher Club at UCF and just wants to help spread positivity in my local music community!
  • This campaign will help make it to where my music can always be FREE! :D And any excess donations made after our goal is reached will be given to charity. 
  • By helping fund this project, you are enabling a positive musical influence. I only make songs that uplift, motivate, and widen perspectives of my audience.

What's In It For You?

I'm not just begging for money here...

  • ​All donors giving $5 and above will be receiving gifts in return of their pledge!
    $5 - Thank You Email
    $10 - Thank You Email + Admission To Release Party
    $20 - Custom Golden Origami + Autographed CD (Only 100 made!) + All Listed Above
    $50 - Lens T-Shirt + All Listed Above
    $75 - Prank Call ANYONE + All Listed Above
    $100 - Shoutout On The Album! + All Listed Above
    $250 - Early Access Listening Of Project + All Listed Above
    $500 - Clay Figure In Your Likeness + All Listed Above
     
  • Once we hit certain milestones, I wll be uploading entertaining videos for everyone! :p
    $100 - I will "hit the dab" while doing a FRONT FLIP
    $250 - Bomb a hill on a skateboard BLINDFOLDED
    $500 - I will FIST FIGHT my producer with Sockem Boppers
    $1000 - I will BATTLE RAP my grandmother!
    $1250 - I will release my SECOND SINGLE!!!
    $1500 - I will eat a GHOST PEPPER!!!!!!!!!!

 

How You're Helping

  • Our $1500 goal will help cover studio costs, merchandise, promotion, and more!
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that is fine. I was broke not even a year ago.

JUST. PLEASE. SHARE. THIS!!!

story:
Hey everyone,

My name is Cory Matthews and I have been making music for over 10 years. I have been working hard to perfect my craft and make music that I am proud of. I have worked with some incredible artists and really want a chance to finally put out my own music to the world. I have been working on my new album "Boy Meets World" for over 2 years now and have finally narrowed down the album to 10 songs. Writing this album has been a journey of self discovery for me. I have really grown a lot through this writing process and have finally discovered who I want to be as an artist.

Your support of this campaign will mean that I finally get to share my passion with each and every one of you. Everyone who has heard demo's of the project have fallen in love with the heart and the soul that has gone into it, and I just want to be able to share that same emotion with the rest of the world.

 

Breakdown:

  • $1000 will be used toward mixing the songs with Matty Trump who has worked with many incredible artists that I have looked up to throughout my years as an artist.

  • $500 will go towards professionally mastering the project with Sage Audio out of Nashville Tennessee who also mastered my first successful single "Broken Down"

  • $1000 will go towards visuals for the project (music videos and promotional materials)

I have already put in over $3000 for recording and production licensing and need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that money is tight and not everyone can contribute financially. Please do not hesisitate to reach out to me with other ways that you can help the project be a success.

Remember to use the share tools offered here by IndieGogo to spread the word about my project via social media.

 

Thank you everyone and God Bless You all... Let's make history together

story:
We are Eb & Flow. We are currently set out to record our new album "The Great Wave" Parts 3 & 4 @ the Saltmine Recording Studios in Phoenix AZ starting January 2017. It has always been a dream of ours to sit back and play music hands free without the recording technology interfering with our creative process. We love working in the studio and all of our writing and recordings our done by ourselves. We would like to take our music up to the Next Level and have our recordings professionally handled. This has been a dream of ours for a long time now, and it will allow us to go in to the studio and channel our energy directly to the music to create new sounds and emotions pure from our being. We feel strongly about a lot of the Improvisational songs we have done and want to channel and capture that energy in this new album. We currently are booked for 2 days in this studio. But this will only allow us to get half of the album done. We are looking for help to get a couple more days covered to finish the tracking and mastering of this new album. Along the journey we will be creating a DVD of the recording sessions ,travel, music, friends, and life to accompany the newest album. We hope to involve everyone who has helped support "The Great Wave" along the way and invite them to join us further as we delve further into the multiple dimensions of music. 

Music connects us, it heals us, music is meditation, it is relaxation. Without these a forms of connection the human race can not fully understand life. It is necessary for us to have these things we are passionate about. Because without them we will forget what it feels like to be human. It is our task to remember. Does it really matter why we are here? All that matters is every second is a recollection of ourselves, it is a fragment in time, Something to be remembered. It is our task to enjoy it! What ever it is that makes you happy! Do it! Make it happen. Music is one of those passions for us.

Studio time: We'll be booking time in the studio with enough flexibility to make sure nothing is rushed.
Mixing
Mastering
Guest Musicians: None of the band are getting paid to work on this record, but we hope to hire some exceptional professionals to give the final touch.
Production: Saltmine Engineers
Artwork
Physical CD production

Risks and challenges

Ganesh is Said to be a "Remover of all Obstacles" may obstacles be in fine balance with success.

Namaste~

story:
- For the English version of this text, please scroll down ⬇️ - 

Kort & bondig

Iedereen heeft die ene uitlaatklep. Een droom om te realiseren. Een passie om na te jagen. Dit album is dat van mij. Als ondernemer, vader en echtgenoot is mijn work-life balans een enorme evenwichtsoefening. Mijn muziek helpt mij om stoom af te laten. Het helpt mij om mijn batterijen weer op te laden en mijn creatieve geest op scherp te zetten. Die muziek komt trouwens in verschillende vormen. Je kent me misschien al van:

  • De Wednesday Night Jams 
  • De Grungblavers
  • The Voice Semi-Finalist

Maar nu is het tijd voor een eigen solo album. 

Over het album:

Het album heet 'Slower, smaller, happier'. Het is een album gebaseerd op 'goesting'. Met talent van hier en songs van eigen maak. De nummers gaan over het leven. Over fictie. Over de realiteit. Het is een funky plaat. Met dansbare songs. Het is nog in de maak, maar hier kan je alvast een eerste song beluisteren en gratis downloaden! 

>> Cassiers: Shackles & Chains <<

Waarom heb ik jou nodig?

Een eigen album opnemen kost tijd. Veel tijd én geld. Niet enkel voor mij, maar ook voor alle mensen die mij helpen bij de opnames. De eerste rekeningen heb ik zelf betaald. Het is tenslotte mijn droom. Maar als ik het goed wil doen, als ik het album juist wil laten klinken, heb ik hulp nodig. Ik heb jouw hulp nodig. Het grootste deel van deze campagne gaat naar het producen en mixen van het album. Dat is noodzakelijk voor een professionele sound. De rest van het ingezamelde geld gaat naar allerlei zaken die nodig zijn om het album te realiseren zoals ik het in mijn hoofd heb zitten.

 

Waar gaat je geld naartoe?

Om te laten zien dat ik het écht meen, wil ik heel transparant zijn. Elke euro die gestort wordt, gaat naar het realiseren van mijn droom. Jouw bijdrage gaat dus rechtstreeks naar één van de vele stappen in het proces:

 

Wat krijg je in ruil voor een bijdrage?

Elke bijdrage telt. Groot én klein. Je kan op deze pagina kiezen uit verschillende 'perks' van €5 tot €2.500. Wat je ook kiest, er staat altijd een beloning tegenover om mijn dankbaarheid te tonen. 

 

De risico's

Wat er ook gebeurt, mijn avontuur gaat verder. Ook als deze campagne haar doel niet bereikt. Never stop chasing your dream, right?  Het ingezamelde geld gaat hoe dan ook naar het album. Stel dat deze campagne enorm succesvol is, dan komen er nieuwe 'perks' bij. Dat geld gaat naar extra's en naar de oorspronkelijke onkosten die reeds zijn betaald.

Je kan ook op een andere manier helpen

Verspreid de blijde boodschap. Wil je liever niet financieel steunen? Even goede vrienden. Maar deel deze pagina dan met je vrienden en familie. Misschien willen zij een bijdrage leveren? 

Uit de grond van mijn hart: nu al bedankt om tot hier te lezen!

- English - 

Short Summary

We all have this passion project that we constantly dream about. This album is mine. I’m an entrepreneur, father of 4, husband of 1 and manager of 25. Finding the right work-life balance is a constant struggle. That’s why I often need to blow off some steam. Music is my outlet. It helps me to recharge my batteries and fuels my creativity. My music comes in many different shapes:

  • De Wednesday Night Jams 
  • De Grungblavers
  • The Voice Semi-Finalist

But now it's time for my solo album.

About the album

'Slower, smaller, happier'.  That's the name of the album. It breathes my passion. It's an album, supported by local artists and features my own, personal tracks. You will definitely feel 'the funk'. Although the album is still a work in progress, you can already listen to a preview or download this track for free!

>> Cassiers: Shackles & Chains <<

Why I need your help

Recording an album is a very time-and budget consuming adventure. Not only for me, but for all the people who are helping me out. I’ve already paid the initial costs out of my own pocket. But if I want to do it right, if I want it to sound right, I need your support. The vast majority of the funds will go towards producing and mixing the album as this sets the pro apart from the amateur. The rest of the funds goes into other necessary elements to make this album exactly the way I imagine it to be:

What you get in return

There are different donation levels, ranging from € 5 to € 2.500 . Each level corresponds to a gift that expresses my gratitude. Whatever level you choose, you’ll get immediate access to the first completed song of my album.

Risks & challenges

If I don’t hit my goal, I will continue my quest for realizing my passion project one way or another. Never stop chasing your dreams, right?

If I exceed my goal, I will use the extra funds to cover up-front expenses that go into the album and into this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If you have friends who would love my music, please invite them to join in. From the bottom of my heart, thank your for supporting me.

story:
Echo Spirit - World Music For World Peace

 This campaign ended with almost 50%, if you wish to support our project please log in to our site and get your Album (View the Perks) , We accept Paypal contributions, THANK YOU!!!!

www.echo-spirit.com
 

!!א נ ש י ם  י ק ר י ם
 אתם יכולים עדיין להיות חלק מהחזון הגדול שלנו, לעזור לנו להביא תדר של שמחה, אהבה לטבעי, לאמא אדמה, לפשוט והקל בעולמנו. להעברות בנקאיות צרו קשר בטלפון  054-9452112 

או במייל 

assirose@gmail.com

לקניית האלבום מראש דרך פייפאל כנסו לאתר

www.echo-spirit.com

Assi Rose is a music producer who plays many instruments since a very young age including Piano, Accordion, Guitar & Saxophone. Studied Jazz & World music in Goldsmith university of London, traveled the world for 15 years studying musicology and indigenous cultures. During this time Assi wrote a huge amount of compositions based on different genres such as: Flamenco, Gypsy, Indian, Afrobeat, Reggae, Latin, EU Folk etc..

Yaela Elysahiv, A singer & an international stage performer: A Dancer and an Actress. Was a part of well-known dance companies with whom she performed locally and around the world. Later in Germany, she played  lead roles in musicals & theaters. Yaela discovered spiritual books of knowledge during her travels and was eager to continue and spread those messages forward with her art.

Assi & Yaela Elyashiv met 5 years ago and became a couple raising 3 children, created Art-Celebration, a Production company and a community center with a Live stage in their own living room for local & international artists to play, with jam sessions, open mic, workshops and also with a Film & Music studio. 5 years later, the dream to create an album is finally coming true. Yaela is taking a very important part in supporting this project, manifesting it and recording female lead & backing vocals.

Why are we creating an album?

  • This is Assi Rose's first debut album!! Assi has been an active musician: has been performing since the age of 14, was involved in many different band projects & Orchestras, played on stages all over the world performing his own compositions as well as  producing & supporting well known artists. (The list is long but here are a few examples: David Grissman, Jah Levi, Shimshai, Tina Malia, Avalon Roots, Zahira, The Bindoo Babas, Yossi Fine and more.) With 1 bootleg internet album uploaded on social medias, 3 radio singles and hundred of compositions, the time has finally come to record an official studio album.

 

  • We believe the world needs each and every one us to share art of any form. We, as musicians with a private studio, are able to create a high quality album, with top musicians and deliver organic music together with up to day messages and reminders to the human kind: Find inner peace, live the moment & find happiness everywhere you are. This is why we are currently putting so much effort and valuable energy to create something we really believe in.
  • ​This album is something like a Documentary of Assi Rose's life as a traveler musician. Each album track is inspired by different music cultures and traditions. We make this album to cut through time & space and deliver something that is also a gift for generations to come.

We hope it's ok to say that we all need healing and that this planet needs our help. We may be busy doing our own thing in our daily life and may forget that we all here together in this blessed process of self & collective healing. This is the reason why we, as artist, decided to dedicate our work towards a positive cause, with an open minded attitude, We have no attachment to the outcome or to the audience's reaction / action but we do believe that our music contributes in one way or another to heal humanity and save the planet.

What We Need & What You Get

Let us break it down for you folks in more detail:

  • We plan, with your funds, to hire top class musicians as we choose to bring quality music, real music recorded in the music by real musicians who have a lot of experience to deliver the energy of the moment, the freshness in the live sound, improvisation and magic.
  • We plan, with your funds, to hire a Top professional mixing studio and engineer to mix & master our album. In the end of the day, the quality of sound makes a difference, we need the quality with the professional touch to make this project stand out and do justice to our compositions and all the hard work involved around the recordings. 
  • We plan, with your funds to push this Album forward in social media, Apple music, spotify, get covered in music articles & magazines, get Tv & Radio interviews. An album is not only about music making but also about getting the music out there to wider circles beyond our friends & family and it does require much time, energy and budget.

The Impact

We believe our music and the messages in this album may raise a smile on your face or make you cry, uplift your spirit, energize and heal your body as we share strong information that came to us through meditation, books & lectures, reminding us to live each moment as it is, accept our reality as it is and find true happiness everywhere we are no matter what happens. We are not responsible for the causes that make us unhappy, we are not guilty even when we look around and see things we don't like or don't agree with. If we really want to make change, we should focus on our inner peace, inner happiness, shift our consciousness by thinking about something nice & positive. The lyrics in the album are designed to remind us that things are ok and will only get better if we believe in it. Our music is recorded on 432 Hz (Healing frequency) to heal our bodies and feel powerful & healthy enough to become strong light warriors, to transform our reality and deliver a great planet to our grandchildren. 

Your donation is important

We promise that all funds raised will be invested in this project and that this Album will be complete.

Hey people, if you can't contribute with money donations, you can still help us a lot!

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign with the 'Indiegogo Share tools'

We thank you deep from our hearts

Love & Light to you all, may we all shine bright and uplift our spirit

Assi & Yaela
story_txt:
Echo Spirit - World Music For World Peace
 This campaign ended with almost 50%, if you wish to support our project please log in to our site and get your Album (View the Perks) , We accept Paypal contributions, THANK YOU!!!!

www.echo-spirit.com 
!!א נ ש י ם  י ק ר י ם אתם יכולים עדיין להיות חלק מהחזון הגדול שלנו, לעזור לנו להביא תדר של שמחה, אהבה לטבעי, לאמא אדמה, לפשוט והקל בעולמנו. להעברות בנקאיות צרו קשר בטלפון  054-9452112 
או במייל 
assirose@gmail.com
לקניית האלבום מראש דרך פייפאל כנסו לאתר
www.echo-spirit.comAssi Rose is a music producer who plays many instruments since a very young age including Piano, Accordion, Guitar & Saxophone. Studied Jazz & World music in Goldsmith university of London, traveled the world for 15 years studying musicology and indigenous cultures. During this time Assi wrote a huge amount of compositions based on different genres such as: Flamenco, Gypsy, Indian, Afrobeat, Reggae, Latin, EU Folk etc..
Yaela Elysahiv, A singer & an international stage performer: A Dancer and an Actress. Was a part of well-known dance companies with whom she performed locally and around the world. Later in Germany, she played  lead roles in musicals & theaters. Yaela discovered spiritual books of knowledge during her travels and was eager to continue and spread those messages forward with her art.
Assi & Yaela Elyashiv met 5 years ago and became a couple raising 3 children, created Art-Celebration, a Production company and a community center with a Live stage in their own living room for local & international artists to play, with jam sessions, open mic, workshops and also with a Film & Music studio. 5 years later, the dream to create an album is finally coming true. Yaela is taking a very important part in supporting this project, manifesting it and recording female lead & backing vocals.

Why are we creating an album?


This is Assi Rose's first debut album!! Assi has been an active musician: has been performing since the age of 14, was involved in many different band projects & Orchestras, played on stages all over the world performing his own compositions as well as  producing & supporting well known artists. (The list is long but here are a few examples: David Grissman, Jah Levi, Shimshai, Tina Malia, Avalon Roots, Zahira, The Bindoo Babas, Yossi Fine and more.) With 1 bootleg internet album uploaded on social medias, 3 radio singles and hundred of compositions, the time has finally come to record an official studio album.
 

We believe the world needs each and every one us to share art of any form. We, as musicians with a private studio, are able to create a high quality album, with top musicians and deliver organic music together with up to day messages and reminders to the human kind: Find inner peace, live the moment & find happiness everywhere you are. This is why we are currently putting so much effort and valuable energy to create something we really believe in.
​This album is something like a Documentary of Assi Rose's life as a traveler musician. Each album track is inspired by different music cultures and traditions. We make this album to cut through time & space and deliver something that is also a gift for generations to come.

We hope it's ok to say that we all need healing and that this planet needs our help. We may be busy doing our own thing in our daily life and may forget that we all here together in this blessed process of self & collective healing. This is the reason why we, as artist, decided to dedicate our work towards a positive cause, with an open minded attitude, We have no attachment to the outcome or to the audience's reaction / action but we do believe that our music contributes in one way or another to heal humanity and save the planet.

What We Need & What You Get
Let us break it down for you folks in more detail:

We plan, with your funds, to hire top class musicians as we choose to bring quality music, real music recorded in the music by real musicians who have a lot of experience to deliver the energy of the moment, the freshness in the live sound, improvisation and magic.

We plan, with your funds, to hire a Top professional mixing studio and engineer to mix & master our album. In the end of the day, the quality of sound makes a difference, we need the quality with the professional touch to make this project stand out and do justice to our compositions and all the hard work involved around the recordings. 
We plan, with your funds to push this Album forward in social media, Apple music, spotify, get covered in music articles & magazines, get Tv & Radio interviews. An album is not only about music making but also about getting the music out there to wider circles beyond our friends & family and it does require much time, energy and budget.


The Impact
We believe our music and the messages in this album may raise a smile on your face or make you cry, uplift your spirit, energize and heal your body as we share strong information that came to us through meditation, books & lectures, reminding us to live each moment as it is, accept our reality as it is and find true happiness everywhere we are no matter what happens. We are not responsible for the causes that make us unhappy, we are not guilty even when we look around and see things we don't like or don't agree with. If we really want to make change, we should focus on our inner peace, inner happiness, shift our consciousness by thinking about something nice & positive. The lyrics in the album are designed to remind us that things are ok and will only get better if we believe in it. Our music is recorded on 432 Hz (Healing frequency) to heal our bodies and feel powerful & healthy enough to become strong light warriors, to transform our reality and deliver a great planet to our grandchildren. 
Your donation is importantWe promise that all funds raised will be invested in this project and that this Album will be complete.Hey people, if you can't contribute with money donations, you can still help us a lot!Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign with the 'Indiegogo Share tools'We thank you deep from our heartsLove & Light to you all, may we all shine bright and uplift our spiritAssi & Yaela

story:
Short Summary

Drive By Wire has been rocking for over 10 years! Starting with the release of our brand new single 'Blood Red Moon' we've finetuned our unique heavy-rock sound, and now we want to record our 4th full-length album fulll of new kickass material.... The days that recordlabels payed the bills for studio-costs, producers, mixing and mastering are long gone......bands have to cough that money up themselves..

 We  decided to take matters into our own and your hands and want to raise money for the new album together with  fans, friends and family who have helped keep this band  going all these years. Throughout the years , we've released 3 full length albums, toured all over Europe, and pretty much lived and breathed this music as long as we've been around....

We are an independent band ( although backed up by a small but very good Indie/stonerrock recordcompany for distribution) free from obligations and want to be in control of our 'careers'. Crowdfunding seems to be the way to go nowadays... it's a way that supporters of this kind of music/ Drive By Wire  know exactly where their hard earned money is going. No middlemen, no commissions, no greedy managers, no bullshit.

What We Need & What You Get

Over the last couple months, we watched other bands use this method and actually succeed. There have been many different approaches and fans of music are starting to understand this format.

The success of this campaign will determine how amazing this record will become. We are set up for Flex Funding which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. So, if we don't reach our goal, we will have to reevaluate how we are planning to do this record. Regardless, we are ready to deliver this thing however our campaign plays out.

The Impact

Every time we've headed into the studio in the past, we've kept all the people who have supported Drive By Wire in mind. But, the level of responsibility is so much higher this time.

With that in mind, we give you our word that we will not settle for 'good enough' - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in this thing will be reflected in the final product.

Lets raise our glasses to making our best album yet... Hell Yeah!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support us, but can't miss the cash – there are other ways you can help out;  Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We don't expect everyone who digs our music to jump on board, just let people know this is happening. With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, by posting links of this crowdfunding-campaign you are reaching places we would never be able to reach..... So, let's spread the word, and lets make this happen together!  Cheers!

 

Exclusive T-shirt (see perks)

story: Honestly, I'm not quite sure what the approach on this new record is going to be. I'm toying with a few ideas. 5 songs were written on piano and 5 on guitar so the arrangements will come from that. I've got a few crazy ideas but can't really nail down anything until I know what my budget is going to be. I'll be sure to share the whole process with you once I get started. Maybe I'll even Facebook Live some of the sessions if that's something you'd be interested in. I'm hoping to have some "special guests" appear!

story:
"Shay is one of San Diego’s most electrifying artists, with a sassy, brassy stage presence that makes her one of the area’s top performers to watch" - Bart Mendoza, Beach and Bay Press

I’ve always wanted to be a performer.  Anyone who knew me as a child can tell you stories of me putting on living room productions and singing into my hairbrush; I told my mom at 3 that I wanted to be onstage.  However after 20+ years of theater and going on to study acting in college, I began to wonder where my true niche was.

Shortly after college I started swing dancing and fell in love with the sounds of sultry torch singers and brassy big bands, and at the encouragement of friends started performing at some of the local dance events.  It didn’t take long for things to start picking up, and shortly thereafter I started performing more regularly with different groups of musicians in varying genres.  When I discovered the rockin' rhythm and blues of the ‘50s and ‘60s I knew I had something I could sink my teeth into.

In 2012, towards the beginning of my career, I recorded my debut album with the producer and multi-instrumental Archie Thompson.  “Soul Tonic” was comprised of wonderful arrangements of covers in several genres I loved to sing (from jazz standards  to soul to R&B), as well as original tunes written by Archie (and one co-written by me).  Since that album my career has grown exponentially: traveling to sing in Brazil, Argentina, and Mexico, winning awards, recording on different projects for other musicians and producers, playing hundreds of shows each year.  I’m truly fortunate to get to do what I love for a living and get so many opportunities to bring joy to people through music.

Although I’ve recorded on projects with other people, I’ve waited 5 years to make a new album of my own because I wanted to feel like I really knew what my “sound” was, what I needed to say, and who I really was as an artist.  Now (with your help) I am ready to bring my vision to fruition.  My vision for this album is inspired by the feelings I get from some of my favorite artists: the energy of Little Richard, the passion of Etta James, and the soul of Otis Redding.

What You’re Supporting

With your contributions, I will record my album at Greaseland Studios

The money raised from this campaign will go towards:

  • Travel to studio for myself & musicians
  • Recording: Studio time for 1 week and mixing
  • Musicians
  • Mastering
  • Graphic Design: Album Artwork
  • Duplication: Printing CDs
  • Album Distribution
  • Promotion: Making sure the word gets out about the album once we get it done

Risks & Challenges

I'm a hard worker and I have a difficult time asking for help, so it's taken a bit of convincing on my part to put this campaign together to ask for your assistance.  So since I am asking for it now, I’ve done a lot of the legwork upfront to remove as much risk to supporters as possible.  This includes:

  • Originals songs have been composed
  • Overall theme for album has been picked and all songs have been chosen
  • Jan 8-12 is reserved at the Studio
  • Musicians are booked
  • Album Cover shoot is done
  • Graphic designer is on board
  • Publicist is reserved
  • CD duplication is lined up

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everyone can help out financially and that’s OK!

But, if you still want to help, you can do so by:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook
  • Tweet it out
  • Email It / Instagram It / Shout it from the rooftops!

story:
Hello beautiful people! It is with glowing pride that Nelumbo Records presents to you SHAK’s Debut EP pre-release Tour 2018. Shak’thiya has been a Nelumbo Artist since early 2017. Most people know him by his stage name, SHAK. Nelumbo Records is an independent Singapore-based Record Label that focuses on soul, funk, jazz and groove music. To put it simply, we are dedicated to the groove. Our mission is to foster emerging and established artists in discovering and amplifying their unique sound.

Nelumbo records and SHAK are delighted to share with you his music from his debut EP entitled ‘Sitting at Home’. With that, we are planning to do an EP pre-release tour to Manila, Sydney and Melbourne.

To do a music tour, there is a notable amount of expense, which includes Promotions, Travel, Lodging, Equipment Rental and Food. The music business is always growing and evolving to meet the needs of the listeners. Not so long ago, music artists had to perform live shows for their music to be known and develop their fan-base. Kudos to the internet, artists now have used Youtube as a justifying platform to gain popularity amongst a virtual fan-base. However, even though it is an effective approach to gaining fans and industry attention, this virtual stage does not assure that an artist is a good live performer. Having access to various means of recording equipment and an intelligent studio engineer helps internet music artists gain more legitimacy, but at some point, standing in the crowd and being a part of the live performance is an experience that can not be replicated via a YouTube video.

So YES, we would like to humbly seek your help in making this dream tour happen. If you have read this far, thank you so much! You are totally awesome and we want you to know that we really  and truly appreciate your support. We are aware that your time is valuable, and so we will elaborate to the best that we can within the brief description below.

Our goal for this campaign is to present SHAK’s music on an international stage. To enable this dream requires a lot of effort and can cost more than you would think. Here is the breakdown of the costs that will go into this tour and planning:

  • Promotion costs
  • Travel costs  (incl. food, lodging, flights, food etc.)
  • Merchandise manufacturing
  • Tour Designer for Merchandise
  • Live music arrangements
  • Musicians' Fees
  • MI and PA Rental
  • Insurance

 

Shak'thiya goes by the stage name SHAK. He began writing music, during his days in National Service. Around this time, he also found a love for poetry and is an avid attendee of Open-Mic nights in Singapore. SHAK is currently a host of a weekly music Open Mic session at The Beast Southern Kitchen + Bar.

With various musical influences from soul, blues, folk-pop to hip-hop, SHAK explains his life journey with melancholic lyrics and folk-tunes. As he sings, he strikes a balance between the extremities.

Apart from that, SHAK stands amongst the list of young and promising talents in Singapore and has participated in National Arts Council programmes such as the Noise Singapore Music Mentorship programme 2016 and The Great Singapore Replay 2017. Recently, SHAK has been featured in the 2017 ST Sessions, The Straits Times' online video series featuring rising talents in the home-grown music scene performing stripped-down live sets.

(Video by: 65 Spectrums)

Since their debut performance in 2016, The Baits has been a growing household session band in Singapore. The band lends their hypnotic groove for any singer-songwriter or artists who wish to perform with a band on stage. Inspired by soul, blues, folk-pop and hip-hop, The Baits have only one mission: To evoke fun and playfulness, on and off stage, to each and every listener.

 

Sitting at Home is the debut EP of local singer/songwriter Shak'thiya, more commonly known as SHAK. The EP explores his struggle in the search for a place to call home; be it as a physical place or within the emotional space of someone else. Accompanied by the stylings of his backing band The Baits, the 5 track EP weaves through various genres with the simple intent of conveying honest circumstance with solid groove.

(Video by: 65 Spectrums)

After holding the polls on Soundcloud, you have voted to include these 5 songs in the EP, (1) Mama Told Me, (2) Sitting at Home, (3) Sleep Talk, (4) Where are you?, and (5) Funny That Way. The plan is simple: we will be releasing the EP in June 2018! So prior to the release, we want to tour and provide you a preview of the songs live, and at the same time promote the EP. We want to perform for our fans in Manila (Feb), Sydney and Melbourne (March), and then back home in Singapore for the EP Launch showcase.

If the campaign exceeds the goal amount, we will use it to fund for our EP Launch show and continue to write more songs for you.

THANK YOU so much for taking the time to check out our IndieGoGo page. We truly appreciate your time and any and all support we shall or already have received! With that, we leave you with an interview from the Straits Times in 2017.

 (Video by: Straits Times SG)

story:
The Ventriloquist Mute's new album "Revenant"

While I have enjoyed making music for many years, this is the first album that I really put a deeply personal and private part of myself into. I have struggled with addiction, as have many close friends and family members, and this album is my story.

  • My dad gave me my first guitar when I was 16 and things slowly developed from that moment.
  • This album is deeply personal to me and tells a story that a lot of people can relate to.
  • I make music as a personal hobby, and as such I do not have corporate backing to help fund the printing, marketing, and distribution of my music. 

I am hoping that those who enjoy my music and want to support a meaningful project will contribute in whatever way they can and enjoy the high quality product they get in return.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The printing of 100 physical copies of the album and 100 11x17 posters will cost $405 dollars; this is where most of the funding is going. The remaining funding goal amount will cover the printing of the t-shirts and distribution on iTunes, google music, etc.
  • I tried to make the perks the things that I would want if I were backing an independent band's project: hard copies of the album, posters, and t-shirts. 
  • I am prepared to dedicate whatever amount of my personal money is needed towards fulfilling funding gaps should this campaign not cover the full cost of printing. 

The Impact

  • Label backed music has become so highly corporatized that there is little room left for creative experimentation out of fear of reduced profit margin and angry stock holder meetings. Crowdfunding gives the power back to both artists and the consumer to make and enjoy something that is unique and inspiring. 
  • I crowdfunded my previous album on Kickstarter successfully and verified that all backers received their promised rewards on time. I am not one to leave a project unfinished: especially one as deeply personal and important to me as this. 
  • I love making music and I hope to reach as many people as possible who may enjoy my music. If even just one person finds meaning or inspiration in my music, then I consider my project a resounding success. Anything more is just icing on the cake!

Risks & Challenges

I would imagine this is a pretty low risk campaign for backers because I have a modest funding target, realistic goals, and lots of experience in making albums independently. The main risk would be a 30-60 day delay in printing the albums/posters/t-shirts so that I can save up enough of my own money to pay for the printing. This would certainly be a burden but I am prepared to do whatever is necessary to make this album happen

Other Ways You Can Help

For an independent artist the hardest thing is getting the word out about your project. 

  • Taking a few minutes of your time to stream my music (it's free!) and let me know what you think is immensely helpful.
  • If you like my music or think you know someone who would like it, share it around! Social media is hugely beneficial to artists in my position and empowers you the listener to connect directly with the artist (me!)
  • Like my Facebook page and connect with me! I love to chat with fellow music lovers and genuinely appreciate feedback, even if it's critical. 

Thanks for checking out my project and I can't wait to share this album with you all!
story_txt:
The Ventriloquist Mute's new album "Revenant"
While I have enjoyed making music for many years, this is the first album that I really put a deeply personal and private part of myself into. I have struggled with addiction, as have many close friends and family members, and this album is my story.

My dad gave me my first guitar when I was 16 and things slowly developed from that moment.
This album is deeply personal to me and tells a story that a lot of people can relate to.
I make music as a personal hobby, and as such I do not have corporate backing to help fund the printing, marketing, and distribution of my music. 

I am hoping that those who enjoy my music and want to support a meaningful project will contribute in whatever way they can and enjoy the high quality product they get in return.
What We Need & What You Get

story:
Short Summary

The Charleston Civic Chorus has a 66-year tradition of providing quality choral performances for the greater Charleston area FREE OF CHARGE.  We depend on funding from this campaign along with corporate and private contributions, grants, and sponsorships to offset part of our operating expenses, salaries, fees for guest performers, music scores, concert hall rent, program printing and advertising. 

Your contribution to this campaign is extremely important to us and will be greatly appreciated.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $2,000 from this campaign to cover the fees for our guest performers, their sound engineer, and a portion of our expenses for advertising, venue rental, insurance, music scores, and salaries of our Artistic Director/Conductor and our Accompanist.

If we do not reach our campaign goal the performance will still go on, but with somewhat reduced funds for additional performances in 2018.

The Impact

By offering this performance to the greater Charleston, West Virginia area FREE OF CHARGE, everyone can come and enjoy an evening of quality choral performance regardless of their financial status.

Now in our 66th year, The Charleston Civic Chorus has established a relationship with the community in which we can be trusted to present wholesome programs suitable for all family members.

We have had a successful track record with crowdfunding including a previous campaign to bring renowned Canadian composer Eleanor Daley to Charleston, WV for an afternoon of her reflective and evocative music. Ms. Daley accompanied The Charleston Civic Chorus on piano and organ, on a concert that included 18 of her compositions.

Risks & Challenges

It is always a challenge to present a widely varying range of choral music that will attract and appeal to the varying interests of the community.  To that end, our Artistic Director and Conductor organizes the repertoire for each performance around a central theme with diverse forms of choral music that relate to that theme, along with his insights and excellent commentary in the concert programs. Enhancing the appeal of this 90-minute performance will be a 25-minute independent set by our guest artists, the Mountain Thyme Appalachian Ensemble, including a piece that combines the voices and instrumentalists of both the Charleston Civic Chorus and the Mountain Thyme Ensemble.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you choose to contribute to our campaign, or even if you do not feel that you can contribute but recognize the value of this project to the community, please share this information and a link to this campaign with your friends and family members via email and social media.

If you are interested in attending this FREE event of the Charleston Civic Chorus, please mark your calendars for Friday evening, December 1, 2017, 7:30 pm in the sanctuary of the Charleston Baptist Temple, corner of Quarrier & Morris Streets, Charleston, West Virginia. We hope to see you there!

story:
100th Anniversary Celebration Concert in the memory of Maestro Antonio Janigro

On January 21, 2018, we will be celebrating the  100th Anniversary of the birth of the famous cellist, pedagogue and conductor, Maestro Antonio Janigro. Although born Italian , with his many years of musical activities in Croatia, Janigro had made invaluable contributions to this country and created generations of musicians, many of whom are now internationally acclaimed musicians. 

Antonio Janigro, in addition of being a world-renowned cello soloist and teacher, was also the founder of the Zagreb Soloists, a chamber orchestra that made him famous as a conductor as well. This ensemble has been the Ambassador of Croatian Culture for over 60 years. Janigro was also the founder of the Croatian Radio Television Symphony Orchestra. 

Naming a street or square after him is in progress by the Zagreb Street Naming Committee . A concert will take place in the memory of Janigro  in Zagreb's premier concert hall,  "Vatroslav Lisinski" and will be broadcasted by the local media. The schedule of the event is planned to take place in four parts: 

1. We will show a short documentary about Antonio Janigro's life followed by the introductory speeches.

2. Thomas Demenga (Switzerland) will perform with Zagreb Soloists.

3. Performances  by his former students who are now internationally acclaimed cellists such as: Julius Berger (Germany), ,Thomas Demenga (Switzerland),  Andrej
Petrač (Slovenia) ,and a masterclass by Michael Flaksman (USA / Germany). An ensemble of the principals of Croatian and Slovenian orchestras will be featured as well.

4. A special cello ensemble "100 cellos for the 100th Birthday" is going to be formed and will play  for this special occasion. 

The celebration of the great Antonio Janigro is a necessary engagement for all cellists and musicians ,and for those responsible for the cultural life of Croatia and the world. We need your help to make this important anniversary happen, any contribution is welcome, and will be recognized on the program.

story:
Who Are The Vocal Blue Trains?

We are a choir of vocalists who create and rearrange contemporary music with an incredible pop-blues-jazz sound mixed with traditional gospel and modern electronic music. Although we've been active for just under 2 years, the project has gained national and international acclaim in more than 40 performances across Italy and Europe, including the Prague International Choral Meeting 2016 and the Wien International Choir Festival 2017.

Why We Need Your Support...

Our director Alessandro Gerini unexpectedly received an invitation to participate in the Jeju International Choir Festival. We were ecstatic! We did some research; for our flights to and from South Korea, Korean Airlines will be supporting us with a convention, however, the round trip will cost about €1000 per choir member - the Vocal Blue Trains are 35. Yep, that means our total amounts to €35,000 euros. Wowza!

We're doing all we can to fundraise, so here on Indiegogo, our goal is €12.000 euro. 

PA (Pretty Awesome) Perks!

To support our dream you will get our deepest gratitude! We will also be giving out awesome gifts to those who can help us lower the costs incurred for this trip, including:

  • Official "Thank You" video taken on stage at the Jeju International Choir Festival
  • T-shirts, signed posters and other cool VBT merchandise
  • Individual or choral voice lessons
  • Your name in the credits of our next official video
  • The opportunity to participate at a Vocal Blue Trains rehearsal
  • A Vocal Blue Trains private concert just for you!

Even if we don't reach our full goal of €12.000 euro, we will still be able to apply all the collected funds to defer the cost of our trip. 

Per leggere le istruzioni e le traduzioni dei perk in italiano clicca qui.

What else are we doing?

To help us get to South Korea we are taking other actions including:

  • Fundraising events
  • Sponsorship packages
  • Exclusive concerts

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help us monetarily, there are a few simple things you can do to provide your support:

  • Share our campaign on your social channels Facebook, Twitter, Instagram
  • Follow us on our official channels
  • Spread, the word to your friends and acquaintances!

Every little help brings us closer to our goal! :)

story:
My name is Hailey Mae Niswanger, I am a saxophonist, composer, vocalist, and lover. My passion for music has been the driving force of my life ever since I can remember. Throughout my childhood years I studied piano, clarinet, saxophone, flute and accordion. Saxophone became my main focus and upon graduating high school, I went on to attend Berklee College of Music to study Jazz Performance. During my freshman year of college, I released my first album, Confeddie (2009). After graduating, I moved to Brooklyn, where I began working as a professional musician, and released my second jazz album, The Keeper (2012). A few years later, I released my third album, a funk project titled PDX Soul (2015), thanks to a successfully funded crowd campaign. And while all these projects were representative of me at those times, I felt like I had yet to find the sound that was truly my purpose, and where I felt the most free. 

So I started letting go of concepts, boxes, and genres that would tell me to write or play a certain way. I opened myself up to all the many different influences around me, and began recognizing our connection to all the life we see and beyond. Meditating on this, I let the music flow through me, without judgement, and found MAE.SUN. This is the most honest, and real I have ever felt with my music, and I believe it's music for the world, intended to help us be free and conscious of the interdependent nature of reality. 

Last December we went into the studio to record Vol. 1: Inter-be. The album features Nikara Warren on the vibraphone, Andrew Renfroe on guitar, Axel Laugart on keys, Aaron Liao on bass, David Frazier Jr. on drums, and I am on soprano sax and vocals. But releasing an album is not easy. It takes months of preparation before and after the recording. It costs a great amount to pay for the studio time and engineer, the musicians, the mixing and mastering of the album, as well as the expenses for pressing the album, the visuals, distribution, and promotion. 

I have been able to budget on expenses so far, but I am in honest need of help to complete the first volume, in addition to recording and releasing the second. If this campaign is successfully funded with $15,000, it would help both of these projects come to fruition. In exchange for your donations, you would receive digital and autographed hard copies of Vol. 1, stickers, T-shirts, a poster of the album art work done by the talented Anna Lise Holly, handmade dream catchers, Skype lessons, VIP tickets to a future concert, a cover recording song of choice, or an original composition. 

It is my dream to release as much honest music as possible, and to make this world a better place through the music. Your contribution will help this music thrive; and in a world with so much separation, fear, and pain, I believe that it is a necessary reminder to be love. Any amount is extremely helpful, and if you are unable to contribute financially but still believe in our music and message, we would greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word to your community about this project.

 

Thank you so much for your support, and I am so excited to bring you all MAE.SUN Volumes 1 & 2!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Karel Ruzicka and I am a saxophone player, composer, producer and educator based in New York City. I perform and record regularly with my groups as a leader and as a sideman I worked with legendary musicians such as Michael Franks, George Benson, Ravi Coltrane, Roy Hargrove, Ben E. King (he wrote and first recorded the hit R&B classic "Stand By Me") , Arturo Sandoval, Dean Brown, Mike Stern, Reggie Young and many others. I am also a frequent guest artist at the Jazz at the Lincoln Center as well as a band member at the Times Square Church.

This upcoming musical offering is called "Grace and Gratitude". This title reflects how positively transformative experiencing grace and responding with gratitude can be. Grace makes things seemingly impossible, possible. And gratitude brings into our life true joy and more things to be grateful for. This is the theme and inspiration for the compositions on this album. Music has so much healing power and my chief aim is to help bring joy and healing among us through the tunes on this album. 

The group that I have put together for this special project is a true dream team. Pianist Jon Cowherd is a member of the Brian Blade Fellowship and also performed with Norah Jones, Cassandra Willson, Iggy Pop and many others. Bassist John Patitucci can be heard with Chick Corea Elektric Band, Wayne Shorter Quartet and did work with Herbie Hancock, Sting, Michael Brecker, Joe Lovano and the list goes on. Drummer Nate Smith has just received a Grammy nomination for a composition "Home Free" from his album KINFOLK-Postcards from Everywhere. He has toured and recorded with Dave Holland, Chris Potter, Ravi Coltrane, Regina Carter, Nicholas Payton and others.

Once again, it is my great pleasure to invite you on this incredible journey with me. Your contributions will help me bring this music to life (and to you).  Moreover, it will be performed and recorded by some of the finest musicians and recording engineers in the world.  This is a big deal and together we are about to make it possible!

 

 

Budget

 

I am very excited about this album and about the musicians, producers and engineers I will be working with to bring this project to life. Making an album is not only a lot of work, but there are many necessary expenses required to create a quality product. This is what $19,750 will pay for:

  • Musicians
  • Studio Engineers
  • Rehearsal Studio
  • Recording Studio
  • Mixing, Mastering
  • CD Artwork/Design
  • CD Manufacturing

For your contributions you will receive rewards ranging from digital downloads, physical CD's, photos/videos,  to your name in the booklet or executive producer credit to more interactive experiences such as online lessons and private in-house concerts (only in NYC Metro Area, Philadelphia,Washington DC,NJ,CT,MA or with all travel expenses covered extra if you are in CA or elsewhere in the US) The live concert option is only available in the USA. The personnel will include top musicians from the NY jazz scene.

Your funds will go towards releasing this project even if we raise less funds than our entire goal. However the number of tracks on the album and album release date might be affected because of the time constraints caused by reduced funding.

 

The Impact

 

Your contribution to this project will provide you with high quality music and the inside look into various aspects of the creative process. All my recordings as both a leader and sideman up to date received awards and nominations and great reviews. Become a part of yet another success!  

 

Risks & Challenges

We will record on June 5 and 6, 2018 and mixing/mastering will proceed subsequently. We expect a release date by the end of October 2018 on the Czech independent label Animal Music https://animalmusic.cz/en?switch=1.

The studio, musicians and rehearsal space have already been booked. Music always has challenges such as meeting all the various deadlines and other unforeseen circumstances. But the team I have in place to see this project through to its completion makes all risks and challenges easy to overcome. We got you covered!

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are in no position to contribute financially, you can still help us make this happen. We will greatly appreciate if you spread the word and make some buzz about this campaign. Send an email with a link to your friends and do not forget to take advantage of all the available Indiegogo share tools.

Your contributions will help me bring this music to life (and to you).  Moreover, it will be performed and recorded by some of the finest musicians and recording engineers in the world.  This is a big deal and together we are about to make it possible!
