I am very excited about this album and about the musicians, producers and engineers I will be working with to bring this project to life. Making an album is not only a lot of work, but there are many necessary expenses required to create a quality product. This is what $19,750 will pay for:

Musicians
Studio Engineers
Rehearsal Studio
Recording Studio
Mixing, Mastering
CD Artwork/Design
CD Manufacturing

For your contributions you will receive rewards ranging from digital downloads, physical CD's, photos/videos,  to your name in the booklet or executive producer credit to more interactive experiences such as online lessons and private in-house concerts (only in NYC Metro Area, Philadelphia,Washington DC,NJ,CT,MA or with all travel expenses covered extra if you are in CA or elsewhere in the US) The live concert option is only available in the USA. The personnel will include top musicians from the NY jazz scene.
Your funds will go towards releasing this project even if we raise less funds than our entire goal. However the number of tracks on the album and album release date might be affected because of the time constraints caused by reduced funding.

 
The Impact
 
Your contribution to this project will provide you with high quality music and the inside look into various aspects of the creative process. All my recordings as both a leader and sideman up to date received awards and nominations and great reviews. Become a part of yet another success!  

 
Risks & Challenges
We will record on June 5 and 6, 2018 and mixing/mastering will proceed subsequently. We expect a release date by the end of October 2018 on the Czech independent label Animal Music https://animalmusic.cz/en?switch=1.
The studio, musicians and rehearsal space have already been booked. Music always has challenges such as meeting all the various deadlines and other unforeseen circumstances. But the team I have in place to see this project through to its completion makes all risks and challenges easy to overcome. We got you covered!
  

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are in no position to contribute financially, you can still help us make this happen. We will greatly appreciate if you spread the word and make some buzz about this campaign. Send an email with a link to your friends and do not forget to take advantage of all the available Indiegogo share tools.

story:
My name is Jacqui Treco, and I am a singer-songwriter currently based out of Nashville, TN. I'm a city kid with a habit of spending summers in small towns, Bahamian-born and raised in the ever-expanding DC metro area. During my junior year of college I released my first EP, Genevieve. Now almost a year and a half later, I've graduated, relocated, and I'm starting the groundwork for my first full-length album. This single—which will be included on the album—is the next step toward pursuing a career in music. At the end of this month, Cathryn and I will be traveling to Atlanta, Georgia to record with our friend and Love Good Music tour mate, Shawn Williams. We are so excited to work with him and the rest of his team at Papercastle Records! The single will be released in early November 2016, and your contributions now will help lay the foundation of the album coming in 2017!

 

For this project, we need to raise $2000. Here is a breakdown of what your donations will accomplish: 

- $1,575 — Papercastle Records — Recording, Production, Mixing, Mastering

- $100 — indiegogo.com — 5% Charge for Project Platform

- $200 — Travel Costs — Car Rental, Gas, Lodging, Food

- $125 — Miscellaneous — Limited Edition Prints, Patron Rewards, etc.

To show my appreciation for your generosity, I've created some perks to thank you for all your help! These include limited edition prints, handwritten lyrics and background info about the songs, download cards, a Nashville care package and more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to donate or not, please share this page on all your social media and with family, friends and strangers alike! Nothing beats a personal recommendation and I'd be grateful for yours!

story:
ARTIST BIO AND MUSIC - KYEKYEKU (GHANA)

Kyekyeku is described by CNN AFRICAN VOICES as a ‘Wizard with a Guitar’. A Ghanaian musician whose acoustic and electric guitars sounds, intricate percussive groove and lush horns defines a style that carries a distinctive Ghanaian sound and image locked between folk and a throbbing urban highlife beat. Kyekyeku is seen as a new generation of young lively Ghanaian musicians that is combining musical traditions from roots PALMWINE (a style of Ghanaian folk) HIGHLIFE and AFROBEAT; performing live in new and exciting sounds. 
The young Ghanaian musician has collaborated with world-renowned musicians including Peter White (UK/Jazz), Thais Morel (Brazil), Mayra Andrade (Cape Verde), Blick Bassy (Cameroun), Ebo Taylor (Ghana), Pat Thomas (Ghana), Atongo Zimba (Ghana) and played same stage as Bob James and Earl klugh.

The singer-guitarist and producer is often seen in his native home Accra, Ghana performing with his band or in solo sets and has been on a study rise with his unique blend of music and message.

RFI Feature
http://en.rfi.fr/africa/20160623-ghanas-kyekyek... 
CNN AFRICAN VOICES –Profiling Kyekyeku on the American news network.
http://edition.cnn.com/videos/tv/2016/02/26/mus... 

FIRST ALBUM ON SOUNDCLOUD - https://soundcloud.com/kyekyeku/sets/album-high...

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:

Kyekyeku seeks to bring his group on tour as their next stage of development and views music festivals across Africa as great way to meet a wider live audience and share the results of hard word through great music and fun in addition to calling attention to the various dysfunctionalites in Africa which is a central theme in Kyekyeku’s music with the hope of contributing to finding solutions.

This year the band performed outside of Ghana at MASA Festival; which is one of Africa’s biggest arts and spectacles expo held in La Cote D’Ivoire where several agents and promoters attend to book acts. The band’s performance and music at MASA caught the eye of other agents, who extended invitations to perform at other festivals thereafter. Consequently, Kyekyeku has been invited at the annual Visa For Music expo in Rabat, Morocco.

For the last 2 years Kyekyeku and his band have worked hard and been invited on several musical events and stages in Accra’s live music scene. The band is one of the most frequently seen playing their own compositions of re-visited Highlife and Afrobeat styles from Ghana.

Being invited at Visa for Music is an incredible opportunity for Kyekyeku and his band to get exposure to a professional crowd and to take his music to the next level. 

 

By contributing to the cost of international flight tickets, you will be helping Kyekyeku towards this aim!

Thank you for sharing with those you think might be interested in supporting this project.

With your help, we can do it.

story:
About Me and My Efforts:

My name is Jorge Juan B. Wieneke V and I make music under the name "similarobjects". I have a deep-seated passion for sharing knowledge and ushering in growth and evolution through the act of creation- most often in the field of sound and art.

you can check most of my material over here: 

https://soundcloud.com/similarobjects/

+ + +

I have a heart for community and education and this is evident with my involvement in the music industry, both locally and globally.

I wish to be a universal connector and with all things in mind, I aim to foster an open-minded future for all. I currently teach Electronic Music as a member of the academe at De La Salle College of Saint Benilde under their AB Music Production Program and I head my own mentorship program/music school called "Cosmic Sonic Arts" where I promote a conscious and spiritual approach to creation.

I believe in always looking beyond what is presented and in the power of intention, frequency and vibration. These are some values that I like to instill among my students and everyone I cross paths with.

Short Summary:

About 4 months ago I signed up for Ableton Loop with no second guesses. I wanted to try and land that slot before anything else and chose to figure out the rest when the spot was secured. I thought I’d leave it up to chance to decide whether or not I could make it happen.

Last month I was lucky enough to be allotted a slot and a ticket. Cosmic Sonic Arts has already helped out by paying for my ticket to the event but I still have a long way to go in being able to manage all the expenses required. Hopefully I can make the trip to Berlin for Ableton Loop while landing some shows there in the process.

 

Finances have been a struggle and it would be nice to receive help from people who are willing to lend a hand, and in change I can share a part of myself with sincerity.

 

What I’m asking for and what you’ll get from me:

I need to raise 4,000 USD to cover travel expenses, accommodations, transport, and food for the duration of my stay. This includes overhead costs of putting together these gifts and tokens of appreciation for my homies, my family, and my supporters.

With all my travels, I always keep in mind to bring everything and give back to the homeland in the form of shared knowledge and energy. All my learnings and my own personal experiences that contribute to my self-mastery, both as an ever-evolving individual and a creator, I always channel greatly into my work and my role as a mentor. All my students, past and present, can attest to the great detail and effort I pour out into each session.

Attending Ableton Loop will allow me to bring all the updated modern technologies and breakthroughs in the field of music back to you guys, and to everyone that passes through my mentorship. Aside from that I want to connect our country outwards and hopefully being in Berlin can open more doors for cross continental collaborations and exchanges.

As a token of appreciation I have put together a number of special packages for those who choose to share their love and energy with me through this campaign, the ff are:

  1. A special limited USB release of my recent interactive album & virtual world “Rara Avis” (2016) + Rarities and Developer Notes + Gallery Guide

  2. A special limited USB of my whole DISCOGRAPHY + NEVER RELEASED TRACKS AND EP’S

  3. A special limited Cassette Release of the recent Raw Philippine Love Song Beat Tape (2016)  - *copied straight from the original Cassette that I recorded on.

  4. A special limited Cassete Release of all my favorite beats made on my SP404 (2011-2016)

  5. Limited run similarobjects logo T-Shirt

  6. Limited edition similarobjects producer pack (drum kits / sound packs / samples / synth patches / ableton instrument and audio racks)

  7. similarobjects Cosmic Sonic Arts Ableton Live Video Course (Ableton Sadhana)

  8. special digital downloads to rare & unreleased EP’s

All gifts come with a special note of gratitude and a specialized sound byte created by me.

 

Impact:

I live for creating and inspiring people through my own work. I really believe in the power of sound as a universal connector of all living things and it’s power to change reality. By supporting this humble project you will be giving me the opportunity to keep us up to date with all the latest developments in the world of sound and other surrounding ideas. You will be allowing me to spread my personal vision and at the same time allow me to share the connections I make with the homeland.

 

I am a giver at the core of all this and I wholeheartedly would love to share with you all my findings throughout these travels, and the travels that come before and after.

Other ways you can help:

Financial blessings aren’t the only way you guys can help make this a reality. I know we all have our own personal struggles to deal with so if you can’t quite make a donation but would still want to help, I would appreciate even just sharing this campaign on your own personal pages or blogs and social media (FB, Twitter, Instagram, etc). Tell your friends about it if you think they’d be interested in helping out. You can also share my music if you just feel like spreading it to help. Always appreciate the love I put out coming back to me in any form.

 

If you just want to float me some love:

 

jorgewienekev@gmail.com

story:
ALBUM

Hello friends,

As many of you may already know, I've spent the last year pouring blood, sweat & tears into my debut album. I've funded the entire project thus far on my own. This collection of songs and the way we've been able to capture them has surpassed my wildest expectations and I can't wait to share my creation with the world. As we approach the completion of my album, I'm asking my friends, fans & family to help me put the finishing touches on the project. The magnitude of what you can help me achieve through your donation will change my life forever. 

    What We Need

    • We're looking to raise a total of $3,500 to help complete the project

    Donated money will be allocated to:

    • Remaining studio time
    • Professional mixing & mastering services
    • Music video production

    What You Get

    We've lined up some great incentives to make this worth your while!

    • Early access to the album
    • Be a part of an in-studio writing & recording session
    • Private show, name on guests lists and free merch

    Risks & Challenges

    If this campaign isn't successful, chances are that the release of my album will get pushed back until next year. We've accomplished so much in the last few months. I would hate for my project to lose the momentum that's been building. Everyone involved is so excited to see the record and visuals come to fruition, but that might not be the case if too much time passes

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're unable to contribute, no worries! You can still help by:

    • Sharing this page and my updates on social media
    • Share with people that support independent artists

story:
Listen to the Full Album Preview!

Roy's Story

As one of 12 children, Roy spent most of his childhood growing up on a farm in a small town in Arkansas.  Roy enjoyed school, helping his father with farming, and he started singing in the church choir at the age of 8. Roy took on most of the farming duties when his father became disabled by a stroke when he was only 13 years old.  The family moved to California in the early 60's . Roy joined the Army in 1966 and was stationed in Germany as a track vehicle mechanic in the 3rd armored div.  After his time in the military Roy decided to travel Europe to broaden his mind and creative spirits.  In 1971 He moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in entertainment and kept studying his craft at LACC.  Roy finally got his first big break when he won a role in the tony award-winning Broadway musical Dreamgirls.  He spent over four years touring the world performing eight shows a week.  When the show ended Roy became a family man.  To provide for his family he took a job as a mechanic at the U.S postal service, and for years he worked the graveyard shift in order to continue pursuing his creative passions to have time to spend with his family.  Over the years Roy has played in several roots and R &B bands with some of them getting to open for more prolific artists.  Now at 69 Roy is going to take the spotlight.

 

Album BIO

The album “Devil’s in the Whiskey” is a roots meets modern approach to a variety of genres while keeping the themes connected. The album starts and ends with an original recording of a chain gang and is the re-occurring theme throughout the album. The songs range from late 1800’s all the way up to current modern production. The album was recorded at Studio 1916 in Kyle TX. It’s a beautiful old Victorian style home that was built in 1916 and has been renovated to become a recording studio while preserving it’s historical integrity. In the recording process of the album, producers Travis Kennedy and Blake Atwell took special care and attention to detail, in using time period correct instruments and gear that would have been used in the original recordings within the themes throughout the album. It’s an album that takes you on a journey through time while keeping a roots theme throughout.

Why we need your HELP!

The album is completely finished and we have poured hundreds of hours and time, and personal money to complete this passion project. Why we need your help is to be able to keep the ball rolling with a campaign for PR/Marketing, Manufacturing, and distribution costs.  By contributing you are becoming our record label and only with your help, we can make this album get the recognition we feel it deserves.

What you'll get that nobody else will!

By pre-ordering from this campaign, not only will you get the album ahead of the rest of the world, and at a discount, but also included are several exclusive packages that will only be made for this campaign. From a CD with exclusive artwork, all the way to a custom finished wooden box that will contain a bottle of whiskey, a cigar, signed and numbered vinyl with exclusive artwork, digital download included, T-shirt, Hat, signed poster, and photo book. Only 50 vinyl records will ever be made for the artwork included in the ultimate package.  Anything helps and we all know that nobody is paying for music these days, but try to think of it this way. You could forego a few cups of coffee from Starbucks and have a tangible piece of art that you can keep forever.  You would also be changing our lives in helping to make this a success. 

Your Impact

With enough help, we will be able to afford a PR/Marketing campaign to get this album to a much larger audience.  When you hear Roy Lee Jones on the radio, you can say to yourself, I made that happen.  There's a ton of expenses outside of producing, recording, mixing, and mastering an album.  We need radio campaigns, interviews with reputable music writers and magazines, show booking agents, web development, social media marketing.... The list goes on forever and your impact is integral to the success of this project. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest fear, is that after putting in hundreds of hours of work into making such a great album, that only our close family and friends will know about it because we won't have the funding to get this album out to a broader audience. PR/Marketing cost will play a big factor in this.  We also want to give Roy the gift of traveling and sharing this to the world.  Travel/touring expenses for a new artist are not cheap and most new artists are just praying they break even. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford maybe even a $10 digital download but that doesn't mean that you can't help!  Please spread the word about this in any way that you can and share this to all of your social media pages, send emails, and just yell about it at the top of your lungs.  We'll be doing the same!  Thanks a million to everyone that can help in even this way!

What you'll get that nobody else will!
By pre-ordering from this campaign, not only will you get the album ahead of the rest of the world, and at a discount, but also included are several exclusive packages that will only be made for this campaign. From a CD with exclusive artwork, all the way to a custom finished wooden box that will contain a bottle of whiskey, a cigar, signed and numbered vinyl with exclusive artwork, digital download included, T-shirt, Hat, signed poster, and photo book. Only 50 vinyl records will ever be made for the artwork included in the ultimate package.  Anything helps and we all know that nobody is paying for music these days, but try to think of it this way. You could forego a few cups of coffee from Starbucks and have a tangible piece of art that you can keep forever.  You would also be changing our lives in helping to make this a success. 


Your ImpactWith enough help, we will be able to afford a PR/Marketing campaign to get this album to a much larger audience.  When you hear Roy Lee Jones on the radio, you can say to yourself, I made that happen.  There's a ton of expenses outside of producing, recording, mixing, and mastering an album.  We need radio campaigns, interviews with reputable music writers and magazines, show booking agents, web development, social media marketing.... The list goes on forever and your impact is integral to the success of this project. 

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest fear, is that after putting in hundreds of hours of work into making such a great album, that only our close family and friends will know about it because we won't have the funding to get this album out to a broader audience. PR/Marketing cost will play a big factor in this.  We also want to give Roy the gift of traveling and sharing this to the world.  Travel/touring expenses for a new artist are not cheap and most new artists are just praying they break even. 


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone can afford maybe even a $10 digital download but that doesn't mean that you can't help!  Please spread the word about this in any way that you can and share this to all of your social media pages, send emails, and just yell about it at the top of your lungs.  We'll be doing the same!  Thanks a million to everyone that can help in even this way!

story:
Short Summary

 We, Reese McHenry (Vocals, Guitar) and Stephen Gardner (aka The Fox, Drums) started a Raleigh-based rock and roll drums/guitar duo in February, 2017.

In July, 2017, we recorded a 4 song, 7" record (EP) we are really proud of. Engineered and produced in Raleigh by the mighty Dave Bartholomew, in a building where one could buy a tombstone, we are anticipating the return of the actual record at the end of November. We are using our own money to finance the record, t-shirts and tours, and we could use your help by way of pre ordering this record for $10.00.  

We do not consider this band a hobby or a side project. We were meant to make music and we are taking steps to do this full time, for a living, forever. We largely use my songs (Reese) but Stephen, in addition to being a fantastic drummer, is a great arranger/songwriter/singer/guitar player. 

We are on the fast track. We've done a 10 day east coast tour, we're doing another one at the end of October and continue to do shorter regional weekends and local shows.  We have both been in rock bands all of our adult lives and starting this duo has proven to be a wonderful and productive union. We are both fully committed and excited for this journey to continue. This band and these songs are  a way to see the world doing the thing we love best: making music that people relate to and enjoy. Once this record comes out, we plan to release it and tour in both the USA and Europe.

We're asking for pre orders, but of course anything is appreciated and will be put to great use. If you'd like to buy a fox t-shirt, please email me at rrmchenry007@gmail.com. They are 20.00 and you can pay by PayPal. Thanks!

story:
Hi, My name is Kenny Mandell. I have been a Jazz musician/educator in the greater Seattle area for over 30 years.I am trying to raise funds for the Third annual Couth Community Jazz Festival.The last 2 festivals were very successful with highlights being a Festival band doing tributes to Charles Mingus and Thelonius Monk.The main focus of this festival is to feature players who are not as well known as they might deserve.Over the last 5 years I have hosted regular jam sessions at the Couth Buzzard Bookstore which has a great sense of community among the regular participants.All proceeds from this fundraiser will go directly into the pockets of the Festival performers equally.  Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What am I all about?

Hi, i'm Erin Mulcair, an Indie Pop musician from Edmonton, AB, Canada. This is my first full length album, and my dream is to share my music with the world. A bit about me! I have been writing a long time, and have always loved it, but never recorded an album.

I got really sick after my daughter was born, and it was such a wake up call! Life is short, life is beautiful... it was time to stop sitting around and waiting to record and realize my dream.

This music is compelling, illustrative, and story driven and it is so important to me that you get to hear it. You will allow me to share this with people all around the globe.

Being a do-it-yourself artist is so rewarding, but not without challenges.. especially financial ones! If every one of my Facebook fans gave even $5, we would surpass the goal and then some.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

The entire project will cost $25,000 and I am asking for $10,000 worth of funding. The money will be used for mixing and mastering the music, CD artwork, publicist costs, and CD manufacturing. 

For as little as $5, I will send you a thank you tweet.

For $50, I will send you a signed copy of the CD and a thank you note right to your door.

Is there a song you were hoping I would cover? For $300, I will record whatever song you want with piano and voice!

I am SUPER optimistic that with your help, we will reach our goal, but if we don't reach the goal, be 100% assured that your money will still go towards the costs listed above. 

 

The Impact

Music moves all of us. It is the thing that you turn to when you are joyful, it is the thing we reach for when we are down and out. It bring us through all moments of life - singing lullabies to our little ones, walking down the aisle, blasting our favourite song in our first car. It connects all of us, and it is the soundtrack to our lives.

In an age where there is more music than you can shake a stick at, I want you to be able to have a new favourite, something that brings you through your day. A soundtrack that you want to put on during a glorious summer sunrise, or a cold winter day. 

 

Risks & Challenges

As I said earlier on, it is risky being a do-it-yourself artist. It is costly, and because there is so much music out there, it is hard to know exactly how to make a big splash. I believe in this music, and not only the sound and the songs, but so much so that I have taken courses and created intensive plans and checklists to ensure its success. Working with a publicist is one of the best decisions I could have made, and it allows the album to get press locally as well as internationally. 

Having already poured my savings into this project, you can be sure this is something I believe in with my whole heart, and that I will work to overcome each challenge through the proactive planning I have already set in motion.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can only do one thing, please share this with your social networks! Whether it is email, Facebook, Twitter, blogs, YouTube, wherever you may be. Thank you so much, and I can't wait for you to hear it.

story:
Paint The Sky

My name is Rebecca McGraw and I'm a worship leader, song writer and singer in the DMV area. Thank you for taking the time to visit my campaign page. I’m also a part of a fiery passionate band called "Awaken Wells". I've been in ministry with Awaken Wells for about eight years. I feel in this season of my life God has given me vision to release songs that bring joy and freedom. Over the years, God has been captivating my heart and my gaze to fall more in love with Him. This project will display different aspects of who God is and his faithfulness towards us. I'm always in awe of sunrises and sunsets because it gives me a glimpse of His majestic ways. I believe God displays colors and light in the sky to give us a taste of what Heaven resembles. When Jesus returns, everyone will look towards the sky because he’s coming for His bride. I want to create music that shows light, depth and the beauty of God. It would mean the world to me if you could donate to this project because you would be partnering with the dream and promise that God as placed inside of me.  My prayer for this album is that through these songs people will come to the Lord, stand in awe of Him and forever praise Him. Again, please donate to the project but more importantly pray for this new journey I'm embracing with the Lord. Thank you so much! 

What We Need

I need to raise $15,000 to fund this project. That amount includes:

  • Studio Time: tracking, mixing and mastering
  • Travel fees : Studio is in North Carolina (Gat3)
  • Honoring the Musicians who agreed to play on this album
  • Website , Videos, Pictures
  • Branding: album art work, logos
  • CD’s: making hard copies
  • Music streaming sites: Apple music, Google Play, Amazon etc…
  • Music videos

Perks!!!!!

  • Send a personal video talking about song stories
  • Worship night (DMV area) 
  • Get the CD before the release date

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign page with EVERYONE
  • Go LIKE and SHARE my music page on Facebook
  • PRAY for this album
  • BLAST THIS JOINT

story:
Even though the campaign ended, you can still pre-order on our websites at www.lauraloge.com and www.sandramogensen.com. All the same perks are available!

 

An American soprano living on the west coast of the US and a Canadian pianist living in Europe! Of course they'd be getting together to collaborate on a project featuring a Norwegian composer! 

We are both extremely in love with the music of Edvard Grieg. His music is the reason we met, the basis of our friendship, and our ongoing work together. Grieg is one of the most well-known composers internationally, but mainly for only a few of his "top hits": music from Peer Gynt, his piano concerto, and some of his Lyric Pieces. There is of course much more! Grieg was in fact a brilliant song composer, on a par with many of the great German and French art song composers. But! How often do you hear these glorious songs sung in their original language outside of Scandinavia?

You're in luck! We are currently on a recital tour in the Pacific Northwest area of the US with a program of Grieg's songs to texts by A.O. Vinje and Norwegian folk song settings for piano...and we are also producing a recording of this music while we are at it. 

For this recording project, we present the songs of opus 33 as well as Grieg's haunting arrangements of Norwegian Folk Tunes, opus 66. Grieg himself had a sense of the uniqueness of these piano miniatures, writing of having "put some hair-raising chromatic chords on paper...they originated not on the piano but in my mind." This is rarely-heard music, curated in an innovative way for your listening satisfaction. We'd love to share this music with you, and therefore invite you to be a part of creating our recording!


In a world in which recorded music of any kind can be had for free through streaming, various download platforms, or video channels, creating a recording in CD or LP format can be considered a radical act. Many artists have decided that their days of offering "hard copies" of their music are behind them; however, no sustainable model has yet presented itself so that musicians receive fair payment for music downloads. All the same, we ourselves still enjoy having and listening to CDs, and know of many others who do as well, so with great optimism and dedication, we are creating this project for you, dear listeners. 

As you can well imagine, the costs of producing a recording, whether for download, streaming, or in CD format, are significant. That, as well as our commitment to creating a product of the highest quality, and our conviction about this gorgeous and important repertoire which is so rarely heard, especially in North America, is behind our drive to do this project. If you, like us, value artistic expression, are nourished by beauty, truth, and meaning, and believe in encouraging creative people to create, then please be a part of this creation by any of the methods suggested on the right of your screen. Just as when you buy fair- or direct-trade products, or shop locally, your support goes a long way. You are helping to sustain artists in their creative work.

Collectively, we have successfully funded four previous recording projects through crowdfunding, and are well versed in the various aspects of producing a recording. We have set a goal of a minimum of $5,000 in this fundraising campaign. The funds will cover the cost of recording studio rental, sound engineer, editing and production of CDs. We have many more costs of course, not the least of which is travel expenses, as we live nearly 5,000 miles/8,000 kilometres apart. We are super excited to bring you this music. Reserve your copies by pledging your support now, and consider some of our other premium perks offered for donations, as outlined at the right of this page. 

We'd love it if you could tell your friends about this project, and share this page widely in all those dandy social media.

With deep appreciation and gratitude, 

Laura Loge & Sandra Mogensen

story:
WHY, WHERE, AND WHEN -

Years ago, while in London, over coffee and kit-kat bars, Martin Esslin, author of THE THEATRE OF THE ABSURD and one of Samuel Beckett’s close friends, suggested that if I really wanted to set some Beckett to music, and I really did, I should just write to him. Seemed simple enough, so I wrote to Beckett care of his publisher in Paris.  And to my amazement, a month or so later, Samuel Beckett wrote back.  IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE is one of Beckett's plosive masterpieces, describing with wild imagery and mathematical precision, a strange, witty, and oddly harrowing journey of the mind and imagination.  And Beckett, in his concise and to the point letter, gave me permission to set it to music:

After years of staring at those hand scrawled words, wondering what I might do with this dazzling 1100-word prose piece, I realized that of course it didn't have to be sung, a setting could be spoken - and taking advantage of digital tools created for sound artists and composers since Beckett's letter, it could be spoken by many voices, with the sound manipulated from there.  An onslaught of voices. They could be recorded and - akin to Beckett's great KRAPP'S LAST TAPE - the scenario would be that the recorded voices challenge as if to compete with musicians - a string quartet.

The string quartet is the protagonist, responding to a wall of recorded voices in a new, tense, funny and moving Beckettian drama - playing expressively, dynamically, lyrically, as if to strike back as the voices continue to challenge them and their existence.

I've been invited to premiere this vision of innovative performance, over 30 years in the making, on June 7-8, 2017, when the San Diego Repertory Theatre’s Lipinsky Family San Diego Jewish Arts Festival will present the world premiere, with plans for the Los Angeles premiere in July at the Broad Stage in Santa Monica, an event co-produced by Red Hen Press .

And that’s where you come in.  We’re starting this project with the help of a generous seed grant, and need to raise the rest of the funds by seeking donations from other major donors and - importantly - from our friends. We have musicians to pay and, as this is more than a concert presentation, we have design elements as well – lights, sets, projections, and sound.  All of the money we raise, all of the money you donate, will go directly to the musicians and artists involved in this project. The direct costs for performances in San Diego and Los Angeles, as well as the eventual CD, will likely exceed $20,000.  We want to raise at least $15,000 now - and all contributions will be tax deductible.

WHAT IT IS AND WHAT HAPPENS 

A string quartet walks into a mysterious room and approaches a laptop on a table.  Music stands surround them - each containing a manuscript. Each player in turn, one at a time, presses the laptop’s space bar and hears voices – solo and in combination – hypnotic, chanting – “No trace anywhere of life” – and then each player presses the space bar – to stop it.

We bear witness as a string quartet responds to voices that command, seduce, and cunningly lure them into a world where the imagination might be dead – or is it?  The Quartet responds the only way it can – by playing the music set before them, and navigating their way through this strange universe, voices lashing out at them as they play predetermined notes in a universe at once chaotic and orderly, all leaving "a stain on the silence."

WHO’S IN IT - 

IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE will be premiered by Quartet Nouveau, an adventurous new San Diego based all-female string quartet that has earned a reputation as an exciting emerging group known for their energizing and deeply emotional performances. The quartet has embraced an eclectic philosophy in their programming, their members being New Music specialists who perform, in addition to the standard quartet repertoire, many lesser known works, world premieres, even jug-band music. They are the ensemble in residence with the California Chamber Orchestra, and, perhaps most important, are dedicated to sharing their music with as wide-ranging an audience as possible, including a recently acclaimed performance at the San Diego Rescue Mission.

To create the world of the voices, reciting Beckett's text in a multi-faceted way to put the Quartet in its place, I recorded friends and longtime collaborators, some among the most celebrated actors and theatre artists in North America, including, from Canada's Stratford Festival, Geraint Wyn Davies, Dion Johnstone, Seana McKenna, and Lucy Peacock, in addition to my good friends Marco Barricelli and Robert Joy, and finally, from South Africa, Jessica Jean Erwin.

"Roth composes music one could imagine Charles Ives composing had he lived long enough to encounter rock & roll and beat poetry" 

I'm grateful that my work has been described in such a flattering way and embrace the open-minded philosophy implicit in that description.  My career as a composer, arranger, music director, pianist, and sound designer includes chamber music, operas, film scores, and the music and sound for over 250 theatre projects throughout North America, including Broadway, off-Broadway, Canada’s Stratford Festival, and many regional theatres, including every major theatre in California.   Notable collaborators have included, among many others, Christopher Plummer, Stacy Keach, many projects with Des McAnuff at La Jolla Playhouse (as a resident composer) and Stratford, over 55 productions at South Coast Rep, many notable and award-winning projects at San Diego REP, and many projects as a music director, arranger, pianist, and editor with Randy Newman.  Please have a look at my website for more details.

THE FULL PROGRAM - 

The program features two additional pieces, creating the thematic journey that culminates in the Beckett premiere.  As a prelude, I’ve composed LABOR DAY, 1967, for violin, prepared piano/percussion, an old 78-recording of a Bar Mitzvah torah-chanting lesson, and, in a special appearance, a cantor.  This premiere, exploring Jewish memories, will be premiered by my friends violinist Batya MacAdam-Somer (from the Quartet), percussionist N. Scott Robinson and a special appearance by Cantor William Tiep.  LABOR DAY 1967 will be followed by Quartet Nouveau’s bravura performance of Beethoven’s String Quartet, Opus 18, Number 3.  Beckett, an accomplished classical pianist, loved Beethoven, likely admiring, as he would, the musical context where things fit together, reflecting a world striving for and perhaps achieving, as Beckett might put it “order.”  An "order" to be reflected and perhaps shattered by Beckett's attempt to strive for the same thing in IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE.

WE NEED - 

Your support.  To cover the San Diego premiere, the Red Hen/Los Angeles performances, and the eventual CD, we need $20,000 to make all of our plans possible.  We're turning to our friends in hopes of raising at least $15,000 now so that we may be well on the way.  And, happily, because San Diego Rep is a 501(c)3 non-profit, all contributions will be tax-deductible.

PLEASE - 

Join me, join San Diego Repertory Theatre, and join my friends in this exciting and very personal project, something that I’ve been dreaming about and wanting to share for over 30 years. 

RISKS & CHALLENGES - 

This is a very personal project, and I'm committed to making it happen despite the risk or the consequences.  I've never opened any project to crowd and internet funding, and have never asked for funding or help in this unique fashion - still, we hope this direct appeal from all of us - from San Diego Repertory Theatre, from Todd Salovey, Artistic Director of the Lipinsky Family San Diego Jewish Arts Festival, from Red Hen Press and all our collaborators - will inspire you to support us in any way that you can.  

AND FINALLY - LOS ANGELES IN JULY! 

Yes, IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE has been invited to be part of a special event at the Broad Stage.  We are thrilled about this and very busy working out details to make the special performances on July 9 happen, when we will be part of a celebration of contemporary literature produced by Red Hen Press.  Quartet Nouveau and our designers will recreate the Beckett as the finale for this program - more details coming soon.  For those who may be interested in jump starting our Los Angeles performances with one major contribution, the boost that will send IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE to LA with enormous confidence, please see the final perk!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP - 

We - the musicians, the designers, and all of the collaborators, are truly grateful for ANY size contribution. All of us will spread the word about this project - and any help that anyone can offer in that spirit would be great and much appreciated.  Please tell your friends.  In addition, please:

Share this on online anyway you can with as many friends as you can, and in anyway that appeals or is convenient via e-mail, Facebook, twitter, etc.

And please do contact us with any questions and feedback, we'd love to hear what you think of this exciting and unique project.

THANKS TO ALL - 

Michael Roth

Todd Salovey, Artistic Director, Lipinsky Family San Diego Jewish Arts Festival, San Diego Repertory Theatre

Kate Gale, Red Hen Press


 

* - “IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE” from SAMUEL BECKETT: The Complete Short Prose,  Copyright © 1995 by The Estate of Samuel Beckett. Used through arrangement with Georges Borchardt, Inc. on behalf of the Samuel Beckett Estate. All rights reserved.
story_txt:
WHY, WHERE, AND WHEN -Years ago, while in London, over coffee and kit-kat bars, Martin Esslin, author of THE THEATRE OF THE ABSURD and one of Samuel Beckett’s close friends, suggested that if I really wanted to set some Beckett to music, and I really did, I should just write to him. Seemed simple enough, so I wrote to Beckett care of his publisher in Paris.  And to my amazement, a month or so later, Samuel Beckett wrote back.  IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE is one of Beckett's plosive masterpieces, describing with wild imagery and mathematical precision, a strange, witty, and oddly harrowing journey of the mind and imagination.  And Beckett, in his concise and to the point letter, gave me permission to set it to music:After years of staring at those hand scrawled words, wondering what I might do with this dazzling 1100-word prose piece, I realized that of course it didn't have to be sung, a setting could be spoken - and taking advantage of digital tools created for sound artists and composers since Beckett's letter, it could be spoken by many voices, with the sound manipulated from there.  An onslaught of voices. They could be recorded and - akin to Beckett's great KRAPP'S LAST TAPE - the scenario would be that the recorded voices challenge as if to compete with musicians - a string quartet.The string quartet is the protagonist, responding to a wall of recorded voices in a new, tense, funny and moving Beckettian drama - playing expressively, dynamically, lyrically, as if to strike back as the voices continue to challenge them and their existence.I've been invited to premiere this vision of innovative performance, over 30 years in the making, on June 7-8, 2017, when the San Diego Repertory Theatre’s Lipinsky Family San Diego Jewish Arts Festival will present the world premiere, with plans for the Los Angeles premiere in July at the Broad Stage in Santa Monica, an event co-produced by Red Hen Press .And that’s where you come in.  We’re starting this project with the help of a generous seed grant, and need to raise the rest of the funds by seeking donations from other major donors and - importantly - from our friends. We have musicians to pay and, as this is more than a concert presentation, we have design elements as well – lights, sets, projections, and sound.  All of the money we raise, all of the money you donate, will go directly to the musicians and artists involved in this project. The direct costs for performances in San Diego and Los Angeles, as well as the eventual CD, will likely exceed $20,000.  We want to raise at least $15,000 now - and all contributions will be tax deductible.WHAT IT IS AND WHAT HAPPENS A string quartet walks into a mysterious room and approaches a laptop on a table.  Music stands surround them - each containing a manuscript. Each player in turn, one at a time, presses the laptop’s space bar and hears voices – solo and in combination – hypnotic, chanting – “No trace anywhere of life” – and then each player presses the space bar – to stop it.We bear witness as a string quartet responds to voices that command, seduce, and cunningly lure them into a world where the imagination might be dead – or is it?  The Quartet responds the only way it can – by playing the music set before them, and navigating their way through this strange universe, voices lashing out at them as they play predetermined notes in a universe at once chaotic and orderly, all leaving "a stain on the silence."WHO’S IN IT - IMAGINATION DEAD IMAGINE will be premiered by Quartet Nouveau, an adventurous new San Diego based all-female string quartet that has earned a reputation as an exciting emerging group known for their energizing and deeply emotional performances. The quartet has embraced an eclectic philosophy in their programming, their members being New Music specialists who perform, in addition to the standard quartet repertoire, many lesser known works, world premieres, even jug-band music. They are the ensemble in residence with the California Chamber Orchestra, and, perhaps most important, are dedicated to sharing their music with as wide-ranging an audience as possible, including a recently acclaimed performance at the San Diego Rescue Mission.To create the world of the voices, reciting Beckett's text in a multi-faceted way to put the Quartet in its place, I recorded friends and longtime collaborators, some among the most celebrated actors and theatre artists in North America, including, from Canada's Stratford Festival, Geraint Wyn Davies, Dion Johnstone, Seana McKenna, and Lucy Peacock, in addition to my good friends Marco Barricelli and Robert Joy, and finally, from South Africa, Jessica Jean Erwin.
"Roth composes music one could imagine Charles Ives composing had he lived long enough to encounter rock & roll and beat poetry" 
I'm grateful that my work has been described in such a flattering way and embrace the open-minded philosophy implicit in that description.  My career as a composer, arranger, music director, pianist, and sound designer includes chamber music, operas, film scores, and the music and sound for over 250 theatre projects throughout North America, including Broadway, off-Broadway, Canada’s Stratford Festival, and many regional theatres, including every major theatre in California.   Notable collaborators have included, among many others, Christopher Plummer, Stacy Keach, many projects with Des McAnuff at La Jolla Playhouse (as a resident composer) and Stratford, over 55 productions at South Coast Rep, many notable and award-winning projects at San Diego REP, and many projects as a music director, arranger, pianist, and editor with Randy Newman.  Please have a look at my website for more details.THE FULL PROGRAM - The program features two additional pieces, creating the thematic journey that culminates in the Beckett premiere.  As a prelude, I’ve composed LABOR DAY, 1967, for violin, prepared piano/percussion, an old 78-recording of a Bar Mitzvah torah-chanting lesson, and, in a special appearance, a cantor.  This premiere, exploring Jewish memories, will be premiered by my friends violinist Batya MacAdam-Somer (from the Quartet), percussionist N. story:
Our Crowdfunding Campaign

1. Manufacture the new 100% American-made "DRIVE" Series designer guitars for its sales force to demo.

2. Use these guitars at expositions for branding the company and begin taking orders. 

The new "DRIVE" Series designer guitars will play and sound like the First Edition designs seen in photos. These new designs were born in the USA and that's where the complete manufacturing will occur, from design to production! These guitars are inspired by 1950's hot rod cars. It captures an elegant yet gritty design and sound to fit all-of musical needs.  Funding this campaign will be a catalyst for this small "USA" guitar company, with a big dream, to grow and begin establishing its brand. 

The Impact

The all USA made "DRIVE" Series guitars will have a positive impact in the US economy. In addition, Moxy Guitars, LLC will also make a donation, from every guitar sold, to a Veteran Charity Foundation.

About the Funding Goal

If the funding goal is not reached, the funds obtained will be utilized to build as many demo guitars for promotional purposes. 

Who is Moxy Guitars?

Moxy Guitars is an American “designer” guitar manufacturing business located in Flemington, New Jersey, USA.  It is a pro-line guitar company with fashionable expressions and freedom inspired by the music, automotive, and fashion industries. Moxy Guitars has a long history of creating one-off custom guitars to customers all over America, with exceedingly positive feedback.  The company is committed to fine craftsmanship as seen in every guitar detail. Today, Moxy Guitars, LLC, was created and founded by Anthony Gemignani (Designer, Guitar Builder, and Sales) and Jose M. Suros (General Management, Designer, Sales, and Marketing).

                                                           

                     Anthony Gemignani                                              Jose Miguel Suros

                                                Moxy Guitars, LLC Managing Directors

                                                            The "Dynamic Duo"

Gemignani is a graduate of Berklee College of Music with a Bachelor’s Degree in Professional music.  He has over 30 years in the music industry as a professional musician, composer, producer, and recording artist.  He is experienced in business management and also owns a music school for over 11 years.   Suros is a graduate of Fairleigh Dickinson University and holds a Bachelor of Science Degree.  He has 29 years of experience in corporate business, sales, marketing, management, leadership, and learning & development.  He is currently following his rock star fantasy of being a blues artist.

What's Unique About the "DRIVE" Series Electric Guitars

Moxy Guitars has taken an old idea and created something new. The new 100% American made "Drive" Series designer guitars and necks are exclusively crafted by their production partner Nakita Guitars in New York, with electronics by Benson Customs and hardware by Hipshot, both based in New York as well.  Moxy Guitars have a wicked sound; they haven’t earned the nickname the “Bone Tone” for nothing – players are sure to feel the music in their bones when playing one.

The price point, when released to the public, will be a big product differentiation – Moxy Guitars are highly competitive when it comes to sound, electronics, quality, reliability, warranty, looks, and overall professional play-ability.

Challenges to Overcome

The two biggest challenges to overcome are: the amount of competitors in the industry and obtaining enough resources to effectively market and grow the brand. In order to tackle these two challenges, Moxy Guitars has 12 sales consultants who are music industry professionals. These individuals have the ability, knowledge, skills, and talent to influence and bring value to musicians.

The Moxy Guitars Vision & Mission

The vision of Moxy Guitars is to become a worldwide multi-million-dollar brand and become the premier designer of all USA made guitars for intermediate and professional musicians. The mission is to design and build all USA made high quality, fine craftsmanship, pro-line, affordable guitars. Moxy Guitars is a growth-oriented business and has entered into a global billion dollar market.  It's long range business objective is to become a well-recognized leader in the guitar manufacturing industry.  Success is written all over the Moxy Guitars brand name!

Other Ways That you Can Support Moxy Guitars

Your contributions will get the new "Drive" Series in the hands of musicians.  We are looking for backers to support future operations of the brand. Please get the word out to family and friends as together we will revolutionize guitar making. The rewards listed on this crowdfunding campaign are a way to say thank you for your contributions and confidence!

Welcome to the Moxy Guitars family of fashionable, well crafted, high quality, and affordable guitars!!!

PLEASE SEE SOME PHOTOS OF THE REWARDS IN THE "PHOTO GALLERY" SECTION UNDER THE CAMPAIGN VIDEO.  We apologize that we may not have all the reward photos in the photo gallery. The all USA made "DRIVE" Series electric guitar prototypes are in the process of being produced.  ​

story:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nick_Fowler

Josh Bryan is a graduate of The University of North Texas with a Bachelor Degree in Jazz Studies Performance and a minor in Classical Guitar Performance. He has toured/ recorded with Harry Belafonte, Wilson Pickett, Queen Latifah, and Kenny Latimore. He has also played or backed up artists such as Legendary Ray Brown, Paquito Rivera and Norah Jones. Broadway Credits include from most recent : Kinky Boots, Lion King, Bring It On, Hands On A Hardbody, Hair, In The Heights, Jersey Boys, Hairspray, Xanadu, Cry Baby, Mama Mia, Les Mis, Aida. 1st National Tours include In The Heights, Jersey Boys, Hairspray, Grease, Best Little Whore House, Little Shop of Horrors. Other credits include NYCs Big Apple Circus, Off Broadway Evita, Grease (The European Tour). Josh also spends time teaching students ranging from beginner level up to advanced college level private and classroom format. He has taught at various music schools including Dallas School of Music, Fort Worth Community College and Livingston Music Center. He is currently working on two different solo efforts. He has scored numerous TV commercials and movies.

story:
Courage & Suffrage is an album to celebrate two iconic women in Britain whose classical compositions inspired many in the suffrage movement. The amount of classical work composed by women represented in the modern society is far too little, whether it is in public performances or CD recordings. There exists an outstanding number of beautifully composed sonatas and sinfonias. Most of them were written in a time when women’s education and professional development were subject to limitations and discrimination. In deliberately under-representing women’s work, we have shifted more and more towards a gender biased industry, in which record companies bias towards male composers. We want to encourage recording companies to give female artists their fair share of our musical heritage.


We hope that more and more people will become aware, study and appreciate the music of women and come to recognise composers like Smyth and Clarke as composers rather than women composers. We believe everyone deserves to be part of this movement, and this album is great first step towards realizing this vision of ours. Whether or not we can succeed depends entirely on your support and we need every bit of help that can be gathered.

Courage & Suffrage is a collection of 3 sonatas for cello and piano.

Cello: Melody Lin (Myself)

Piano: Kumi Matsuo

This Album will feature the following:  

Dame Ethel Smyth:  

Sonata for cello and piano in c minor  

Sonata for cello and piano in a minor, Op. 5  

Rebecca Clarke:  

Sonata for viola (rearranged to cello) and piano

 Why we need your help: 

To cover various expenses including the editing, mastering, production and distribution of CDs, copyright fees, musician fees and of course the recording itself. 

We want to encourage recording companies to give female artists their fair share of our musical heritage.  

We hope that more and more people will become aware, study and appreciate the music of women and come to recognize composers like Smyth and Clarke as composers rather than women composers. 

We believe everyone deserves to be part of this movement, and this album is great first step towards realizing this vision of ours. Whether or not we can succeed depends entirely on your support and we need every bit of help that can be gathered.  

<historical significance of the two featured composers, Smyth and Clarke>

In the late 19th century, British born Dame Ethel Smyth was the most successful and accomplished British composer of opera. She was awarded knighthood of the Order of British Empire in 1922, for her compositions and contributions to music. In fact, she is the first woman in Britain that was awarded a knighthood. Despite the recognition from the King, and her multiple doctorates from University of Durham and Oxford, her peers and crtics always regarded her as a "woman composer", rather than a "composer", and judged her harshly on the grounds of sounding like "male composers". After her death, her musical talents and legacy were not celebrated, as most scholars regarded her as an eccentric figure. However Ethel Smyth had been a figurehead for women’s rights in the 19th century, part of the suffrage movement. She wrote two cello sonatas, the first in A minor was published but the second one, in C minor was never published, though she got very close to it as I read her original manuscript, now stored in the British Library.

Rebecca Clarke, born and raised in London, whose most creative years coincided with the most intense period of the women's suffrage movement. Her career was patchy at best as she struggled to find herself amongst other composers and like Smyth, faced difficulty promoting her own work to critics and peers. Unlike Smyth though, she mostly chose to be silent instead of being a fighter for the suffrage movement. As a result many of her compositions were never published and her composition career came to a halt shortly after she got married. Nevertheless she acted with great courage to promote young women instrumentalists to perform her own compositions. Clarke is another example of a great composer that could have been much more had the world given her a chance, and after a lifetime of classical music, the recognition she received is much less than what she deserved. She composed her first sonata for viola in the iconic year of 1919, when the Gender Disqualification Removal act became a law in the United Kingdom. This album will feature this sonata arranged for cello.

What you are supporting:

Professionally recorded CDs

Production cost breakdown:

4 recording sessions, s a total of £864

Mixing and editing £950

Musician fee- £150 per session, £600

1000 CD prodiction, £1850 

 Total: £4264+ Indiegogo commission: 5%

 

Risk and challenge:

This is the first musical album that I've ever proposed; it is a very challenging project to start with.

As I started planning on it, I realized most of the music scores for the repertoire were either missing or unpublished. Not only that, restrictions on copyright and recording right are more complicated than what I expected. Funding is definitely that real issue, as most of the application for project funds require the first 10% cash match funding.

At the stage, I’ve managed to get all the scores, although one of the sonatas weren’t ever published. I have gotten a manuscript copy from British Library, and will have to transcribe into the form that is performable. As the copyright, I’ve also managed to find out all the information. I will have to pay for Limited Manufactured License before I start the recording sections.

From all above, what’s missing is only funding. It would be impossible to release this album if it doesn’t reach the target. 

 

Artist:

Melody Lin/ Cello

Melody Lin is a breathtaking young Taiwanese cellist with a special aptitude to the development of fresh perspectives on solo as well as chamber music, both interpretation and performance. Her recent career highlights, including her 2015 recital consolidating solo works by J.S. Bach and B. Britten at the University of Cambridge, where she also performed “Taiwan is a Formosa” Six Fu-Lao Folk Tunes for Solo Violoncello by H.P. Lee in 2006. As well as her 2016 concert series that toured Poland and London - “Chopin Project” with Polish pianist Artur Haftman attests to her exceptional talents. As a chamber musician, Mellanie Trio was formed in 2014 and has performed in various chamber music series including a recital in St. James Piccadilly, supported by Concordia Foundation, where they received a standing ovation. Melody has also organized and performed a sold-out concert for Richard Lester Cello Ensemble, where they also performed in Steven Reich Composition Masterclass at Royal College of Music. 

Her studies at Royal College of Music is supported by Ann Drivers Trust and she currently plays on a Joseph Hill cello, kindly loaned by Royal College of Music since 2014.

Kumi Matsuo/ Piano

Kumi Matsuo was born in Tokyo, Japan. Winner of the 5th Louisiana International Piano Competition in 2013, she has also won Second Prize at the 75th Music Competition of Japan in 2006, Third Prize at the 22nd Ferrol International Piano Competition in 2008 and First Prize at the 6th Isidor Bajic International Piano Competition in 2012. 
Kumi graduated from the Toho Gakuen High School of Music and the Toho Gakuen University of Music in Tokyo. In 2007 she moved to London for her further study at the Royal College of Music where she gained an Artist Diploma and a Master of Music in Performance supported by the Charles Napper Award, the Russell Gander Award and the Rohm Music Foundation. Kumi has finished the Anthony Saltmarsh Junior Fellow in Accompaniment at the Royal College of Music.
story_txt:
Courage & Suffrage is an album to celebrate two iconic women in Britain whose classical compositions inspired many in the suffrage movement. The amount of classical work composed by women represented in the modern society is far too little, whether it is in public performances or CD recordings. There exists an outstanding number of beautifully composed sonatas and sinfonias. Most of them were written in a time when women’s education and professional development were subject to limitations and discrimination. In deliberately under-representing women’s work, we have shifted more and more towards a gender biased industry, in which record companies bias towards male composers. We want to encourage recording companies to give female artists their fair share of our musical heritage.
We hope that more and more people will become aware, study and appreciate the music of women and come to recognise composers like Smyth and Clarke as composers rather than women composers. We believe everyone deserves to be part of this movement, and this album is great first step towards realizing this vision of ours. Whether or not we can succeed depends entirely on your support and we need every bit of help that can be gathered.
Courage & Suffrage is a collection of 3 sonatas for cello and piano.
Cello: Melody Lin (Myself)
Piano: Kumi Matsuo
This Album will feature the following:  
Dame Ethel Smyth:  
Sonata for cello and piano in c minor  
Sonata for cello and piano in a minor, Op. 5  
Rebecca Clarke:  
Sonata for viola (rearranged to cello) and piano
 Why we need your help: 
To cover various expenses including the editing, mastering, production and distribution of CDs, copyright fees, musician fees and of course the recording itself. 
We want to encourage recording companies to give female artists their fair share of our musical heritage.  
We hope that more and more people will become aware, study and appreciate the music of women and come to recognize composers like Smyth and Clarke as composers rather than women composers. 
We believe everyone deserves to be part of this movement, and this album is great first step towards realizing this vision of ours. Whether or not we can succeed depends entirely on your support and we need every bit of help that can be gathered.  
<historical significance of the two featured composers, Smyth and Clarke>
In the late 19th century, British born Dame Ethel Smyth was the most successful and accomplished British composer of opera. She was awarded knighthood of the Order of British Empire in 1922, for her compositions and contributions to music. In fact, she is the first woman in Britain that was awarded a knighthood. Despite the recognition from the King, and her multiple doctorates from University of Durham and Oxford, her peers and crtics always regarded her as a "woman composer", rather than a "composer", and judged her harshly on the grounds of sounding like "male composers". After her death, her musical talents and legacy were not celebrated, as most scholars regarded her as an eccentric figure. However Ethel Smyth had been a figurehead for women’s rights in the 19th century, part of the suffrage movement. She wrote two cello sonatas, the first in A minor was published but the second one, in C minor was never published, though she got very close to it as I read her original manuscript, now stored in the British Library.
Rebecca Clarke, born and raised in London, whose most creative years coincided with the most intense period of the women's suffrage movement. Her career was patchy at best as she struggled to find herself amongst other composers and like Smyth, faced difficulty promoting her own work to critics and peers. Unlike Smyth though, she mostly chose to be silent instead of being a fighter for the suffrage movement. As a result many of her compositions were never published and her composition career came to a halt shortly after she got married. Nevertheless she acted with great courage to promote young women instrumentalists to perform her own compositions. Clarke is another example of a great composer that could have been much more had the world given her a chance, and after a lifetime of classical music, the recognition she received is much less than what she deserved. She composed her first sonata for viola in the iconic year of 1919, when the Gender Disqualification Removal act became a law in the United Kingdom. This album will feature this sonata arranged for cello.
What you are supporting:
Professionally recorded CDs
Production cost breakdown:
4 recording sessions, s a total of £864
Mixing and editing £950
Musician fee- £150 per session, £600
1000 CD prodiction, £1850 
 Total: £4264+ Indiegogo commission: 5%
 
Risk and challenge:
This is the first musical album that I've ever proposed; it is a very challenging project to start with.
As I started planning on it, I realized most of the music scores for the repertoire were either missing or unpublished. Not only that, restrictions on copyright and recording right are more complicated than what I expected. Funding is definitely that real issue, as most of the application for project funds require the first 10% cash match funding.
At the stage, I’ve managed to get all the scores, although one of the sonatas weren’t ever published. I have gotten a manuscript copy from British Library, and will have to transcribe into the form that is performable. As the copyright, I’ve also managed to find out all the information. I will have to pay for Limited Manufactured License before I start the recording sections.
From all above, what’s missing is only funding. It would be impossible to release this album if it doesn’t reach the target.

Melody Lin is a breathtaking young Taiwanese cellist with a special aptitude to the development of fresh perspectives on solo as well as chamber music, both interpretation and performance. Her recent career highlights, including her 2015 recital consolidating solo works by J.S. Bach and B. Britten at the University of Cambridge, where she also performed “Taiwan is a Formosa” Six Fu-Lao Folk Tunes for Solo Violoncello by H.P. Lee in 2006. As well as her 2016 concert series that toured Poland and London - “Chopin Project” with Polish pianist Artur Haftman attests to her exceptional talents. As a chamber musician, Mellanie Trio was formed in 2014 and has performed in various chamber music series including a recital in St. James Piccadilly, supported by Concordia Foundation, where they received a standing ovation. Melody has also organized and performed a sold-out concert for Richard Lester Cello Ensemble, where they also performed in Steven Reich Composition Masterclass at Royal College of Music. 
Her studies at Royal College of Music is supported by Ann Drivers Trust and she currently plays on a Joseph Hill cello, kindly loaned by Royal College of Music since 2014.
Kumi Matsuo/ Piano
Kumi Matsuo was born in Tokyo, Japan. Winner of the 5th Louisiana International Piano Competition in 2013, she has also won Second Prize at the 75th Music Competition of Japan in 2006, Third Prize at the 22nd Ferrol International Piano Competition in 2008 and First Prize at the 6th Isidor Bajic International Piano Competition in 2012. Kumi graduated from the Toho Gakuen High School of Music and the Toho Gakuen University of Music in Tokyo. Kumi has finished the Anthony Saltmarsh Junior Fellow in Accompaniment at the Royal College of Music.

story:
My name is Allison Black.  I'm a single parent, singer/songwriter, makeup artist and Yogi.  I'm originally from Anchorage, Alaska and have lived in Atlanta, DC, New York, and currently reside in "the Music City " Nashville, Tennessee. While living  life, I wrote a collection of songs called Single Ride that I'd like to record and release on a independent label,Triple Vision Records. 

We are raising $10,000 to record, master, and print on CD and Vinyl. We will also use funds for shooting two videos. There are several perks you can choose from for supporting Single Ride, signed posters, Yoga classes, and even a live in home performance for generous contributions!

Not only will you be helping a independent artist growth, you will be assisting in the fulfillment of a lifetime dream of sharing music and love.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Please spread the word or come out to an event if you are unable to contribute. Your energy is always welcome! Thank you!

story:
Why support I, Pariah?

The "War Engine" EP is already recorded and in the process of being mixed! By supporting this campaign you will be pre-ordering the EP as well as have access to an early digital release! All money raised from the campaign will be treated as an "album purchase" with perks that are not otherwise available to friends, family, and the awesome fans! By supporting I, Pariah and this campaign you will be contributing to the production of the physical EP, as well as other awesome merchandise such as shirts, stickers, and draw string backpacks!

story:
Since 15 years musicians from all over the globe come together for the beautiful and very unique SUFI SOUL FESTIVAL in Kall , Germany at Osmanische Herberge.

Sufi Soul Festival 2017 is a completely non-profit Festival and all donations will go to cover the food of volunteers, renting equipment, travel tickets for the music bands and expenses of building the infrastructure etc

Please make the contribution whatever you can and spread the word for donations ...​so we can make the event even greater and support those standing for Peace ;)

story:
Thank you for visiting my IndieGoGo, and for considering contributing to "California"  !!!

 

What is "California?" 

The second full length record for indie singer/songwriter Mary Scholz, "California" will be the most organic, intimate release yet. 

  • Focusing on the intimate style of Mary's live performances, this record will keep Mary's voice and lyrics front and center, supported by a stripped down, live band.
  • Recording on an Ampex 8 track tape machine, the record will be co-produced by Los Angeles musician and producer, Jason Hiller. This method of recording is what helps keep it organic and personal.
  • With Mary on acoustic guitar and piano, the record will also feature superb musicians on upright bass, electric guitar, cello and percussion. 

Hi Everyone - thank you for taking the time to learn about the next Mary Scholz record! I am so excited to get into the studio and record what feels like the most honest version of my music yet. As many of you know, I have been touring and releasing records independently for 11 years now, sharing my own life battles through song, in hopes that we can all come together, knowing that we're not alone. My last record, The Girl You Thought You Knew, centered around the experiences dealing with my relocation, divorce, and making peace with being exactly who I am. 

California is the next chapter - recognizing that sometimes the best choices in life are the scary ones, and finding yourself able to make those choices. 
It's about stepping into the sunlight - knowing what you want, and moving towards it.

It's also about love, longing, and "what the hell did I get myself into??" 

 

The Most Important Collaborator: The Listener


Part of the perk of being an indie artist is having complete creative control over my material, (how it sounds, how it looks), and getting to collaborate with whomever I'd like, which helps me work towards my artistic goal.
But one of my most important collaborators is the listener.  
You're the reason this music reaches an audience, instead of collecting dust in my lyric book. 
Your random messages when you have a special connection to a song is what keeps me putting my personal experiences out in the world. 
You are the driving force that keeps me going when the DIY solo artist world gets tough and the road gets weary. 

I'm so excited to share this next chapter with you, but in order for this album to come to life, I need your help! I've saved money to make this record, but as one indie artist with no label backing, it would take quite a while to save enough.

So let's collaborate:

  • I'm aiming to raise $10,000 to cover studio costs, producer fees, tape fees and mastering. 
    You can help here by simply pre-ordering the record, either digital or physical. You can also purchase items like the current Mary Scholz catalog, posters, handwritten lyrics, t-shirts, house concerts, Skype voice lessons, etc.
    Every. Dollar. Counts. 
  • I'll be covering pre-production costs, musicians' salaries, instrument rental, artwork, photography, physical pressing (cd and vinyl!), distribution costs, promotion, PR, booking, travel, etc.
    (The list goes on!)
  • If we don't reach the entire goal, the money still goes toward creating the record.
    It just means that the end result will be delayed, as I'll be continuing to work and save to finish the record and book a release tour.

The Impact

Your contribution to this project means so much to my creativity - but also to my health:

  • In 2013 I was working 5 different jobs and in the studio overnight to make TGYTYK (alongside regular life costs) happen. It cost me $18,000 to make, 5 of which was raised right here. (Thank you!!)
    Those kinds of hours left me with very little sleep, migraines and various bouts of sickness during production. 
  • I'll still be working full time through this process, but raising this dollar amount will give me the ability to stay focused on the creativity, and (fingers crossed) healthy throughout the production.
  • I could never have completed TGYTYK without you all - and I am so grateful for your continued Love and support.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you just can't contribute,  doesn't mean you can't help:

  • It's all about noise, folks! Help me make some, by sharing on social media, in email to friends, or via word of mouth! Being an indie artist is all about the grassroots, word-of-mouth promotion. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You, Thank You, Thank You, Thank You, Thank You!!!

I could never have completed TGYTYK without you all - and I am so grateful for your continued Love and support.
