Just because you just can't contribute,  doesn't mean you can't help:

It's all about noise, folks! Help me make some, by sharing on social media, in email to friends, or via word of mouth! Being an indie artist is all about the grassroots, word-of-mouth promotion. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You, Thank You, Thank You, Thank You, Thank You!!!

story:
WHO AM I / WHO ARE WE?

My name is Conrad, bandleader of The Big Butter Jazz Band, a L.A.-based Traditional Jazz band dedicated to playing classic jazz songs from the 1900's-1930's (and a few from the '40's). We've been playing around Los Angeles since 2013 at bars, restaurants, swing dances, festivals, and more.

Two years ago, I left my corporate job to pursue music and martial arts, the two passions of my life. It's been challenging, hustling for every gig, trying to make a living. For the most part, it's a one-man show behind the scenes. I do 98% of the booking, hiring, promotion, web design, and social media. And that's on top of practicing and actually playing music! 

 

WHY NOW?

After 3 years, it was time to record a CD and showcase some of the amazing musicians that the BBJB features. For you guys, it's a chance to enjoy our music when you want, outside of our shows.  Playing live is still our favorite, but having a CD is a crucial step in our development - with a CD we can better promote ourselves, plus we get to give you something you can take home.  And with the first one out of the way,  we can start planning the second one!

 

What can you get, and how much help are we looking for?

What you are funding is a CD of 11 trad jazz tunes featuring some of the top players in LA.

You can preview three of the tracks here: https://soundcloud.com/user-20560466

On the CD are:

  • Corey Gemme (Clarinet & Trombone)
  • Barbara Laronga (Trumpet)
  • CJ Sams (Sousaphone)
  • Adam Levy (Bass)
  • Mark San Filippo (Drums)
  • Elizabeth Goodfellow (Drums) 

 These folks have played with some of the best around the country and the world.

Raising $4000 would be incredible and would cover the costs.  If you've enjoyed our music, danced to it, or just like us as people, here's your chance to help us out!

Approximate rundown of costs:

  • Studio time (25+ hours of recording, editing, mixing, mastering):  $1400
  • Musician pay: $800
  • Manufacturing: $950
  • Physical & Digital Licensing (6 songs): $600
  • Shipping of Rewards: $100

TOTAL: $3850

 

PERKS

Donations can be in any amount, but perks begin at only $10! The donation brackets are set up to be more like pre-orders of the CD.  After all, that's what this campaign is for, ordering the CD.  Some levels will include the JC Jazz Crew CD  (Justin Au, Chloe Feoranzo, me, Corey Gemme, and Katie Cavera) and the only other thing I can offer, which martial arts / self-defense lessons .

These lessons are 70 minutes long and can be private or small group (up to 3 people).  Choose from:

  • Filipino Martial Arts (most known for its use of weapons)
  • Silat (from Indonesia, Philippines, Brunei, Malaysia, as seen in "The Raid")
  • Capoeira (great for cardio, fitness, flexibility, and ground movement)
  • Boxing (great for cardio, fitness, footwork, reflexes)
  • Kickboxing (great for cardio, fitness, footwork, reflexes, flexibility)
  • Self-Defense tactics & concepts (both physical and mental)

You must be in the LA area or be willing to wait until I am in your area.  I have 26 years experience in Martial Arts and 20 years of teaching, and have taught everyone from absolute beginners to seasoned practitioners, so it will be fun and informative.

  • $10 - Big Butter Jazz Band album digital download
  • $15 - Big Butter Jazz Band physical CD
  • $20 - BBJB + JC Jazz Crew  digital downloads
  • $30 - BBJB + JC Jazz Crew physical CD's
  • $70 - BBJB download + 70min private or group lesson
  • $80 - BBJB + JCJC downloads + 70min private or group lesson 
  • $85 - BBJB CD + 70min private or group lesson 
  • $90 - BBJB + JCJC CD's + 70min private or group lesson.

Hope these sound interesting! The CD is in post-production, so whatever donation you choose will help offset the costs, even if I don't hit my goal!

 

NOT FOR YOU?

Maybe you don't really know me or the players in the band.  Maybe you're not into jazz or martial arts. That's totally cool!

 But maybe you know someone who is - and you can still help by passing on this campaign or spreading the word.  I'd totally appreciate it!

Thanks again for reading through this, any support you decide to give is greatly appreciated!

 

THE SONGS:

  • HINDUSTAN (1918, O.Wallace, H.Weeks)
  • MY HONEY’S LOVIN ARMS (1922, J.Meyer)
  • SQUEEZE ME (1925, C.Williams, T.Waller)
  • UNDECIDED (1934, C.Shavers)
  • SWEET LOTUS BLOSSOM (1935, S.Coslow, A.Johnston)
  • ROYAL GARDEN BLUES (1919, C.Williams, S.Williams)
  • JUST A GIGOLO (1929, L.Cassuci, J.Brammer )
  • BIG BUTTER & EGG MAN (1926, P.Venable)
  • THE BLUES MY NAUGHTY SWEETIE GIVES TO ME (1919, C.McCarron, C.Morgan, A.Swanstone)
  • I CAN’T BELIEVE YOU’RE IN LOVE WITH ME (1926, C.Gaskill, J.McHugh)
  • SOMEDAY SWEETHEART (1919, J.Spikes, R.Spikes)

Boxing (great for cardio, fitness, footwork, reflexes)

Self-Defense tactics & concepts (both physical and mental)

You must be in the LA area or be willing to wait until I am in your area.  I have 26 years experience in Martial Arts and 20 years of teaching, and have taught everyone from absolute beginners to seasoned practitioners, so it will be fun and informative.

$10 - Big Butter Jazz Band album digital download
$15 - Big Butter Jazz Band physical CD
$20 - BBJB + JC Jazz Crew  digital downloads
$30 - BBJB + JC Jazz Crew physical CD's
$70 - BBJB download + 70min private or group lesson
$80 - BBJB + JCJC downloads + 70min private or group lesson 
$85 - BBJB CD + 70min private or group lesson 
$90 - BBJB + JCJC CD's + 70min private or group lesson.

Hope these sound interesting! The CD is in post-production, so whatever donation you choose will help offset the costs, even if I don't hit my goal!
 
NOT FOR YOU?

Maybe you don't really know me or the players in the band.  Maybe you're not into jazz or martial arts. That's totally cool!
 But maybe you know someone who is - and you can still help by passing on this campaign or spreading the word.  I'd totally appreciate it!
Thanks again for reading through this, any support you decide to give is greatly appreciated!
 
THE SONGS:

HINDUSTAN (1918, O.Wallace, H.Weeks)
MY HONEY’S LOVIN ARMS (1922, J.Meyer)
SQUEEZE ME (1925, C.Williams, T.Waller)
UNDECIDED (1934, C.Shavers)
SWEET LOTUS BLOSSOM (1935, S.Coslow, A.Johnston)
ROYAL GARDEN BLUES (1919, C.Williams, S.Williams)
JUST A GIGOLO (1929, L.Cassuci, J.Brammer )
BIG BUTTER & EGG MAN (1926, P.Venable)
THE BLUES MY NAUGHTY SWEETIE GIVES TO ME (1919, C.McCarron, C.Morgan, A.Swanstone)
I CAN’T BELIEVE YOU’RE IN LOVE WITH ME (1926, C.Gaskill, J.McHugh)
SOMEDAY SWEETHEART (1919, J.Spikes, R.Spikes)

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello! Welcome to my IndieGoGo page! I am an 18 year-old college student with a lifelong dream of a career in music as a singer and songwriter! I began writing songs at the age of 8, and I have since dreamed of going to Nashville to record my first EP (6 songs)! Now that I finally have the chance and opportunity to do so, I would love your help! 
  • This campaign will help me make the best possible recording of the songs I've poured my heart into creating the past 18 months. I hope to work with the amazing producers and musicians in Nashville and believe your support will be the main reason I can.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I want to raise $15,000 which goes toward travel, studio time, mixing and mastering the end recordings, and marketing and promotions including an actual physical CD as well as online downloadable versions of the EP (6 songs). 

The Impact

  • The music industry is full of successful artists who seem to be featured over and over again on radio. I want to break through as a new artist you'll hear on the radio too and this EP (6 songs) is a big part of that process.
  • My first single, "Broken" has received over 20,000 views on YouTube so far, and has received several awards already. I really think that recognition has helped me make valuable industry connections that will only be a great foundation and have the momentum needed to create this new EP (6 songs).
  • Music has been in my family for generations! I have been singing for as long as I can remember! Both of my parents grew up in very musical homes. My dad, Richey Gibbons, was on his way to fulfilling his dream as a rock star when he was diagnosed with a brain tumor. He passed away five days before I was born. My mom named me "Anna Richey" so that I would always have a piece of him with me at all times. When it came time to choose a stage name, I wanted to use his name, Richey, to carry on his legacy and dream as I pursue a full-time career in the music industry.

Risks & Challenges

  • More than the music itself, your support is your belief in me as a person and artist. There are thousands of artists struggling to find their way and every one of them need financial resources to do what they are passionate to do. This is a risky project, but it's also the best way for me to present myself as a serious artist. I'm excited for this challenge and so thankful for your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I have a great social media following of fans already and I'm just getting started. If you can support me with just even $25, it will make a huge difference.
  • It would seriously help to have you share the link to this fundraiser on your social media as well. Whether it's Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or whatever, sharing this link would help me so much.

story:
All-New Pop/Rock Original Music!

Hi! We're Black Tie Stereo (Stephen, George, Aaron, and Jesse)! We're from Scranton, Pennsylvania (like The Office) and we play Pop/Rock tunes (like OneRepublic, Imagine Dragons, Walk the Moon, The Killers, Maroon 5).

You may know us or hear about us if you're from our area. We are honored to have been named Northeast Pennsylvania's Best Pop/Top 40 Act of 2016, and to have opened up for national acts such as Weezer, Panic! At the Disco, Steve Miller, and more.  But you may only know that we've done these things as a cover band, or one that doesn't write their own material.

We are actually primarily an original band. We have released a self-titled EP (Extended Play) of five songs and two singles over the past two years, all recorded with great people at great studios in our area. With your help on this project, we will add an additional five (or more) songs to our recorded library, professionally recorded in Los Angeles with producer Mark Mazzetti, who has similarly worked with artists that are household names (John Mayer, Janet Jackson, Sting, and more).

 

Why Do We Want This?

This is HUGE for us.  Simply put: creating a project with an established music industry professional in Los Angeles dramatically increases our appeal to large record companies. This could mean making music our full-time career; hearing our songs on major radio stations around the country, going from packing bars in Scranton to filling concert venues everywhere, and fulfilling each of our individual and collective dreams of becoming successful in the music industry.  And it all starts with this 5-song EP, which all starts with YOU.

 

You Will Be Rewarded!

Of course, this isn't by any means cheap.  The $25,000 we are hoping to raise covers Production Cost, Producer Fees, Recording Cost, and goes towards housing, food, gas (yes, we are driving from Pennsylvania to Southern California!), and possible necessary equipment rentals.

But we won't let your donation go without thanks! In order to thank you for your donation, we've set up perk packages at certain donation levels.  These include all of our existing merchandise, signed copies of the eventual new release, private performances, your name on the EP liner notes, and your own A&R (talent-seeking and artist development) session with Mark Mazzetti!

 

What Happens If We Don't Raise All That $$$?

We're viewing this as a platform to our one really big shot at success.  The project will happen, however much money we raise through Indiegogo.  The more money we raise through your generosity and support, the easier this will be for us. Thank you, as always, for whatever amount you can give!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now, that's fine! ANY type of support helps - including sharing this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. to get the word out, and even coming to see our shows! Please feel free to listen to our current music on iTunes, Spotify, SoundCloud, and Amazon Music.  If you like what you hear so far, it will only get better, we promise!

Thanks SO much for checking us out, and we'll see you on the West Coast!

Stephen, George, Aaron, and Jesse

Black Tie Stereo

 

Special thanks to Carlo Acerra for the video!

story:
Hello!

I'm so glad you've made it to this page!

Music and Judaism are the crux of my existence, so this debut project is incredibly important to me. I want to release an EP of 4 songs of my original Jewish music. My style ranges anywhere from acoustic melodic to folk to R&B. I listen to a myriad of genres, and that can be seen in what I write. I will be recording in Los Angeles, CA with the amazing Josh Goldberg in mid-August.

Keep reading to learn more about this exciting project!

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $10,000. Recording is expensive and time consuming, and in order to properly compensate everyone involved and get a great final outcome, $10,000 is my target. 
    • About $3000 will go to production costs
    • About $2000 will go to studio fees
    • About $2000 will go to mixing and editing fees
    • About $1200 will go to musician fees
    • All remaining will go towards getting the EP on streaming sites, physical CDs, photography, marketing, Indiegogo fees, etc.
  • Depending on how much you donate to this campaign, there will be perks! See the right side of this page for more information!
  • If I don't reach my full goal, we will record anywhere from 1-3 singles depending on how much is raised.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Support by:

  • Sharing the link to this campaign on social media
  • Liking my Facebook page and checking out my Music Monday posts every week

story:
Imagine a place where Stars are Born

  • A Music & Film venue built from Pure Salvage without curfews, limitations, and in the midst of 18,000,000 people who could join us to celebrate and support all the ways we can work together to Save and improve the World.  Lots of room to camp overnight for multi-day events that would enable the positive energy of people to get their works out through concerts and premiers out doors where thousands could assemble without an army of city police, huge expenses, and allow the freedom for people to speak out as we did in the days of Woodstock.  We have wars to stop, injustice to make right, and need the music and film venue capable of letting that dialogue happen once more.  Imagine the 12' x 40' stage on the back with that door above that leads to the recording studio.

  • Not only will this grow the Pure Salvage Living Renaissance by proving we can finish building it all out of Salvage, in the Tiny Texas Houses tradition, but it will also create a market where we can barter our goods, music, crafts, and films to a public that is craving change from the status quo.  Freedom to create solutions, share them, and inspire others with festivals that are focused on Organic paths to Empowerment of the people can only be found outside the big cities where the bureaucracy can not limit or control us.  That is exactly what I have to offer and have nearly finished.  

    This fund is simply to top it off and let everyone know it is here, that you can book concerts, premiers, and market days for all think ecological, anti-war, and freedom of the people oriented.  Decades ago we had drive in theaters and this will give us a giant one where film festivals can run all night long.  Concerts can run for days on end with camping and RV spaces, Tiny Texas Houses to stay in, and extremely limited Authoritarian presence.  We are outside any city limits, so the possibilities are nearly endless.  Imagine this space filled in with people, and it goes much further back behind where this shot is taken.   

  • Contributors will be part of creating a legendary venue site that will be so creatively built, so incredibly low priced, and accessible to all right along Interstate 10 in the Heart of Texas where Austin, San Antonio, and Houston will be just a short drive away.  From here we can hold festivals and events as well as Barter markets for all things salvaged from the past, grown organically, created in America, and designed to make it possible to sing the songs and show the masses how we can wipe out the age of consumerism, Big Pharma, Big Oil, Insane Wars, and Global Corporations that are destroying our planet.  

No where in Texas is there a place where we can gather together the masses that will be possible here in order to hold events to buy, sell, barter, and trade antiques, music, organic food, and all the salvage parts it takes to build Tiny Houses or bigger.  Events from giant weddings, bike and car rallies, solar, wind, and 0-point energy shows, preppers gatherings, Steampunk festivals, and so much more.  Promoters will get the venue nearly for free if the cause is right, and thus the cost to the public will be lower than possible in any city on the planet.  Very limited police force even able to come on the property so the freedoms we will have are unlike in the big cities that make a fortune off from hauling cars away, busting people for all the wrong reasons, and charging amazing fees for the use of public parks.  

What We Need & What You Get

As you can see from the pictures... it is already nearly built...(photoblog with more shots) the land is already in hand... utilities and even the materials to build much more is in stock.. so that those who want to come and be part can.  In return for contributing,  or volunteering people can get most of the materials they need to build market spaces,  book events, and get involved with establishing the schedules of regular festivals, rallies, concerts, markets, and other great ideas for the use of this venue in the years to come.

  • The restaurant for concessions, cooking up the brownies, cookies, muffins, and popcorn, as well as serving cold drinks, and so much more is nearly completed already.  More refrigeration is needed and some finish out of the second story decks that will let people sit and view the Texas scenery for miles around while they eat, drink, and find happiness outside the city.  This will cost $10,000 to $15,000 to finish, depending on how much refrigeration we buy and help we get on finishing the decks.  


  • The recording studio for audio and video production behind the stage on the back of the building is also nearly finished so that visiting groups can set up in a quiet peaceful space and create masterpieces.  A few thousand will take care of that.  Here is the entrance and shots of the inside of the quiet studio space.

  • We have spaces inside for gatherings, that still need some flooring and ceilings which the materials are in stock for, but some of the labor has to be taken care of adding a couple of grand.  We  even some 3rd story space for 1,000 sf of  guest dorms if we get extra money.

  • The bigger contributors will get to book Music Concert, Film Festivals, and events of other sorts dates as rewards for $1,000 or larger contributions.  We will create a Drive-in Venue using vintage beams cut to let cars drive up on, park, and  create the classic pitch of the old drive in theaters, then use FM transmitters to reach the cars with great sounds.  The projector and FM transmitter will be the biggest cost but a few grand should do it, or better yet a donation by a corporation wanting to prove their product and a giant canvas or Highway billboard sign reversed to show the movies on.  We will offer free tickets to the concerts and events for the $50+ contributors as well as free parking.  

    The people who want Market spaces will get all the materials for a 10' x 20' space for $2,000 contributions, including roofing metal, Cobalt clay tile for roofs, doors, windows, and posts needed to build weatherproof digs, and their prime location spaces for events at no cost for a year.   This is a view of some of the materials ready to go and one of the buildings for the market on the frontage.
  • All the money raised will go to completing and opening up Salvagefaire for the public to have a venue where thousands can meet for weekday or weekend bookings.  We already have camping spaces for tents, RV spaces, and if we get more than our target we will add more along with bath houses for over night guests too.  We also have Tiny Texas Houses to stay in by the ponds.  


    We have the materials in place to do it all, and other great projects like covered and screened campsites, but the labor is a cost factor unless volunteers show up.  Those who come to help will be able to barter time for materials or free use of the camp houses they help build.  The more we get, the more incredible we will build out the facility so that it will be able to grow into the biggest and best space for concerts and film festivals in Texas.  
  • Most of the profits from Salvagefaire events will be going toward creating the 30 Building Plans and Space Magic with Pure Salvage Book to show others how to build Tiny Texas Houses or manifest other toxin free dream homes sustainably out of 95% Pure Salvage.  The big picture is to promote the Pure Salvage Living Renaissance so that people can grow this concept in places far from Texas and keep moving forward with sharing how to empower the people without government and big corporations controlling the narrative.   

Having a positive Impact on millions is possible.

You can actually help create a forum for change in this challenge to activists and people concerned enough to write music, make films, and do all they can with their energy of soul to change the world into a better place.  

  • Once upon a time it was possible for musicians to be heard by large crowds as they sang about stopping the War, helping Farmers, and social reforms we needed to make in America.  Now most venues are controlled by the very people we were protesting about so the chance to get a film onto the big screens that threatens the status quo is nearly impossible.  Lets change that. 
  • Musicians singing about change like Joan Baez, Dylan, Crosby, Stills, &Nash, the Byrds, and so many others can be heard again if the festivals are open and they do not cost them anything to come and perform.  This is the chance for you to help make that to happen again as well as come to see it for free.
  • Tiny Texas Houses has proven to the world we can build incredible sustainably built energy efficient houses out of 95% Pure Salvage that are toxin free and now it is time to take it to the next level.  

    By creating the markets for people to get the parts and pieces, even through barter rather than cash, we will open up a new door to the empowerment of the people.  The music and film festival venue will enable us to fund the further growth of Salvagefaire, as well as the book and building plans projects using profits from concessions and parking.  That way we can sponsor events that our followers feel are important.
  • You can put your investment toward making events happen from opening the door to a Battles of the Girl Bands, seeing great plays up on the stage, or spiritual and political speakers addressing the public from the Island of Free Thought (a second stage at the center of a moat).  You can co-create great events, rallies, fund raisers, and so much more by helping launch a venue dedicated to nurturing the change you want to see in the world by helping manifest a place that will provide the impetus and forum. 

Risks & Challenges

I have spent the last 9 years working toward proving the many things that are possible which others thought I was crazy to even try.  I have proven we can build incredible houses from what others thought was trash and I call salvage.  Now I am determined to finish manifesting the venue it will take to give attention to causes which will help cure global issues by helping get the music and films that I believe can  convince people to be the change by seeing how great the support and numbers are for these great causes.

  • I have done what others believes was impossible in the past, from fixing up blighted neighborhoods in Austin in the 80's-90's, growing the largest architectural Antiques store in the USA from the 90's-2005, and then creating Tiny Texas Houses to prove sustainable toxin free houses could be built from 95% salvage and getting recognition for it from around the world.  I have gathered the materials, land, and knowledge to make this next big dream materialize and I believe it can happen too.  The biggest challenge is to get the public to join me in manifesting a venue where we can gather in numbers, and through giving attention to our goals, music, films, and issues, grow the future we want to manifest with a legendary venue that will resonate and broadcast events around the world using the internet.
  • I have people coming from all around the country to help make this possible.  It demands more than just my ability and talents alone for I am not a musician, a film maker, a concert promoter, or internet whiz, but those who are seem to be are stepping up and I believe I can provide the venue for them to all join together.  I have gathered the materials, the land, the buildings, the houses, (see blog with pictures of it all http://puresalvageliving.com/new-plan-for-music-film-festival-venue-one-door-closes-and-another-one-opens/) and the the last part to make it a reality is just a little more money.  
  • The biggest challenges left are now possible to overcome thanks to the spirit of these people who are willing to come play the music, share their films, produce, and get it out on the internet, that now make it possible to materialize a presence that will be heard and seen around the world.  I am now challenged by convincing you and others to support this effort, but I am positive we can  accomplish another miracle and do what others again thought was impossible when I started with your assistance now. 

You can help in many ways, not just by giving $

Spreading the word to your friends that are musicians, film makers, artists, craftspeople, organic growers, car collectors, bikers, Steampunkers, preppers, salvage hunters, environmentalists, and many others who want access to venues and can not find them affordably.  Here is the chance to book a concert for a grand and they may want to join together to make that happen.

  • Tell the people who want a great place to plan a giant wedding, family reunion, and other events, even Earth Friendly corporate events, SXSW side shows that cost a fortune in the city but not here, and more because they may want to contribute to make this available when they need it one day too.
  • Use the many tools available to share, from Indiegogo to Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other social platforms to help get the word out so that we can create something together unlike anything before where activists, artists, and the strangest of us can gather in unity to make the impossible a weekly event.

Steampunk festivals, and so much more.  Promoters will get the venue nearly for free if the cause is right, and thus the cost to the public will be lower than possible in any city on the planet.  Very limited police force even able to come on the property so the freedoms we will have are unlike in the big cities that make a fortune off from hauling cars away, busting people for all the wrong reasons, and charging amazing fees for the use of public parks.     What We Need & What You Get As you can see from the pictures... it is already nearly built...(photoblog with more shots) the land is already in hand... utilities and even the materials to build much more is in stock.. so that those who want to come and be part can.  In return for contributing,  or volunteering people can get most of the materials they need to build market spaces,  book events, and get involved with establishing the schedules of regular festivals, rallies, concerts, markets, and other great ideas for the use of this venue in the years to come.  The restaurant for concessions, cooking up the brownies, cookies, muffins, and popcorn, as well as serving cold drinks, and so much more is nearly completed already.  More refrigeration is needed and some finish out of the second story decks that will let people sit and view the Texas scenery for miles around while they eat, drink, and find happiness outside the city.  This will cost $10,000 to $15,000 to finish, depending on how much refrigeration we buy and help we get on finishing the decks.  



The recording studio for audio and video production behind the stage on the back of the building is also nearly finished so that visiting groups can set up in a quiet peaceful space and create masterpieces.  A few thousand will take care of that.  Here is the entrance and shots of the inside of the quiet studio space.


We have spaces inside for gatherings, that still need some flooring and ceilings which the materials are in stock for, but some of the labor has to be taken care of adding a couple of grand.  We  even some 3rd story space for 1,000 sf of  guest dorms if we get extra money.
 The bigger contributors will get to book Music Concert, Film Festivals, and events of other sorts dates as rewards for $1,000 or larger contributions.  We will create a Drive-in Venue using vintage beams cut to let cars drive up on, park, and  create the classic pitch of the old drive in theaters, then use FM transmitters to reach the cars with great sounds.  The projector and FM transmitter will be the biggest cost but a few grand should do it, or better yet a donation by a corporation wanting to prove their product and a giant canvas or Highway billboard sign reversed to show the movies on.  We will offer free tickets to the concerts and events for the $50+ contributors as well as free parking.  The people who want Market spaces will get all the materials for a 10' x 20' space for $2,000 contributions, including roofing metal, Cobalt clay tile for roofs, doors, windows, and posts needed to build weatherproof digs, and their prime location spaces for events at no cost for a year.   This is a view of some of the materials ready to go and one of the buildings for the market on the frontage. All the money raised will go to completing and opening up Salvagefaire for the public to have a venue where thousands can meet for weekday or weekend bookings.  We already have camping spaces for tents, RV spaces, and if we get more than our target we will add more along with bath houses for over night guests too.  We also have Tiny Texas Houses to stay in by the ponds.  
We have the materials in place to do it all, and other great projects like covered and screened campsites, but the labor is a cost factor unless volunteers show up.  Those who come to help will be able to barter time for materials or free use of the camp houses they help build.  The more we get, the more incredible we will build out the facility so that it will be able to grow into the biggest and best space for concerts and film festivals in Texas.  
Most of the profits from Salvagefaire events will be going toward creating the 30 Building Plans and Space Magic with Pure Salvage Book to show others how to build Tiny Texas Houses or manifest other toxin free dream homes sustainably out of 95% Pure Salvage.  The big picture is to promote the Pure Salvage Living Renaissance so that people can grow this concept in places far from Texas and keep moving forward with sharing how to empower the people without government and big corporations controlling the narrative.       Having a positive Impact on millions is possible. You can actually help create a forum for change in this challenge to activists and people concerned enough to write music, make films, and do all they can with their energy of soul to change the world into a better place.    Once upon a time it was possible for musicians to be heard by large crowds as they sang about stopping the War, helping Farmers, and social reforms we needed to make in America.  Now most venues are controlled by the very people we were protesting about so the chance to get a film onto the big screens that threatens the status quo is nearly impossible.  Lets change that. 
Musicians singing about change like Joan Baez, Dylan, Crosby, Stills, &Nash, the Byrds, and so many others can be heard again if the festivals are open and they do not cost them anything to come and perform.  This is the chance for you to help make that to happen again as well as come to see it for free. Tiny Texas Houses has proven to the world we can build incredible sustainably built energy efficient houses out of 95% Pure Salvage that are toxin free and now it is time to take it to the next level.  By creating the markets for people to get the parts and pieces, even through barter rather than cash, we will open up a new door to the empowerment of the people.  The music and film festival venue will enable us to fund the further growth of Salvagefaire, as well as the book and building plans projects using profits from concessions and parking.  That way we can sponsor events that our followers feel are important. You can put your investment toward making events happen from opening the door to a Battles of the Girl Bands, seeing great plays up on the stage, or spiritual and political speakers addressing the public from the Island of Free Thought (a second stage at the center of a moat).  You can co-create great events, rallies, fund raisers, and so much more by helping launch a venue dedicated to nurturing the change you want to see in the world by helping manifest a place that will provide the impetus and forum.     Risks & Challenges  I have spent the last 9 years working toward proving the many things that are possible which others thought I was crazy to even try.  I have proven we can build incredible houses from what others thought was trash and I call salvage.  Now I am determined to finish manifesting the venue it will take to give attention to causes which will help cure global issues by helping get the music and films that I believe can  convince people to be the change by seeing how great the support and numbers are for these great causes.  I have done what others believes was impossible in the past, from fixing up blighted neighborhoods in Austin in the 80's-90's, growing the largest architectural Antiques store in the USA from the 90's-2005, and then creating Tiny Texas Houses to prove sustainable toxin free houses could be built from 95% salvage and getting recognition for it from around the world.  I have gathered the materials, land, and knowledge to make this next big dream materialize and I believe it can happen too.  The biggest challenge is to get the public to join me in manifesting a venue where we can gather in numbers, and through giving attention to our goals, music, films, and issues, grow the future we want to manifest with a legendary venue that will resonate and broadcast events around the world using the internet. I have people coming from all around the country to help make this possible.  It demands more than just my ability and talents alone for I am not a musician, a film maker, a concert promoter, or internet whiz, but those who are seem to be are stepping up and I believe I can provide the venue for them to all join together.  I have gathered the materials, the land, the buildings, the houses, (see blog with pictures of it all http://puresalvageliving.com/new-plan-for-music-film-festival-venue-one-door-closes-and-another-one-opens/) and the the last part to make it a reality is just a little more money.  
The biggest challenges left are now possible to overcome thanks to the spirit of these people who are willing to come play the music, share their films, produce, and get it out on the internet, that now make it possible to materialize a presence that will be heard and seen around the world.  I am now challenged by convincing you and others to support this effort, but I am positive we can  accomplish another miracle and do what others again thought was impossible when I started with your assistance now.     You can help in many ways, not just by giving $ Spreading the word to your friends that are musicians, film makers, artists, craftspeople, organic growers, car collectors, bikers, Steampunkers, preppers, salvage hunters, environmentalists, and many others who want access to venues and can not find them affordably.  Here is the chance to book a concert for a grand and they may want to join together to make that happen.  Tell the people who want a great place to plan a giant wedding, family reunion, and other events, even Earth Friendly corporate events, SXSW side shows that cost a fortune in the city but not here, and more because they may want to contribute to make this available when they need it one day too. Use the many tools available to share, from Indiegogo to Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other social platforms to help get the word out so that we can create something together unlike anything before where activists, artists, and the strangest of us can gather in unity to make the impossible a weekly event.

story:
We're recording a series of vinyl 45’s, and we need your help!

Morning 40 Federation are – Josh Cohen, Ryan Scully, Bailey Smith, Steve Calandra, Mike Andrepont and Rick Hukill. In1998, we began writing, recording and touring the United States. We’ve played major U.S. festivals (SXSW, Voodoo, Jazz Fest, etc.) and have been interviewed and reviewed by NPR, Billboard, Spin, Maxim, CNN, The New York Times, and Playboy among others.  

Those of you who know us already know that a few years ago we went on hiatus (Alright! We broke up!) to reassess our place in the universe. After a couple of years, it told us to get back together and play. From the first rehearsal things began to click. You could say we've been experiencing a bit of a Morning Forty Renaissance, or as Scully likes to say, a "Fortyaissance". As new songs and ideas spew forth, releasing a traditional CD has lost its appeal. Our goal is to produce and record a series of 7 inch records that capture this resurgence, i.e., a fully realized piece of sonic art. In order to bring this to fruition, we need additional funding. Here's where you can help!

The Project

The project we’ve been working on is a set of four limited edition 7 inch vinyl singles (500 of each). Each record will have its own theme complete with front covers designed by New Orleans artists, colored vinyl based on the theme of the record, and an image on the back, that can only be viewed when all four back covers are put together. The music for one of the four records has already been recorded, having been produced by Galactic's own Ben Ellman, with Ani DiFranco on backup vocals. The two songs are called "From Conception" and "Wild White Tears." (You guess the theme and what the color of the vinyl will be.)

Why do we need your money?

We were able to pay for the first two recordings with a little help from a friend. Now we need help from our other friends and fans to bring it home. 

To complete this project, we need to raise an additional $16,000 to cover the expenses. As with the first recording, the next three will have reputable producers each chosen to fit the theme and sound of the record. Your funding will pay for those producers as well as studio time, record pressing, photography, and all of the miscellaneous expenses that come with such an undertaking. 

Perks

We have put together a few perks and incentives in the vein of other campaigns we’ve seen. However if there is nothing here that you want, or if you feel like you would like to contribute a different amount, you are not limited to the donation price points to the right. You may contribute any amount you are comfortable with at the top of the page, right above the large red “Contribute Now” button. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you contribute financially, we would really appreciate your help in spreading the word about our Indiegogo campaign. Please tell your friends about our campaign through Facebook, Twitter, and email! Do you know some people who love being part of projects like this? Do you know a billionaire who has a soft spot for a bunch of good-timing, New Orleans rabble-rousers? Please send it their way!

Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Morning-40-Federation

Thank you!

Above all, we want to thank you for reading this and considering our project. It’s because of all the amazing people like you that we are still recording today. From the bottom of our hearts, we truly appreciate you.
